About Us

CPA Australia is one of the world’s leading member service organisations, with over 163,000 members across 125 countries. Our core services to members include education, training, technical support and advocacy.

Our core services to members include education, training, technical support and advocacy. Employees and members work together with local and international bodies to represent the views and concerns of the profession to governments, regulators, industries, academia and the general public.

About the Role?

Reporting to the Manager – Business Intelligence, this role is responsible for; Using data and a deep understanding of the business to understand and communicate industry and business insights to increase profits and efficiency.

  • Define, develop and monitor the organisations key performance indicators
  • Partnering with the business to provide analytical insight for product and process performance information to stakeholders
  • Work with key business decision makers in leveraging information to enable better informed decisions
  • Assist users in how to leverage the BI environment to improve self-service capabilities
  • Leverage data and analytic skills/tools to advance business insights and opportunities
  • Provide modelling and forecasting capabilities as requested by key stakeholders
  • Act as a data steward to develop and oversee the implementation of initiatives which lead to increased data integrity
  • Lead and oversee the validation of business process improvements
  • Scan and retain external market information to compliment internal data and analysis
  • Build and augment BI and analytic skills in-line with technology changes and improvements

Please note we have contract and permanent options avaialable.

About You – You will have:

  • SQL querying skills
  • Knowledge and experience in using BI Tools and techniques
  • Advanced MS Excel, including use of PowerPivot, PowerQuery, Power BI, MS PowerPoint & Word
  • Excellent analytical skills and business acumen
  • Ability to synthesise structured and unstructured data and present sound recommendations based on analysis
  • Able to work in a team environment and individually

What’s in it for me?

At CPA Australia people are at the heart of what we do. We promote and encourage an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone can be their best.

  • Flexible working hours
  • Paid parental, volunteer and study leave
  • Annual incentive scheme
  • Discounts on health insurance, phone plans, fuel, banking and many more
  • Convenient Southbank location
  • Learning & Professional Development opportunities
  • Become part of a well-known global brand and make global connections within a collaborative environment

How do I Apply?

Click Apply Now to submit your application for this opportunity! Should you require more information on the role, feel free to contact the Recruitment Team on employment@cpaaustralia.com.au

To learn more about CPA Australia and other opportunities, please visit our Careers page at https://www.cpaaustralia.com.au/about-us/careers

The Opportunity

Financial Resources Management (FiRM) is responsible for managing the University's budgeting development and budget reporting processes. Providing quality advice and assistance across all budgeting, funds management and financial analysis.

We are currently seeking a professional Business and Process Analyst to join our Mulgrave team. The focus of this role will be to provide a range of analytical support including supporting the effective use, maintenance and improvement of the University budgeting and forecasting system. The role will also maintain records and oversee work flow and processes.

As the successful candidate, you will be responsible for providing a range of analytical support and administrative services, you will also need to undertake research and analysis to provide sound advice. This position will supporting business decisions around data analysis, will develop user friendly reports, and create presentations to stakeholders.

If you have a strong commitment to excellence in customer service, a demonstrated ability to work as an effective team member - with highly developed information technology skills, then we look forward to hearing from you.

If you believe you can fulfil these requirements, you are strongly encouraged to apply.

This role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.

At Monash University, we are committed to being a Child Safe organisation. Some positions at the University will require the incumbent to hold a valid Working with Children Check.

The successful applicant will need to possess a current valid Police Check.

Your application must address the selection criteria. Please refer to "How to apply for Monash Jobs".

Position Description

Business and Process Analyst

Closing Date

Friday 31 May 2019, 11:55 pm AEST

Supporting a diverse workforce

The Opportunity

  • Immerse Yourself in an Inclusive Culture
  • Use your Skills and Make an Impact on Data Innovation Outcomes!
  • Join CSIRO’s Data61, the Digital Innovation Arm of Australia’s Largest Science Agency, the CSIRO.

This position is with the Data-Driven Enterprises Group in the Analytics Program of Data61. The Group undertakes research and industry projects to support digitisation of government and private organisations to achieve better inference from large, complex datasets. The position will contribute to the Group’s goals by undertaking research into advanced statistical and machine learning methodologies to enhance the Group’s and Data61’s capabilities in these domains. In addition, the role will liaise and work with industry and the government to help improve their processing of large, complex datasets, and inference drawn from the data, so as to enhance business processes and decision making.

Your duties will include

  • Incorporating novel approaches to scientific investigations by adapting and/or developing original concepts and ideas for new, existing and further research.
  • Undertaking research into, and development of, advanced statistical and machine learning methodologies.
  • Communicating effectively and respectfully in the interests of good business practice, collaboration and enhancement of CSIRO’s reputation.
  • Producing high quality scientific and/or engineering papers suitable for publication in quality journals and for presentation at national and international conferences.
  • Working effectively as an integral member or leader of a multi-disciplinary, often regionally dispersed research team, to undertake independent scientific investigations and carry out/delegate associated tasks under broad guidance from more senior Research Scientists/Engineers.
  • Working collaboratively and honestly with internal and external colleagues, clients and partners to develop and progress challenging but realistic research plans for a range of research projects.

Location: Clayton, VIC (preferred), Docklands, VIC (negotiable)

Salary: AU$98k - AU$106k plus up to 15.4% superannuation

Tenure: Indefinite

Reference: 60967

To be successful you will need

  • A doctorate or equivalent research experience in a relevant discipline, such as statistics, mathematics or machine learning.
  • Demonstrable experience in the analysis of large, complex datasets using statistics and machine learning.
  • Theoretical and practical understanding of statistical and machine learning techniques e.g. Bayesian methods, MCMC, support vector machines, gradient boosting, or deep learning.
  • Experience with programming languages such as R and Python, statistical and machine learning tools such as Stan, XGboost, Tensorflow, Theano or Keras and fluent with git and SQL.
  • Proven ability working effectively as a member of a multi-disciplinary, regionally dispersed research team, and experienced in carrying-out independent individual research, to achieve organisational goals.
  • A record of scientific publications at respected peer-reviewed journals and conferences, and/or patent filings in Australia, Europe or the USA.

For details about who to contact and for more information please view the Position description


CSIRO’s Commitment to Diversity

We’re working hard to recruit diverse people and ensure all our people feel supported to do their best work and empowered to let their ideas flourish.

Flexible Working Arrangements

We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you. Balance

About CSIRO

At CSIRO you can be part of helping to solve big, complex problems that make a real difference to our future. We spark off each other, learn from each other, trust each other and collaborate to achieve more than we could individually in a supportive, rewarding, inclusive and truly flexible environment.


Who we are


CSIRO’s Data61 business unit is the largest data innovation group in Australia, bringing together approximately 600 research and development staff working in digital technologies to create benefit for Australia. Data61 develops Australia's future leaders with its strong 300+ PhD student program in collaboration with our best universities across Australia.

Description

ABOUT LANDERS

Lander & Rogers is a leading independent Australian law firm operating nationally from Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane. We are proud to be the trusted advisor to many publicly listed and private Australian companies, Australian subsidiaries of global companies as well as all levels of government.

We have nearly 500 staff nationally, seven broad areas of practice, and we cover a range of industry sectors, with a focus on financial services, insurance, government, infrastructure, real estate and retail and supply chain.

Our firm believes that legal services are much more than just the law - they are about great people, sustained excellence and exceptional client service. We have a reputation in the legal market as a provider of premium legal services, and as a sought-after employer. We are renowned in Australia for our down-to-earth and friendly workplace culture.

ABOUT THE ROLE

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Innovation Hub (iHub) team based in Melbourne. This role will suit an individual who is a self-starter and is highly proactive.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Work closely with members of the iHub and Finance teams to develop, extract and test complex reports from all systems, predominantly the practice management system (SQL database)
  • Undertake an audit of all SSRS reports currently run from the current practice management system and migrate to new SQL server
  • Working with data visualization tools to create user reporting stories
  • Experience in optimising dashboards with a focus on usability, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardisation
  • Work with iHub developers to maintain and enhance existing applications
  • Complement the firm's current and future innovation strategy through web-based application development

ABOUT YOU

The position would suit an enthusiastic Business Intelligence Analyst with experience in a similar role within a professional services environment. To be successful in the role, you will need to possess the following:

  • Expert knowledge of Power BI, including prior experience developing and dashboards as well as scheduling and distributing reports.
  • Expert knowledge of SQL, including the ability to develop report specifications and create and modify reports using SSRS 2008/2012.
  • Knowledge and experience developing in one or more of the following is desirable: C#, .Net Framework, .Net Core, ASP.NET, HTML, CSS, JavsScript, JQuery
  • Expert knowledge of Microsoft Office, Worksite
  • Ability to understand a client's reporting requirements and develop that into an easy to extract report that write reports from scratch and then test.
  • Understanding of and exposure to finance terminology.
  • Ability to identify skills and knowledge gaps and develop appropriate plans to transfer skills and knowledge.
  • Logical and analytical thinker, approachable, flexible and works well with others in a respectful, collegiate and collaborative manner.
  • Excellent organisational skills, demonstrated time management and strong organisational skills to work effectively in a multi-disciplinary and dynamic environment.
  • Role model for behaviours in line with the firm’s core values and culture.
  • Works well with others in a respectful, collegiate and collaborative manner.
  • Proven ability to communicate effectively (varying style as appropriate to meet the needs of the audience) by building awareness, trust, collaboration and support across the firm.

If you are interested in joining our Innovation Hub (iHub) team, please submit your CV by clicking the 'Apply' button.

For more information about Lander & Rogers please see our website, www.landers.com.au.

Job Description

Austin Health is the major provider of tertiary health services, health professional education and research across 3 campuses in the northeast of Melbourne and state-wide. Austin Health is world-renowned for its research and specialist work in cancer, liver transplantation, spinal cord injuries, neurology, endocrinology, mental health and rehabilitation.


An exciting opportunity currently exists for an enthusiastic Data Analyst to join the Neuroscience Molecular Imaging Research team in the Department of Molecular Imaging & Therapy.


Details of Department


The Austin Health Department of Molecular Imaging and Therapy has an active research team in the area of PET imaging in Dementia. It has extensive national and international links and performs both academic studies and scans to support therapy trials. It is the imaging co-ordination and image processing site for several national collaborative studies. The successful applicant will work with the dementia research team headed by Professor Christopher Rowe, Director of Molecular Imaging Research, to support the Acquisition, Archiving and Analysis of images required for the dementia research team. The dementia research group obtains or manages over 500 PET and MRI scans per year. The successful applicant will work with and be directly supervised by the senior computer scientist officer.


Details of position/position requirements


We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst who will provide support for data organization, reporting and analysis of the dementia PET research team studies under the direction of the computer sciences senior Officer. This includes system administration of the data management platform, for which software development or IT experience would be beneficial (in particular, python and other scripting), with other academic and commercial partners. The candidate will also work closely with world leading scientists in PET imaging for dementia and will be encouraged to get involved with the research and develop their own projects. Support will be provided to attend international conferences and to pursue higher academic qualifications such as a PhD.


To be successful in this role you must demonstrate:


  • A Bachelor or Master in Science/ Computing Science, Information Technology, and/or Physics and/or related Engineering specialty.

  • Proficiency in use of all OS (Linux, OS-X and Windows), python, R

  • Proficiency in Database development and maintenance

  • Basic statistical understanding

  • Attention to detail

Work with us! Your reward is to work in a collaborative environment which will provide you with opportunities for ongoing training and development. Your benefits will include salary packaging, and employee assistance program.


All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory National Police Check conducted by Austin Health and if required, a Working With Children Check.


Austin Health is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged.

The Role & Opportunity
,You will be working as a business analyst/data analyst within the ICT division of our major client and will be responsible to support the Data Completions processes associated with data entry into our PNI system Spatialnet.
,

,
Ideal candidate would have familiarity with PNI environments and are able to work through changes associated with systems and processes whilst working with multiple stakeholders.
,
Data Completions is responsible for entry of physical, logical and address data into the clients Spatial Net PNI system.
,
What's in it for you?
,
,
Interested? If you have the skills and motivation we are looking for, please Apply Now. For more information, please contact Sukanya Mukhopadhyay on 03 8319 7810 or via email Sukanya Mukhopadhyay @ igniteservices.com.

Agile Business Analyst

6months contract to permanent opportunity

  • IMMEDIATE START
  • Fast growing Fintech business
  • Autonomous and flexible culture
  • Work directly with CTO and Founders, collaborate on tech roadmap

CXi Software is a fast growing scaleup FinTech looking to grow their Business Analyst competency into a cohesive, high performing operation. For this they need a strong Agile Business Analyst to produce well groomed user stories.

Agile Business Analyst Responsibilities: 

  • Effectively elicit and validate concise requirements from stakeholders, translate into well groomed user stories and communicate to the diverse technical team
  • Act as the main conduit between and across multiple business and IT streams
  • Translate business needs into business design, integration and IT streams for BAU and project work Apply your strong relationship building skills through engagement with customers, colleagues and other key stakeholders
  • Strong consultative and collaborative approach
  • Facilitate workshops, discovery and story refinement session and positively influence solution development and ongoing support
  • Conduct option analysis to determine optimum IT and business process solutions
  • Focus on delivering value and inspiring the team to innovate
  • Work directly with customers and users to test value, interface designs and feedback from new releases
  • Seek opportunities to streamline processes (including support) to achieve better outcomes for customers and internal stakeholders

Agile Business Analyst Core Competencies:

  • Proven methods for eliciting requirements and documenting user stories in JIRA
  • Demonstrated understanding of the Agile methodologies. BDD, TDD, Scrum, Kanban
  • Demonstrated experience with BPMN, Visio
  • Excellence in verbal and written communication
  • Collaboration and composure
  • Flexibility
  • Technical capacity / IT fluency

Agile Business Analyst Qualifications:

  • Minimum bachelor’s degree in computer science or another relevant field
  • Agile certification preferred
  • 5+ years’ experience as a business analyst
  • Preferred JIRA portfolio experience
  • Proven background in Finance industry especially unit registry very favourable

The successful applicants will be a team player, possess well developed analytical and problem solving skills, strong communication, process mapping and documentation skills and will be self-reliant and able to work autonomously.

What's on offer?

The opportunity to get in on the ground at fast paced, exciting scaleup that has the potential to disrupt the Unit Registry industry and go global in a very short space of time. The right candidate will be encouraged to bring their best ideas, identify creative solutions, back themselves and their knowledge and have the opportunity to shape their career in whatever direction they want to explore.

-Growth sector of Superannuation - one of Australia's Award-Winning Super Funds
-Help shape the Fund's product innovation and service delivery
-Permanent role with excellent employee benefits

The Company 

The new phase of evolution for this Industry Super fund provides an exciting opportunity to develop and build capability around Data, BI and Analytics in a complex and changing landscape. 
  
Within the organisation there is strong sense of purpose, clear vision, pragmatic strategies and emotionally compelling goals that will inspire you to be part of their journey and envisioned future.  With a long-standing history in the Industry Fund sector and big aspirations for their future, they are the trusted partner working on behalf of some of the hardest working superannuants in Australia. 
  
What’s your Why? 
  
Is it to enhance your already accomplished career in business intelligence?
  
Is it to work in an environment that:
-leverages your expert technical skills
-recognises and values your input into strategy
-enables you to collaborate with senior leaders and truly partner with the business
-sets you for success to deliver meaningful outcomes that impact  

Is it to start at the beginning of a business intelligence journey again and prove that you can repeat your success, apply your learning and deliver in a new or different environment?

Is it to work with a Leader who inspires you to bring your best self to work everyday?
  
If any of the above resonates for you, and you consider yourself high performing BI talent, this role will afford you the opportunity to take your career to the next level.  There is scope, diversity and complexity that will keep you engaged and challenged. 
  
What will you be accountable for?

You will be shaping the direction for the Fund and driving organisational performance through deepened insights that enable informed product development and member service decisions, as well as developing more meaningful relationships with key stakeholders. 

You will be supporting leaders in influencing critical business decisions and you will contribute to the evolution and success of the Fund, now and in the future.
  
The Business Intelligence Analyst is an integral role and essential to the success of the Fund by providing data insights that enables effective decision-making to deliver on growth initiatives whilst continually adding value to member outcomes. This position provides both strategic and technical expertise to develop and manage the Business Intelligence (BI) solution and analytical capabilities including:

-Working across all areas of the Funds involved in business intelligence (Distribution, Technology, Marketing, Administration and Compliance) to develop and implement robust Business -Intelligence strategies and initiatives – translating business needs into technical specifications.
-Designing, building and deploying BI solutions within the business, utilising the available reporting tools.
-Creating and maintaining analysis models.
-Evaluating and improving existing BI systems and processes, including systems integration and data sources.
-Developing and executing database queries and conduct analysis.
-Creating visualisations, dashboards and reports to meet agreed business requirements and project initiatives.
-Conduct unit, data and system testing, audits, troubleshooting, and develop/maintain technical documentation.
-Providing and supporting appropriate training to business users.
-Monitoring market movements and developments to ensure the -Fund is continuing its future-fit approach and can proactively address any potential impacts on the Funds’ strategic objectives.
-Supporting your leader with reporting requirements and presentations to Board, Committees and the Executive Leadership team
  
What skills and experience must you have to be successful?
-A strong blend of technical skills, soft skills and business knowledge with domain expertise in Superannuation, or more broadly Financial Services.
-Demonstrated appreciation and understanding of the compliance regime relevant to an Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) regulated body.
-Excellent technical knowledge and proven experience in the following fields:
-BI Development
-Data integration, security, data model creation, reports, dashboards and KPIs
-Background in Data Warehouse design, with an in-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP), and ELT (extract, load, transform) framework
-Data visualisation and analysis
-BI technologies such as Microsoft Power BI (configuration and reports development)
-SQL queries (T-SQL), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), -DAX Programming, MDX (optional)
-Master Data Services development, administration and troubleshooting

Strong thinking capability to consider impacts when planning and executing business iniatiatives.

Outstanding ability to analyse and interpret information and data, interpret business needs and develop appropriate business and technical solutions that meet the needs and expectations of stakeholders.

Exceptional interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated expertise in technical report writing.

Strong consulting and influencing skills and ability to proactively engage with employees at all levels across the organisation.

Relevant tertiary qualifications (Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering, Econometrics, Finance or comparable field) are mandatory.

Reasons for joining our client
-There is a robust culture that is authentically lived by the Executive Leadership team.
-The Fund is in a really strong position and is initiating its growth plans. Now is an exciting time to join.
-Our client recognises that the best way to develop the Fund is to develop its people by helping them grow and enhance their potential.
-You will be joining an organisation with a people first mentality.Our client recognises the contribution of its employees and rewards their staff with a dedicated range of attractive benefits.  There is a genuine commitment to work/life balance.
-The Fund is undergoing a major transformation journey to modernise the Fund. You will play an integral role in shaping the future.
-Real tangible employee benefits and genuine work/life style balance.
 
Next Steps
  
Please “APPLY NOW” with your resume and covering letter (in Word format only).
  
You must have full rights to work in Australia to be considered for this opportunity.

Job Type: Full-time

Would you like to work in a dynamic and challenging environment where you will be supported to reach your potential? There are opportunities available for the role of State Business Analyst in Melbourne.

About the Role:


Working within the National Field environment, you will ensure that the accurate analysis of market performance is communicated to State Management. This analysis of statistical data and market information will support the monitoring, planning and development processes of the business in order to achieve sales & marketing objectives.

You will provide the State Management team with regular updates on progress against company targets and ensure all relevant data bases are maintained with the latest information. You will be a motivated, self-starter who strives to offer solutions and input on process improvements to maximise efficiency within the team, field force and across departments. There will also be an element of administrative support required in the day to day activities of the State Office that you will to support with.

About You:

You should ideally possess the following attributes:

  • Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel including defining & creating formula, macros and pivot tables as well as PowerPoint.
  • Strong analytical ability to proactively identify trends, issues and opportunities and translate these into insightful commercial stories and recommendations
  • Ability to effectively plan, organise and prioritise
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in addition to presentation skills
  • Resilience and initiative, with a ‘can do attitude


The Perks:

If you are successful, you will receive the following:

  • Competitive remuneration package including bonus
  • Above statutory superannuation
  • Company laptop and smart phone
  • Opportunities for regular Learning and Development training

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

Job Description

This Intelligence Analyst role has a focus on intelligence for counter terrorism. The role contributes by informing the decision making to enhance the quality of the forensic services and operational responses related to counter terrorism threats and incidents.

  • VPSG-4 range $84,019 - $95,392 p.a. + 9.5 % super + leave loading
  • 1 x Ongoing role available
  • Working within the Forensic Services Department, located at 31 Forensic Drive Macleod, VIC 3085

As the successful applicant, some of your duties will include:

  • Manage the collection, evaluation, collation, analysis and controlled dissemination of information and intelligence in support of Forensic services and operations, particularly those related to counter terrorism.
  • Make high quality recommendations in respect of the analysis of Forensic intelligence and related statistical data, identification and evaluation of emerging patterns and trends in crime, road policing and public order, particularly focussed on those matters relevant to counter terrorism..
  • Participate in the design, execution and writing of qualitative and quantitative research reports and intelligence products aimed at improving Forensic intelligence and the Department's contribution to front line policing.
  • Identify, assess and report on specific crime related and or other trends, or risks impacting Forensic operations, with a focus on counter terrorism driven analysis and trends.
  • Identify research and analyse patterns, trends, linked crime and make recommendations on developed Forensic intelligence to senior management and internal or external stakeholders and investigators.
  • Identify areas for improvement in Forensic intelligence gathering and analysis and make appropriate recommendations.
  • Liaise with and develop a good working relationship with potential sources of information from inside and outside Victoria Police in order to develop a holistic approach to Forensic intelligence.
  • Ongoing skill development in the use of Victoria Police Law Enforcement & Intelligence applications such as SAS, LEAP and Interpose.
  • Provide significant input toward the development of Forensic intelligence and present and contribute to high end briefings on Forensic intelligence issues, particularly those of relevance to counter terrorism, such as ballistics, explosives, CBR agents and the state of forensic data collections.
  • Proactively market and promote the role of Forensic intelligence to internal and external stakeholders through preparation and delivery of information sessions and also dissemination of Forensic intelligence publications.
  • Provide immediate and reactive intelligence support for incident response activities conducted by the Department.

Skills & experience:

To be successful, candidates will need skills in development of intelligence assessments and other products, as well as good communication and teamwork skills to aid in intelligence development and the force-wide response to critical incidents. The preferred candidate will hold relevant qualifications and have experience in providing intelligence services in a law enforcement setting. Strong capabilities in data analytics, statistics and use of contemporary IT analytics and visualisation tools would be highly regarded.

Requirements and relevant information:

  • Will be required to work as part of a collaborative team.
  • Will be required to obtain a national security clearance.
  • May be required to perform work out of hours and attend at scenes of crime or associated incident response centres.
  • Possess a current Victoria Driver's Licence and hold or qualify for a white Class Driver Authority within 3 months.
  • The successful candidate will be required to provide a DNA sample (buccal swab) for use in laboratory quality control procedures
  • May be required to work after hours.

Please see role statement and position description for further details and relevant information.

Your application must include:

  • Resume, and;
  • Completed application form - attached to the job advertisement.
  • Please note that applicants are not required to respond to each key selection criteria listed in the position description.

Applications close midnight, Sunday 19th May 2019 - No applications will be accepted via email.

For further information on this role please contact: Chris Bell (03) 9450-9779 or via email Chris.bell@police.vic.gov.au

To apply, please click on the ‘Apply Now' button and follow the instructions.

The Fair Work Ombudsman (FWO) is an independent statutory office established by the Fair Work Act 2009. Our role is to promote harmonious, productive and cooperative workplace relations and ensure compliance with Australian workplace laws.

We are seeking an exceptional candidate for the ongoing position of Analyst within our Intelligence Team operating within the Policy, Analysis, Intelligence & Reporting Branch.

The Intelligence Team undertake a range of functions including the provision of intelligence products that inform FWO’s strategic, investigative and operational initiatives, including:

  • Monitoring and assessment of information sources relevant to the intelligence function to identify potential trends or issues
  • Management of the intelligence database, including the external facing Anonymous Report tool
  • Engagement with stakeholders to share information, and maintain awareness of tactical analysis and target identification
  • Providing support and guidance to operational teams in the identification and planning of operational activities
  • Production of intelligence products to support decision making for future compliance activities
  • Proactive identification of operational priorities


The successful candidate will:

  • Work effectively under the support and general direction of Senior Analysts and within a team to contribute to the development, planning and production of intelligence outputs and outcomes for FWO.
  • Be a high achiever who will manage multiple tasks with competing priorities and proactively contribute to a positive, fast paced, dynamic team environment.
  • Be primarily responsible for the production of value-added Intelligence products following the evaluation and analysis of information collected across internal and external sources.
  • Have excellent written communication and liaison skills and personal drive.


Please note a baseline security clearance may be required.

The FWO provides a challenging and supportive work environment with access to great training and development opportunities and flexible working arrangements. You will be rewarded and recognised for your performance and have the satisfaction of knowing you work for an agency which aims to achieve fairness in Australian workplaces.

For further information about the Fair Work Ombudsman, please visit www.fairwork.gov.au.

Typical Duties

The primary duties of the APS5 Analyst – Intelligence Team include, but are not limited to:

  • Research, analysis, integration and evaluation of information for the formation of tailored intelligence products
  • Processing analytical results, extracting insights and presenting data in formats suitable for interpretation and meeting stakeholder needs
  • Preparation of narrative focused written briefing material and analytical reports with high attention to detail, supporting operational decision-making
  • Monitoring current emerging issues and trends in the workplace relations environment and internal data systems in alignment with the FWO strategic priorities
  • Development and assessment of Intelligence briefs to communicate emerging issues and evidence based concepts to stakeholders


Selection Criteria

  • Demonstrated ability to analyse and identify issues, patterns and understanding from information collected across various sources
  • Demonstrated ability to provide accurate, consistent, and timely advice to customers and stakeholders
  • High level written and verbal communication with the ability to analyse and prepare substantial submissions, complex recommendations and briefings
  • Excellent organisational skills including the ability to manage competing work priorities to meet tight deadlines.

Data Analyst - Registry Science and Research


Alfred Health

Alfred Health is a leader in health in health care delivery, improvement, research and education. We are the main provider of health services to people living in the inner southeast suburbs of Melbourne, from ambulatory, to inpatient and home and community based services.

  • 0.6 – 1 EFT
  • 12 month contract in the first instance
  • HS3
  • Based at 553 St Kilda Road
  • Be a part of the Monash and Alfred research program


THE ROLE

This position will be based in the Registry Science and Research Unit of the School of Public Health and Preventive Medicine, Monash University.

The data analyst will provide statistical support in the analysis and reporting of data from registries in an accurate and timely manner. Specific duties include providing statistical support to produce reports which are statistically sound, troubleshooting existing data analytics problems with registries, undertaking quality control audits of data/analysis and assisting in the conduct training courses and workshops around registry sciences. The person will work with a team of other data analysts under the supervision of the senior biostatistician. The team is also involved in collaborative research with the various registries as well as methodological research, including spatial models, methods of risk adjustment and longitudinal data analysis and there will be opportunities to contribute in those areas as well.


SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • A bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field with several years working experience, preferably in the field of public health, or a Master’s in Public Health degree or a Master’s degree in a related quantitative field.
  • High-level analysis skills; experience with Stata software is essential plus R program is desirable
  • Sound understanding of statistical principles
  • Good knowledge of healthcare data
  • Excellent written communication and verbal communication skills with proven ability to produce clear, succinct reports and documents
  • A demonstrated awareness of the principles of confidentiality, privacy and information handling
  • Capacity to work in a collegiate manner with other staff in the workplace

Any queries please call 9903 0112 or email arul.earnest@monash.edu


  • Access to Salary Packaging and Novated Leasing
  • Health and Wellbeing initiatives in addition to discounted health insurance
  • Great work/life balance


Alfred Health is an equal opportunity employer and committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged.


If you are interested in applying for this position, please visit the Alfred website for further details.

All enquiries to 9903 0112 or email arul.earnest@monash.edu

job_desc:
Trinity College is a vibrant, diverse community, inspiring and enabling students of exceptional promise from Australia and around the world in its various educational programs, including a Residential College, a Theological School and a Pathways School. Trinity offers a warm collegiate workplace set amongst the leafy environs and historic buildings of Melbourne University’s oldest college, founded in 1872.

Trinity College has recently developed a Strategic Plan which sets out a five-year road map that will position the College as a leading education institution within the Asia-Pacific region. Emerging from the Strategic Plan, the College has developed an Information and Communication (ICT) Strategic Plan. The ICT Strategic Plan sets out a three-year blueprint that will position the College’s ICT systems to support the current and future operations of the College.

We are seeking a Business Analyst to work alongside the IT department. The Business Analyst role is a key facilitator within the organisation providing business analyst services for the ICT strategic initiatives. This position will interpret business requirements and act as the conduit between stakeholders across the College and those technical initiatives

The successful candidate will have:

  • Experience working as a business analyst in a complex organisation or on large IT projects. (Experience in an academic or government environment preferable).
  • The ability to demonstrate a strong understanding of Software Development Life Cycle.
  • Experience in vendor management and participation in RFP’s (highly regarded).
  • An ability to absorb and evaluate information from a variety of sources and understand “the big picture”.
  • A high level of attention to detail and accuracy in documentation, data entry, and follow-up on processes.
  • Strong organisational and time management skills.
  • Well-developed computer literacy in Microsoft Office Applications, preferably in a Mac Environment, with the ability to learn new systems.

This is a full-time, fixed term contract of 6 months, with potential for extension.

Latitude Fintech is technology company focused on providing disruptive products and services in the financial industry.

Vanguard is a path-breaking and unique platform from Latitude fintech that combines end-to-end retail and SME financing function with a sophisticated inbuilt Automation tool that allows banks to implement the lending solution. The solution taps digital sources for information, has an integrated backstage, uses cognitive automation and self-learning models for credit underwriting.

We have multiple positions for Business Analysts

Responsibilities

To liaise with Clients for ensuring that features of platform can be implemented to satisfy business needs.

As the vital link between a firm’s information technology capabilities and its business objectives, the business analyst is expected to assist the implementation so as to contribute to the profitability of client.

The business analyst is expected to help the client implement technology solutions in a cost-effective way by determining the requirements of a project or program, and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and partners.

The business analyst should possess the required skills and experience to anticipate and extract information from the users. At the same time, he should be able to manage users from putting up personal preferences, etc.

To be able to organise the business needs of various stakeholders and move the development in a sequential manner.

Responsible for guiding the technical team through the requirements during the development and delivery of tangible consumer benefits through the Vanguard platform.

To analyse and help configure the platform offerings in such a way that they become differentiated for the client needs and to identify and manage the on-going rationalization of operations to ensure efficiency and effectiveness while operating on the Vanguard platform

To perform business needs analysis to assess the need for any requested changes as well as their potential impact regarding performance on the platform.

After the IT solution is delivered, post implementation after care support role is required, covering maintenance, or preventing and correcting defects; enhancements, or making changes to increase the value provided by the system etc.

Qualifications, Education, Experience and Skills

The Business Analyst must have at least a degree preferably in the Finance field. Additional qualifications from Banker’s Institutes etc will be valuable.

Minimum Banking experience of 5+ years in Identifying, investigating, and analysing business processes, procedures in developing functional specifications.

Work experience required for competency in this role needs experience in Vanguard platform offerings.

Identifying and evaluating inefficiencies and recommending optimal business practices, and system functionality and behaviour

Using project management methodologies, principles and techniques to develop project plans and to cost, resource and manage projects

The Australian Geospatial-Intelligence Organisation (AGO) is an intelligence agency in the Strategic Policy and Intelligence Group (SP&I) that provides services and advice to Defence and national customers. Its mandate is to provide geospatial intelligence (GEOINT) in support of Australia's defence and government decision-making, and to assist with the planning and conduct of Australian Defence Force operations.

Several vacancies exist within GEOINT Mission and Engagement, GEOINT Foundation and Support, and GEOINT Policy and Programs Branches.

GEOINT Mission and Engagement (GME) is a small, dynamic branch focussed on leading mission coordination and prioritisation, providing governance and a coordinated engagement capability to strengthen key international and domestic relationships and deliver timely and relevant GEOINT products and services. GME is seeking to fill the following positions:

Customer Engagement Officer

The Customer Relations and Production Support (CRPS) team is seeking a Customer Engagement Officer to work in a face-paced and highly motivated team responsible for engaging and coordinating AGO’s support to senior decision-makers across Government and with international partners.

In the CRPS team you will engage with a broad spectrum of customers and interpret their requirements to deliver GEOINT products in a timely manner.

The Customer Engagement Officer role requires the successful candidate to:

  • be customer-focused with experience in managing and engaging internal and external customers,
  • be a strong communicator with an eye for detail and experience in developing and applying standards,
  • possess exceptional time management skills with an ability to manage multiple tasks and deliver high-quality outcomes,
  • possess an ability to build and sustain effective relationships with team members, and contribute to team objectives, and
  • possess experience in, or an understanding of the importance of design and the visualisation of information to inform customers.

GEOINT Analyst – Australian Geospatial-Intelligence Operations Centre

The Australian Geospatial-Intelligence Operations Centre (AGOC) is seeking a GEOINT Analyst to join its team to deliver mission-driven GEOINT 24 hours a day; 7 days a week. In the AGOC you will be responsible for coordinating and delivering a broad range of topical and time-critical products to a broad range of customers and stakeholders, ranging from AGO analysts on deployment through to senior decision makers.

The AGOC GEOINT Analyst role requires the successful candidate to:

  • possess an ability to research and analyse complex issues,
  • be a strong communicator with an ability to quickly produce intelligence reports,
  • possess exceptional time management skills with an ability to manage multiple tasks and deliver high-quality outcomes, and
  • possess an ability to build and sustain effective relationships with team members, and contribute to team objectives.

The AGOC GEOINT Analyst role works as part of a rotating shift and the successful candidate will be entitled to generous shift penalties as outlined in the Defence Enterprise Agreement.

External Engagement Officer

The External Engagement directorate is seeking an External Engagement Officer to work in a small team to build AGO’s capability and resilience through strengthening its external relationships.

In the External Engagement team you will contribute to the management of AGO’s bilateral and multilateral relationships, and drive the strategic direction for partnerships internationally, domestically, and across industry and academia.

The External Engagement Officer role requires the successful candidate to:

  • possess experience in establishing and managing internal and external stakeholder relationships,
  • be able to think strategically in order to identify opportunities for new engagement activities or to strengthen existing relationships in support of AGO and broader Defence engagement objectives,
  • be a strong communicator with an ability to quickly produce written briefs, talking points and policy documents for AGO senior leadership,
  • possess an ability to build and sustain effective relationships with team members, and contribute to team objectives, and
  • possess exceptional time management skills with an ability manage multiple tasks and activities.

GEOINT Foundation and Support Branch (GFS) is responsible for managing, prioritising, collecting and enabling foundation data and satellite imagery requirements on behalf of the Department of Defence and the National Intelligence Community. This works is closely coordinated with a range of national and international partners, including industry and academia, and is vital to providing accurate and timely support to everything from tactical operations to strategic decision-making. GFS is seeking to fill the following position:

Source Strategist

The Collection Directorate is seeking a Source Strategist to work as part of a high performing team responsible for coordinating satellite imagery operations to meet the missions of AGO’s customers in Defence and the Australian Government.

As a Source Strategist you will be trained to specialise in satellite imagery operations and will have opportunities to innovate, share skills and experience, and support analyses required for today’s strategic environment, as well as evolve new capabilities required for tomorrow.

The Source Strategist role requires the successful candidate to:

  • possess relevant experience in one or more of remote sensing, space operations and satellite imagery applications,
  • be customer-focused with experience in managing and engaging internal and external customers,
  • possess an ability to build and sustain effective relationships with team members, as well as international and commercial partnerships, and
  • possess exceptional time management skills with an ability manage multiple tasks and activities.

Qualifications and experience in one or more of the following is desirable; geographic information systems; data management; geomatics and other earth observation sciences; web application development and related technologies; strategic and international studies’ science and applied mathematics; engineering and ICT project management; experience in related analytical or intelligence fields.

GEOINT Policy and Programs (GPP) is a diverse branch within AGO. It has a broad range of responsibilities focussed on enabling the delivery of AGO’s mission through its business sustainment, business enterprise, contracts and procurement, tradecraft, training and planning, and policy, governance and compliance. GPP is seeking to fill the following position:

Policy and Compliance Officer

The Policy, Compliance and Governance Directorate is seeking a Policy and Compliance Officer to work as part of a small, dynamic team responsible for providing the organisation with corporate policy guidance on a broad range of topics and undertake compliance activities.

As a Policy and Compliance Officer you will perform complex policy development and compliance activities and tasks. You will work within a framework of legislation, established principles, work practices and procedures.

The Policy and Compliance Officer role requires the successful candidate to:

  • be able to think strategically in order to ensure policy accords with AGO’s strategic objectives, legislation as well as national and international obligations,
  • be a strong communicator with an ability to produce written briefs, ministerial correspondence and policy documents for AGO senior leadership,
  • possess an ability to interpret and apply legislative, policy and regulatory frameworks,
  • possess an ability to build and sustain effective relationships with team members, internal and external stakeholders, and
  • possess exceptional time management skills with an ability manage multiple tasks and activities.

Please Note: It is important to identify which role/s you are applying for in your application.

Job Description

At the Department of Justice and Community Safety, we’re looking for people who want to make a difference. People who take pride in their work. People who get things done. People who are committed to making Victoria a safer place.

We embrace diversity and strive to have a workforce that reflects the community we serve. We’re all about recruiting the best people, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation or cultural background. If you think you can do the job and would be a good fit for our department, we’d love to hear from you.

The department is committed to the safety and wellbeing of children and recognises that children’s rights need to be respected, their views welcomed and valued, and their concerns taken seriously and acted upon.

If you’re having any trouble viewing this ad and would like it or any attachments in an accessible format (such as large print), please don’t hesitate to get in touch with the contact person listed on the ad.

For more information on working with us and our recruitment process, please visit justice.vic.gov.au/careers

We’re proud of the important work we do across Victoria. Want to be part of it?

About us

With Victoria's strong population growth and demand for services within the justice portfolio increasing at unprecedented rates, the scale of the infrastructure required to support this demand has never been more significant.

The Community Safety Building Authority (CSBA) has been established to support the transformation required to create a public service that is more connected, agile and mobile to respond to these challenges.

The CSBA supports the Department of Justice and Community Safety (DJCS) by planning, designing, procuring and building new infrastructure assets as well as modernising and upgrading existing ones.

About the role

As the Business Analyst you will contribute to a significant and high-profile security infrastructure program being led by the CSBA and delivered in collaboration with a range of program partners and stakeholders.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • analyse issues and opportunities, including the risks and benefits, and determine solution options and propose likely impacts of solution options and develop business cases
  • liase with stakeholders, resolve issues and maintain relationships, assist with managing expectations
  • guide and provide advice to the project team and CSBA in the areas of requirements development, requirements management and testing.

Please note this is a fixed term positon based in Melbourne.

About you

Our ideal candidate will have:

  • knowledge and experience in the planning, identification, documentation, review and analysis of business processes and business requirements
  • knowledge and experience in the planning and execution of acceptance tests on complex projects
  • knowledge and experience in working on complex projects through the full lifecycle.

Qualifications in business analysis, or equivalent experience are essential.

How to apply

Please click the Apply button at the bottom of this advertisement. Applications should include a resume and covering letter. Attachments can be uploaded in .doc, .docx, .pdf, .txt or .rtf formats.

Please note: When submitting your application online, there will be questions pertaining to a number of the position's Key Selection Criteria to which you are required to respond.

Reprise is looking for a junior digital analytics and insights superstar.

Reprise Digital Australia leads the business globally in product innovation, process and collaboration. We work with some of Australia’s biggest and most loved brands to create the best possible digital experience for their customers and provide return on investment.

We’re looking for someone to join the team who is curious, passionate and proactive about all things digital. We love our work, but we know when to stop and have fun. You will be working with a diverse team from all corners of the globe who have fun together both inside and outside of work.

Working alongside our current Analytics team, you will help deliver our data-driven insights & recommendations. This will include working across clients in a wide variety of industries, requiring a range of different approaches.

  • Working as a ‘Data Consultant’, doing any data-driven investigation or analysis that a client may require, using any tools you desire to get to the required outcome.
  • Performing full audits of clients’ Analytics, tracking and measurement setups, uncovering and fixing any potentially areas of inaccuracy or potential improvement.
  • Communicating directly with the client to ensure that the data being generated is giving the maximum possible value across all areas of their business.

You will need to be flexible in your work on a day-to-day basis, being creative and forward-thinking whilst retaining a scientific underpinning to everything you do.

EXPERIENCE

1-3 years’ relevant industry, agency or internal Reprise experience in web analytics or similar analytical field.

WHO YOU ARE

Essential – You will have:

  • Excellent numeracy skills with the ability to analyse data and identify trends
  • Strong listening skills and the ability to be open to new ideas
  • A creative mind and a passion for all things digital
  • Experience in delivering data analytics insights and solutions to clients
  • Experience in monitoring and reporting on performance of digital assets using Analytics platforms (including Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics)
  • Excellent written and oral communications skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical information to non-technical stakeholders
  • A good working knowledge of JavaScript and HTML

Desirable – We’d like to see:

  • A thorough knowledge of the strengths and weaknesses of the platforms in the market.
  • Experience writing and placing analytics code on websites using a tag management system such as Google Tag Manager or Adobe DTM
  • Experience using conversion optimisation software including Visual Website Optimiser, AB Tasty or Optimizely.
  • Experience with data visualisation & dashboarding software such as Data Studio or Tableau.
  • Experience with enterprise-level Analytics implementations, ideally using Google Analytics 360.
  • A good working knowledge of SQL

Bonus – We’d love to see:

  • A relevant tertiary marketing or scientific degree from an accredited institute
  • Experience with Python, R or another scripting language, with the ability to automate data collection and manipulation using APIs.
  • Experience with Agile working environments

For more information, get in touch.

As a Business Analyst with IMA, we guarantee you'll have your opinions sought and heard whilst making a big impact. If you have a 'consulting mindset' you'll know exactly what we mean.

You'll also:
  • Get exposed to multiple diversified clients and domains to really build your 'well rounded' expertise.
  • Challenge the norm and have the freedom and support to think outside the box.
  • Become a trusted advisor to your clients and have them lining up to secure you for your next engagement.
  • Build an impressive reputation as a charismatic consultant who can deliver 100% to your clients every time.
  • Use your confidence and initiative to really drive the process forward.
  • Utilise your knowledge and personality to work seamlessly between technical and business teams.
  • Present to your stakeholders and prepare documents and reports that identify and showcase what's really happening on the project. Cool charts and graphs would help.
  • Experience variety and work closely with a community of like-minded, brilliant, sharp innovators.

You will have,

  • 7+ years of relevant Business Analyses experience.
  • Strong business analysis background, with an ability to grasp the big picture.
  • Diverse project background, and the ability to work within a consulting and client-facing environment.
  • Exceptional client interaction, commercial and relationship management.
  • Analyse business requirements and recommend solutions.
  • Produce high-quality requirement specifications.
  • Agile methodology experience would be a bonus.

Too many consulting companies, 'amazing team culture' is merely lip service. We work really hard at making IMA a great place to work.

You:

Engaging, confident and passionate about Agile Business Analysis and bridging the gap between technology and the business! You have an analytical mindset and experience working with technical teams to deliver customer facing web solutions.

The role:

Working within an agile squad to deliver a new web initiative for the organisation, working closely with the technical teams and the business stakeholders to cement the user stories, user journeys and deliver new exciting customer facing technical solutions.

The Organisation:

A well-known household name in the retail space this company are innovating and expanding their organisation.

Skills and experience needed:

  • Experience working as an Agile BA on customer facing websites (ideally retail)
  • Exposure to SCRUM and Kanban
  • Exposure to JIRA
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; strong ability to articulate complex situations and information clearly
  • Experience of working within Agile and waterfall projects
  • Attention to detail; thorough
  • Disciplined and rigorous in following through on actions
  • Able to work collaboratively and effectively at all levels in an organisation.
  • Solid Business Analyst capabilities, experienced at being the link between IT and business stakeholders

If you are interested please click the Apply button or call Richard Green on 03 8399 9312 for a conversation about the role.

company: Trinity College, The University of Melbourne
job_desc:
Trinity College is a vibrant, diverse community, inspiring and enabling students of exceptional promise from Australia and around the world in its various educational programs, including a Residential College, a Theological School and a Pathways School. Trinity offers a warm collegiate workplace set amongst the leafy environs and historic buildings of Melbourne University’s oldest college, founded in 1872.

Trinity College has recently developed a Strategic Plan which sets out a five-year road map that will position the College as a leading education institution within the Asia-Pacific region. Emerging from the Strategic Plan, the College has developed an Information and Communication (ICT) Strategic Plan. The ICT Strategic Plan sets out a three-year blueprint that will position the College’s ICT systems to support the current and future operations of the College.

We are seeking a Business Analyst to work alongside the IT department. The Business Analyst role is a key facilitator within the organisation providing business analyst services for the ICT strategic initiatives. This position will interpret business requirements and act as the conduit between stakeholders across the College and those technical initiatives

The successful candidate will have:

  • Experience working as a business analyst in a complex organisation or on large IT projects. (Experience in an academic or government environment preferable).
  • The ability to demonstrate a strong understanding of Software Development Life Cycle.
  • Experience in vendor management and participation in RFP’s (highly regarded).
  • An ability to absorb and evaluate information from a variety of sources and understand “the big picture”.
  • A high level of attention to detail and accuracy in documentation, data entry, and follow-up on processes.
  • Strong organisational and time management skills.
  • Well-developed computer literacy in Microsoft Office Applications, preferably in a Mac Environment, with the ability to learn new systems.

This is a full-time, fixed term contract of 6 months, with potential for extension.

Salary Range: 4, FTE $81,794 to $85,265 plus 10% Superannuation and Leave Loading 17.5%

Enquiries: Robyn Healy, IT Transformation Manager Email: robynh@trinity.unimelb.edu.au

Applicants must be Australian Citizens, Permanent Residents or hold a valid work permit or visa. The successful applicant must secure, or be in the process of securing, a Working with Children approval.

To be considered for this role, you must submit a current copy of your resume, cover letter and your response to the key selection criteria as outlined in the position description.

Applications close 9:00am on Monday, 3 June 2019.

No agency enquiries please.

Would you like to work in a dynamic and challenging environment where you will be supported to reach your potential? There are opportunities available for the role of State Business Analyst in Melbourne.

About the Role:


Working within the National Field environment, you will ensure that the accurate analysis of market performance is communicated to State Management. This analysis of statistical data and market information will support the monitoring, planning and development processes of the business in order to achieve sales & marketing objectives.

You will provide the State Management team with regular updates on progress against company targets and ensure all relevant data bases are maintained with the latest information. You will be a motivated, self-starter who strives to offer solutions and input on process improvements to maximise efficiency within the team, field force and across departments. There will also be an element of administrative support required in the day to day activities of the State Office that you will to support with.

About You:

You should ideally possess the following attributes:

  • Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel including defining & creating formula, macros and pivot tables as well as PowerPoint.
  • Strong analytical ability to proactively identify trends, issues and opportunities and translate these into insightful commercial stories and recommendations
  • Ability to effectively plan, organise and prioritise
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in addition to presentation skills
  • Resilience and initiative, with a ‘can do attitude


The Perks:

If you are successful, you will receive the following:

  • Competitive remuneration package including bonus
  • Above statutory superannuation
  • Company laptop and smart phone
  • Opportunities for regular Learning and Development training

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

Do you have a passion to make a difference and help people get their lives back after injury or illness?

  • Do you have an experience in the workers compensation industry and strong analytical and reporting skills?
  • Provide support and detailed analysis of claims portfolio and guidewire system
  • We help people get their lives back on track after a workplace injury

EML is a leading Workers Compensation Insurance company. We now have over 2000 employees and are still growing which means an amazing and diverse culture with a very high internal promotion rate.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As part of our diverse team based in Sydney CBD , you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.

You will assist to identify and assess risks by working collaboratively with Senior Managers, and key stakeholders to manage key risks and identify corrective and preventative actions that minimise financial, reputational and operational risks to EML.

The role requires a collaborative and consultative approach, working with iCare and business leaders to identify critical issues.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Providing incisive analysis and making recommendations to enhance and improve current claims management processes, and performance.
  • Modelling performance and financial outcomes.
  • Provide assistance to understand claims management practices and emerging experience trends
  • Make recommendations to enhance and improve current processes for data collation and extraction, monitoring and reporting.
  • Deliver detailed analysis of portfolio trends, utilizing information to make strategic decisions

ABOUT YOU

  • Sound knowledge and experience of Workers Compensation Insurance
  • Demonstrated experience in QlikSense / QlikView and SAS highly desirable
  • Data interpretation and visualisation experience.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as in a team
  • Excellent communication and problem solving skills are a must.
  • Must have strong analytical/reporting skills
  • Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline is highly desirable

WHAT WE OFFER

We stand together as equals. EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.

EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including:

  • Onsite Learning and Development Team
  • End of Month Celebration Events
  • 17.5% Annual Leave Loading
  • Free Fruit Boxes
  • Free Onsite Pilates,Yoga and Fitness Classes

We value our people and are committed to supporting our employees by investing in their professional development and providing generous employee benefits. If this is of interest to you, please or for more information/confidential conversation please contact Mary Norouzifar on 0280713623.
