Tryzens is an international digital commerce consultancy that takes a holistic approach to growing our customers business, no matter how or where our customer chooses to buy. Our focus is centred on being collaborative partners in digital commerce, optimising their opportunity for online growth and engaging our customers in compelling and intuitive experiences.


We're looking to hire an experienced Ecommerce Business Analyst to join our Melbourne office locaed in Richmond. The role requires proven experience in delivering high quality ecommerce solutions to our clients. Working knowledge of at least one ecommerce platform such as Hybris, Demandware/Salesforce Commerce Cloud, Magento, EpiServer, Websphere Commerce is essential. A strong retail background is also highly desirable.

You'll be working with the client stakeholders, internal technical team and related third parties to analyse, design and document technological solutions to meet the business objectives. You'll also be responsible for representing the business in all internal stakeholder project meetings and will be a key member of the professional team.


The role covers the full project lifecycle from the elicitation of business requirements through to user acceptance testing and implementation of the system/s. The objective of the role is to elicit the business requirements and to deliver business requirement specifications that meet the client objectives for the project and support the team through to delivery.


You will need to be comfortable and confident in working autonomously, with limited guidance at times due to time differences.


Requirements

Essential Experience & Knowledge

  • Experience in leading discovery workshops
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills
  • Excellent requirement documenting skills in the form of user cases, user stories and functional specifications
  • Understanding of the full eCommerce product life cycle
  • Working knowledge of at least one of the ecommerce platforms e.g Hybris, Demandware/Salesforce Commerce Cloud, Magento, EpiServer, Websphere Commerce
  • Proven track record in software development environments and experiences of end to end project lifecycles
  • Experience of testing the developed solution to ensure it meets requirements and client expectations.
  • Proficient in co-coordinating with offshore teams and vendors.
  • Familiar with MS Outlook, Word, Excel, Visio and Project.
  • Degree educated or equivalent


Desirable Experience & Knowledge

  • Understanding of Web Standards
  • Knowledge of project management tools and methodologies e.g. MS Project/Prince 2
  • Technical understanding of multi-tier Java platform architecture
  • Basic Project Management skills to manage small change requests and projects
  • Exposure to the software testing process including the preparation of test plans, execution of test scripts is an advantage.
  • Worked with business tools e.g Visio or similar
  • Exposure to issue management and collaborative tools e.g. Jira, Basecamp, Confluence

Benefits

  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Forward thinking company with growth prospects
  • Office based in Richmond
  • 25 days annual leave per year
  • 2 corporate social responsibility days per year
  • Your birthday off
  • Team lunches, dinner/drinks & great team culture
  • Travel opportunities

Business Analyst - (12 month fix term)

First, a bit about ANZ.
At ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers.
We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.
Purpose of role
This role will help transform how data is organised, managed and leveraged within the Risk function meet current and future data governance requirements at ANZ. You will support the Data Governance Lead with the delivery of a plan that will embed the Enterprise Data Governance Framework with a focus on adding value to the customer and business.
You will work with a team of analysts in the delivery of a portfolio of initiatives and work collaboratively with stakeholders to elicit requirements while enabling a clear understanding of the program’s objectives and benefits.
We are looking for your drive, enthusiasm and smarts to help us to improve that quality of data that risk consumes and produces. Your knowledge of business analysis techniques and translating them into commercial solutions, as well as your ability to work with stakeholders and support initiatives in an efficient and timely manner.
Key Responsibilities
  • Support the Data Governance initiatives for Risk in adherence to ANZ Enterprise Data Governance Framework
  • Provide innovative thought leadership into the plan for managing risk data, introducing modern data concepts and challenging the status quo whilst understanding the regulatory requirements of the bank
  • Participate in appropriate forums within the ANZ Data Governance model, and embed data governance capabilities within Risk
  • Have responsibility for monitoring initiatives and issues and help drive remediation strategies and execution
  • Liaise with Enterprise Data Governance to leverage services and artefacts available through the Data Governance Framework to improve risk data assets and planned benefits
  • Provide updates to Risk and Data on initiatives against the EDG framework and plan
  • Have an open and adaptive mindset and adopt ANZ NWOW agile project practices
    Is this role for you?
    • Do you have experience in embedding and executing upon a data plan in a large organisation?
    • Do you have experience identifying and resolving data or project issues?
    • Do you have experience in delivering frameworks for data management?
    • Do you have an understanding of business glossary, metadata or data lineage?
    • Do you have experience in designing for data simplification?
    • Do you have an understanding of the data lifecycle?
    • Do you have the ability to interpret and analyse data through various techniques?
    • Do you have experience with the agile SDLC and planning project delivery?
    • Are you a collaborative player that encourages sharing knowledge within and across teams?
      If you answered yes to all or most of these questions, you could be a great candidate for joining the Group Data team!

      “At ANZ we aim to create an inclusive environment where employee differences such as gender, age, culture, disability, sexual orientation, family and caring responsibilities and religion are valued.

      We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you.”

job_title: Energy Analyst | Operations Analyst | Data Analyst
job_desc:
A little about us…

SavvyBI is the ultimate energy assistant that allows businesses to truly understand their energy behaviour. It empowers businesses with the skills and knowledge to make smarter decisions about energy leading to savings in cost, energy and time.

SavvyBI comprehensively scans and interprets meter data, invoices, rates and various other data streams to identify recommendations and opportunities for businesses. Using industry-leading technologies SavvyBI delivers clear messaging, actionable insights and self-service apps to provide a complete energy experience.

SavvyBI - the simple way to understand energy.

Tell me more about the role…

Working in the ‘hub’ of the business, we currently have an opening for a motivated Energy Analyst / Operations Analyst / Data Analyst to join the team. Open to candidates of all backgrounds and experience, the role acts as a go-between for the business and its clients, as well as across the different teams in the business.

What would you be doing…

Good question! As we continue to transition from our MVP (minimum viable product) to our fully flagged platform the role would be involved in everything from ensuring existing services are delivered on time to assisting the developers with their new features to keeping our clients happy.

A few of the key day-to-day responsibilities include:

  • Preparing energy budgets, forecasts and accruals
  • Loading, processing and validating retailer invoices
  • Performing energy management services including network tariff reviews, tender evaluations, sustainability reporting
  • Maintaining and enhancing existing business intelligence reports
  • Providing support and account management services to stakeholders as required
  • Brainstorming and assisting with the rest of the team on improvements, enhancements & new features
  • Being an internal champion

Skills we’re looking for…

Ideally you will be a chameleon – someone who can grow, adapt and evolve along with the business.

The skillset we’re looking for includes:

  • Highly motivated, strong work ethic and a team player
  • Dedicated to delivering the optimum outcome for the business
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Well organised with an ability to meet tight deadlines
  • Possess a high attention to detail and the capability to grasp new concepts quickly
  • Hands on approach to problem solving and technically proficient
  • BONUS POINTS for any experience/knowledge of the following:
  • Australian Energy Market
  • Similar type roles: operations, customer support, data analysis
  • Excel & SQL
  • Business Intelligence Platforms
  • AWS Cloud Computing

Tell me about the perks…

  • Flexible working conditions (casual dress, ability to work from home, flexible hours)
  • Decide your own job title....(within reason of course!)
  • Dynamic, innovative and fast-growing business with great career opportunities
  • Modern office in Docklands conveniently located close to Southern Cross Station
  • Exposure to cutting-edge technology

Jump onboard and come be part of an innovative disruptor that helps bring energy closer to the consumer than ever before!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $45,000.00 to $85,000.00 /year

**Description**
,
It’s no secret that a good education has the power to change lives. The challenge lies in the pace with which Australia’s educational landscape is transforming. It’s no longer just about providing access, but also ensuring progress.
,

We are looking for an ICT Business Analyst to provide sound business, requirements formulation, code based analytical work, documentation and design leadership within our software company where we are seeking to create and develop a new way to deliver insurance to small business. The successful candidate will communicate with employees, stakeholders and customers to increase our business offering by developing a a truly innovative digital platform.

Reporting to the Director, the successful candidate will have overall responsibility for helping define and build our new product to improve customer experience, business processes and ensuring ongoing compliance to regulatory change.

Most importantly the successful candidate will be responsible for developing the digital product strategy, leading all aspects of the technical development, design and future growth. They will undertake all aspects of the role to deliver excellence to all stakeholders. We expect the successful candidate to be well-versed in current technological trends and familiar with a variety of business concepts.

Requirements

  • working with users to build business requirements
  • identifying, investigating, and assessing business processes, procedures
  • Build processes to improve business practices, and system functionality and behaviour
  • using current software tools to build business cases for hiring, and project decisions.
  • project management methodologies, principles and techniques to develop project plans and to cost, resource and manage projects

  • Build and manage user stories, and project backlogs
  • develop specifications for use by Engineers and Designers
  • using data and process modelling techniques to create clear system specifications for the design and development of system software
  • acting as a central reference and information source, providing guidance and assistance in the system project decision making process

Benefits

  • We trust our employees. This means we focus on outcomes and provide a flexible workplace. We genuinely encourage work life balance.
  • You’ll be right in the centre of Abbotsford. That’s right, the best coffee and food Melbourne has to offer is right outside our doorstep!

Maribyrnong City Council is undergoing significant change in population growth, redevelopment, and a transitioning economy is leading to an influx of new residents, businesses and opportunities. Maribyrnong is becoming a sought after residential area and a destination for foodies.

Our Information Technology Services Department is seeking a Business Systems Analyst to join the team. As a valuable member of the team, you will report to the Coordinator IT Services. The primary purpose of this role is to partner with the business and provide the bridge between the businesses technology aspirations and the development of requirements and scope for priority technology projects.

This role will encompass a wide variety of business analyst work, from identifying and management of business benefits of projects, requirements/scope development and management, defining strategies, validating and justifying business needs, through to helping with organisational change aspects, to technology project implementation.

Working in a collaborative environment, the IT Business Systems Analyst will assist in facilitating smooth and supported processes in an environment that drives a culture of continuous improvement.

You will have great attention to detail, experience in requirements elicitation, documentation and project management, with strong communication and interpersonal skills in order to work effectively with a variety of people and teams. Extensive experience in and enthusiasm for web technologies, digital trends, innovation and digital delivery is essential.

Previous experience in Local Government and working with large corporate databases will be highly regarded. Join the team at Maribyrnong.

We are a child safe organisation and an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to child safety and supporting the best interests of children in all our operations. Council encourages young people, people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply.

Enquiries: Avryl Ebert, Coordinator IT Services on (03) 9688-0254.

Do you have a passion to make a difference and help people get their lives back after injury or illness?

  • Do you have an experience in the workers compensation industry and strong analytical and reporting skills?
  • Provide support and detailed analysis of claims portfolio and guidewire system
  • We help people get their lives back on track after a workplace injury

EML is a leading Workers Compensation Insurance company. We now have over 2000 employees and are still growing which means an amazing and diverse culture with a very high internal promotion rate.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As part of our diverse team based in Sydney CBD , you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.

You will assist to identify and assess risks by working collaboratively with Senior Managers, and key stakeholders to manage key risks and identify corrective and preventative actions that minimise financial, reputational and operational risks to EML.

The role requires a collaborative and consultative approach, working with iCare and business leaders to identify critical issues.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Providing incisive analysis and making recommendations to enhance and improve current claims management processes, and performance.
  • Modelling performance and financial outcomes.
  • Provide assistance to understand claims management practices and emerging experience trends
  • Make recommendations to enhance and improve current processes for data collation and extraction, monitoring and reporting.
  • Deliver detailed analysis of portfolio trends, utilizing information to make strategic decisions

ABOUT YOU

  • Sound knowledge and experience of Workers Compensation Insurance
  • Demonstrated experience in QlikSense / QlikView and SAS highly desirable
  • Data interpretation and visualisation experience.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as in a team
  • Excellent communication and problem solving skills are a must.
  • Must have strong analytical/reporting skills
  • Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline is highly desirable

WHAT WE OFFER

We stand together as equals. EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.

EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including:

  • Onsite Learning and Development Team
  • End of Month Celebration Events
  • 17.5% Annual Leave Loading
  • Free Fruit Boxes
  • Free Onsite Pilates,Yoga and Fitness Classes

We value our people and are committed to supporting our employees by investing in their professional development and providing generous employee benefits. If this is of interest to you, please or for more information/confidential conversation please contact Mary Norouzifar on 0280713623.

Who we are

Containerchain is a successful and growing software company that has ambitious international expansion plans. We are a leader in our industry, providing solutions and ideas that increase the efficiency of ports, shipping, and freight logistics.

We are looking for a brilliant Business Analyst who has strong analytical, lateral thinking and communication skills to join our team.


What is the role?

As a Business Analyst, you will be responsible for gathering, analysing, modeling and documenting requirements for the continuous development of our software product suite.

You'll be working with customers, as well as our Business and Tech teams to make sure that our most important business requirements flow seamlessly to our products. We follow Agile, so we're looking for someone who can work with our teams to ensure we deliver quality, quickly.


Your Key Responsibilities:

  • Gather and Document Customer and Business Requirements for Product Development
  • Translate Customer and Business Requirements into User Stories and supporting documents
  • Support the Development Process through Clarification of Requirements and User Stories
  • Review and Validate produced functionality to ensure it meets Customer and Business Requirements

You have:

  • 5+ years demonstrated Business Analysis experience in an Agile environment (Scrum and / or Kanban)
  • Demonstrable experience in identifying business requirements and translating into user stories for implementation by Technology teams
  • Highly developed data and process modeling skills
  • Strong analytical and lateral thinking skills
  • Strong technical and user documentation skills and experience

What would give you an advantage:

  • Experience working in the logistics industry
  • Experience of documenting legacy applications for lift and shift projects

What's on Offer?

This is an exciting opportunity offering a very competitive salary and room to grow in the future. We're a growing company looking for exceptional talent to help guide us in delivering on our company strategy.

  • Are you a high performer looking to take the next step in your career?
  • Opportunity to bring your experience data analysis and data analytic tools
  • Contribute to advancing the use of analytics to deliver assurance across the enterprise

About the role

An exciting permanent opportunity has arisen for a Data Analyst in Internal Audit to support the Audit team by performing data extraction, transformation and analysis to deliver insights on key risks and provide assurance to a wide range of stakeholders across the enterprise.

Accountabilities

Your day to day responsibilities will include (but not be limited to):-

  • Support Audit leads and managers to provide insights and recommendations on audit matters to minimise risk and uplift business performance
  • Contribute to requirements gathering and design of analytical solutions.
  • Take accountability for sourcing, extracting and transforming data to meet the needs of audit requirements
  • Work with the Audit team to draw conclusions from the analysis
  • Collaborate with the broader Data Analytics team to ensure training and business requirements are met
  • Take accountability for ensuring the data analysis is completed on time, within budget, to agreed standards and ensure all issues and obstacles are managed appropriately
  • Proactively monitoring risk and assurance requirements
  • Demonstrate ongoing commitment to continuous improvement of processes

Skills & experience

To succeed in this role, you must be able to work in a fast-paced, and at times ambiguous and complex environment, and have:

  • Prior experience in Data Analytics role is essential
  • Ability to work with large sets of data from various data sources, conducting deep dives to identify trends and provide insights using your expertise in data extraction and analysis
  • Demonstrated ability with SQL, or similar, query language for data preparation and transformation purposes
  • Knowledge of Python and/or R desirable
  • Demonstrated ability with Tableau or a similar data visualisation tool
  • Strong stakeholder engagement skills
  • Ability to engage and communicate technical ideas to a non-technical audience
  • Experience working in a risk or audit environment desirable

Benefits

At NAB, we provide access to a large number of exclusive employee benefits that will support you both personally and professionally. These include volunteer leave, education and learning benefits and banking & financial services discounts for example. Visit our benefits page for more information http://www.nab.com.au/about-us/careers/working-at-nab/benefits

How to apply

If you are ready to take the next step in your career, we are keen to hear from you!

Please note, candidate screening and interviews may take place prior to the advertised close date.

To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status. Please apply via the link.

If you are looking for a role that will give you excellent exposure across the business and allow you to utilise your existing knowledge and skills in a new environment, then this role in the NAB audit division is the opportunity for you.

Working for AMP means being part of a company that values diverse thinking, encourages collaboration and promotes innovation. It’s an environment that offers challenging and exciting work as well as opportunities for professional growth. We’re flexible enough to allow you to make the most of your life, both professionally and personally.

We are looking for those that have the courage and agility to navigate changing and complex environments so that we can deliver the best solutions for our customers. We value people with integrity, an innate willingness to help others and an eagerness to perform to the best of their abilities.

We’re transforming our business, and we need people like you to join us on this journey.

About the role

Bank IT provides technology solutions for the Bank. The purpose of the Business System Analyst role is to work collaboratively with the business, third parties and internal IT team stakeholders to ensure all solutions achieve the desired outcomes and are aligned with the strategic objectives of the Bank. By combining banking domain knowledge and technical competency, this role ensures that solutions fulfil business needs while being technically viable. The role will primarily be based at our Parramatta office with some travel to Circular Quay required.


Key Responsibilities

  • Identify and propose technology solutions viable to the business case

  • Conduct facilitated workshops to elicit requirements both functional and technical requirements

  • Research and analyse all aspects of existing business practices and procedures

  • Generate interface designs, data flow diagrams and system models

  • Participate in code deployment and migration

Capabilities & Experience

  • Demonstrated experience in a Business Systems Analyst role, preferably within Banking

  • Familiar with SQL Server and able to write SQL queries

  • ‘Full-stack’ development skills, including design and development of RESTful APIs

  • Knowledge of software designing concepts

  • Understanding of networks, operating systems, and technology system interfaces

Wellbeing & Benefits

As a company that values wellbeing, we offer a range of great benefits to support you financially, professionally and personally. These include access to a wide range of flexible working options including the ability to purchase extra leave, retail discounts, onsite wellbeing centre including a gym (Sydney Office), Employee Assistance Program, competitive home loan rates, leading superannuation contribution, discounted financial advice and personal insurance.


Inclusion & Diversity

AMP recognises individual differences and welcomes people from a variety of life and work experiences. The diversity of our people is core to our ability to innovate, grow and to fulfil our collective aspiration of helping people to own their tomorrow. A natural curiosity, a respect for differences and a growth mindset are valued at AMP.

Are you interested in using your analytical and data skills to help propel a small but hyperactive company to new heights? This is a place you will want to examine. Located in North Ryde but catering for flexible working arrangements, this opportunity to be a key participant in the company's early stages is pretty rare. But not for the faint-hearted. This is a startup and we are after a person who are comfortable in a rapidly changing and sometime ambiguous environment. If you have knowledge of how clinical information systems work, have an opinion on how they could be made better and have some of the following, we'd love to have a chat with you:

  • Excellent command of SQL
  • Experience working with sensitive and confidential data
  • Experience working with medical datasets including medical vocabularies
  • Great communication and team working skills

Desired skills
  • Experience interacting with medical data systems such as Cerner Command Language, Cachè
  • Familiarity with HL7, FHIR and/or OMOP standards
  • Familiarity with medical security standards including CFR 21 part 511.C, HIPAA and PSAF
  • Research experience, in particular in medical research
Please send your application to Richard@mantechit.com.au

Would you like to work in a dynamic and challenging environment where you will be supported to reach your potential? There are opportunities available for the role of State Business Analyst in Melbourne.

About the Role:


Working within the National Field environment, you will ensure that the accurate analysis of market performance is communicated to State Management. This analysis of statistical data and market information will support the monitoring, planning and development processes of the business in order to achieve sales & marketing objectives.

You will provide the State Management team with regular updates on progress against company targets and ensure all relevant data bases are maintained with the latest information. You will be a motivated, self-starter who strives to offer solutions and input on process improvements to maximise efficiency within the team, field force and across departments. There will also be an element of administrative support required in the day to day activities of the State Office that you will to support with.

About You:

You should ideally possess the following attributes:

  • Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel including defining & creating formula, macros and pivot tables as well as PowerPoint.
  • Strong analytical ability to proactively identify trends, issues and opportunities and translate these into insightful commercial stories and recommendations
  • Ability to effectively plan, organise and prioritise
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in addition to presentation skills
  • Resilience and initiative, with a ‘can do attitude


The Perks:

If you are successful, you will receive the following:

  • Competitive remuneration package including bonus
  • Above statutory superannuation
  • Company laptop and smart phone
  • Opportunities for regular Learning and Development training

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

We have found that by nurturing the unique talents of our people and working with them to carve out a rich and varied career, we are able to create a new standard of retail in the Southern Hemisphere.

The Marketing, Financial Services and Customer Innovation teams focus on delighting our customers by offering a fully integrated and seamless customer experience through various online and offline marketing channels. The team is responsible for our brand positioning, engagement initiatives and communication campaigns as well as delivering a range of financial services and products to our customers.

We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our Insights team and play a key role in establishing and facilitating ways of working for a new team. Reporting through to the Advanced Analytics Manager, this unique role is integral in utilising advanced analytical techniques to assist in the delivery of strategic projects across the Country Road Group and David Jones brands.

In this role you will:

  • Unlock incremental value within existing and new data assets through the use of advanced analytical technics such as;
    • Modelling for prediction
    • Modelling for discovery
    • Clustering and segmentation
    • Market mix modelling and basket/association modelling to inform and optimise decisions.
  • Advise and conduct analysis to support business decision making, including taking briefs, performing analysis and producing reports that enable effective decision making.
  • Manage the complete model life cycle (Build, Test, Deploy, Monitor)
  • Stay abreast of the latest developments in analytics and identifying opportunities to utilise them.
  • Assist with commercial analysis as and when required
  • Mentor and share knowledge of techniques, applications and approaches with the wider analytical team

We are looking for that little bit extra, so join us if you:

  • Proven data experience including segmentation, behavioural analysis and financial modelling
  • Expertise with coding in SAS and R, and the use of BI and data visualisation tools (such as SAS VA). Experience with other languages and platforms (e.g. Python, Lua, Scala, Tensorflow, Matlab) would be advantageous.
  • Have demonstrated experience in successfully building, evaluating deploying and monitoring statistical models for data mining, predictive modelling, clustering, classification, deep learning, genetic algorithms, neural networks (MLP, Convolutional, Recurrent), NLP and text mining
  • Have demonstrated experience with big data and big data architecture (Map reduce, Hive, Pig, Spark)
  • Have developed expertise in database technologies and SQL language for joining, querying and manipulating data sets
  • Are adept in turning questions into testable hypotheses and presenting insights to key, non technical stakeholders
  • Are team oriented, and thrive in a collaborative and dynamic environment
  • Are comfortable operating in high change, ambiguous environments
  • Possess experience in identifying new uses for data and its interaction with data design using a variety of techniques and applications
  • Have excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, with the ability to influence stakeholders across the organisation

At David Jones and Country Road Group we go the extra mile. We offer:

  • Offer opportunities to work across premium exclusive Fashion, Beauty, Home & Food products.
  • Have an ever changing store environment with leading design and visual merchandising displays.
  • Offer career progression - there are always opportunities for those with aspirations.
  • Are surrounded by a great team who are inspired to make a difference for our customers.

To begin a career with endless possibilities, we invite you to begin your application now.

Austin Health is the major provider of tertiary health services, health professional education and research across 3 campuses in the northeast of Melbourne and state-wide. Austin Health is world-renowned for its research and specialist work in cancer, liver transplantation, spinal cord injuries, neurology, endocrinology, mental health and rehabilitation.

An exciting opportunity currently exists for an enthusiastic Data Analyst to join the Neuroscience Molecular Imaging Research team in the Department of Molecular Imaging & Therapy.

Details of Department

The Austin Health Department of Molecular Imaging and Therapy has an active research team in the area of PET imaging in Dementia. It has extensive national and international links and performs both academic studies and scans to support therapy trials. It is the imaging co-ordination and image processing site for several national collaborative studies. The successful applicant will work with the dementia research team headed by Professor Christopher Rowe, Director of Molecular Imaging Research, to support the Acquisition, Archiving and Analysis of images required for the dementia research team. The dementia research group obtains or manages over 500 PET and MRI scans per year. The successful applicant will work with and be directly supervised by the senior computer scientist officer.

Details of position/position requirements

We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst who will provide support for data organization, reporting and analysis of the dementia PET research team studies under the direction of the computer sciences senior Officer. This includes system administration of the data management platform, for which software development or IT experience would be beneficial (in particular, python and other scripting), with other academic and commercial partners. The candidate will also work closely with world leading scientists in PET imaging for dementia and will be encouraged to get involved with the research and develop their own projects. Support will be provided to attend international conferences and to pursue higher academic qualifications such as a PhD.

To be successful in this role you must demonstrate:

  • A Bachelor or Master in Science/ Computing Science, Information Technology, and/or Physics and/or related Engineering specialty.
  • Proficiency in use of all OS (Linux, OS-X and Windows), python, R
  • Proficiency in Database development and maintenance
  • Basic statistical understanding
  • Attention to detail

Work with us! Your reward is to work in a collaborative environment which will provide you with opportunities for ongoing training and development. Your benefits will include salary packaging, and employee assistance program.

All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory National Police Check conducted by Austin Health and if required, a Working With Children Check.

Austin Health is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve. Applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged.

About us

Seer is developing technology to revolutionise the diagnosis and management of neurological conditions, with a special focus on epilepsy. Our mission is to deliver deep personalised clinical insights and advance patient experience with leading-edge technology.

Our technology consists of wearable devices, a cloud platform and machine learning systems. These systems are at the core of our at-home video EEG monitoring and diagnostic service - the first of its kind. Seer has already made a big impact across the east coast of Australia over the last 2 years and is now building for international expansion.

The Role

Data Scientist is a key role at Seer! We're building a cloud-based machine learning platform to deliver personalised insights from ambient, wearable and implantable devices.

This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team and work alongside the software development group. You will drive new innovations to provide improved data-driven insights to empower our users at scale.


Responsibilities

  • Building deep neural networks to detect abnormalities in EEG and ECG data.

  • Working on large and complex data sets in preparation for machine learning

  • Deploying machine learning models as production code

  • Automating tests and validation of algorithms

  • Apply exciting and best practice methods of analysis through statistics and modelling that assists in detecting of seizures.

  • Act as an internal subject matter expert yet collaborate effectively across-channels and different teams.

  • Being an active member of the team's learning

  • Driving innovation to scale our technology

About You

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics)

  • Min 3+ years’ experience, with data analytics and science and proven experience in designing experiments

  • Strong analytical skills, with experience solving ambiguous problems using data

  • Experience with developing deep learning models and working with remote machines in the cloud

  • Extensive experience with Python is essential

  • Linux, Docker and Git experience

  • Experience in cloud computing (ideally AWS)

  • Strong communication skills and an attention to detail

  • Passionate about building maintainable and robust systems, with experience across; data processing, machine learning libraries and big data technologies

  • Enthusiasm for software quality (automated testing, code review, and documentation)

  • Ability to work well in a diverse team with different backgrounds and experience levels

JOB TITLE - Criminal Intelligence Analyst

Location - ACT; NSW; QLD; SA; VIC; WA

AFP Broadband 6-7 (Intelligence) 93,233.00 - 110,172.00

VACANCY REFERENCE NUMBER 1199

Role Summary

AFP appointees contribute to the achievement of outcomes in accordance with the regulatory framework, the AFP Code of Conduct and the AFP Governance Instruments. It is expected that the successful applicant will deliver on the core responsibilities and meet any requirements of the position as outlined below.


Criminal Intelligence Analysts engage in the collection, collation and high-level analysis of information to produce and disseminate intelligence which influences organisational decision-making at all levels. They support complex criminal investigations and AFP corporate objectives in their ability to manage and assess large-volumes of disparate data, applying contemporary analytical tools and techniques to produce actionable operational and strategic intelligence. Criminal Intelligence Analysts provide guidance to junior members in a coaching and mentoring role. They communicate effectively and with influence with a range of stakeholders in order to achieve intelligence and operational outcomes.

Role Description & Responsibilities

Criminal Intelligence Analysts plan, collect, collate and analyse information to produce high-level operational and strategic intelligence in support of complex criminal investigations and AFP corporate objectives. As a Criminal Intelligence Analyst you will:

  • Use your knowledge of policing, law enforcement and the criminal justice system to produce high-level operational and strategic intelligence in support of complex criminal investigations, AFP corporate objectives and whole-of-government outcomes;
  • Proactively plan, collect, collate and analyse information to produce and disseminate quality, influential intelligence to a broad range of intelligence consumers;
  • Provide input and advice to drive broader AFP intelligence collection requirements and produce intelligence in support of corporate objectives;
  • Apply high-level research methods into contemporary issues and trends to inform and influence policy development, strategy or to achieve specific policing outcomes;
  • Provide high-level intelligence briefings to a range of stakeholders, both written and orally;
  • Record information and intelligence appropriately;
  • Coach and mentor others;
  • Maintain currency in intelligence concepts and methods through ongoing professional development and learning; and
  • Maintain your knowledge and understanding of the criminal justice system, components of offences and the social impacts of policing.
  • As a Criminal Intelligence Analyst you must attain a Diploma of Police Intelligence Practice within 12 months of commencement. This training will be offered through the workplace.

Our Ideal Candidate

The AFP works closely with a range of other law enforcement and government agencies at state, territory, Commonwealth and international levels to protect Australians and Australia’s interests. As a Criminal Intelligence Analyst within the AFP you will be:

  • Committed to excellence and innovation;
  • Honest, law abiding, and respectful of others;
  • Forward thinking and self-motivated;
  • Able to demonstrate excellent stakeholder relationship skills, including the ability to provide insightful and trusted advice to a diverse range of stakeholders; and
  • Able to embody the culture to which we aspire to.

Essential Requirements

  • You must be an Australian citizen.
  • Negative Vetting 2 (Top Secret) - security clearance or the ability to obtain one.
  • Contemporary experience in policing, law enforcement or criminal intelligence and/or associated related qualifications in this field, such as (but not limited to) intelligence, investigations, policing, criminology, criminal justice or analytical/research. (Applicants with three years or above contemporary experience will be ideally suited for these positions).
  • Effective communication skills, ability to influence in writing and orally, and a high resilience level with ability to adapt to change.
  • A proven ability to manage and critically assess large volumes of data.
  • Advanced research and analytical skills.
  • A demonstrated ability to coach and mentor others.
  • Knowledge of Commonwealth legislation or the ability to obtain this knowledge.

Selection Criteria

  • Achieve Results
  • Contributes to Strategic Thinking
  • Cultivates productive working relationships
  • Shows Personal Drive and Integrity
  • Communicates with Influence

Required Application Documents

As part of your application you will be required to submit the following documents:

  • Employment Suitability Questionnaire (ESQ) – non-AFP employees only
  • Traffic History – non-AFP employees only
  • Proof of Australian citizenship – non-AFP employees only
  • Resume/CV

Please note: A two page pitch is not required for this application - please refer to question five (5).

Contact Officer: Vanessa Parton, 02 61316506 or vanessa.parton@afp.gov.au

Application Preliminary step:

It is strongly recommended that you take action now to obtain a copy or copies of your driving history through the relevant local motor registry or road traffic authority.

Application:

  • applicants must complete and submit an online application;
  • resumes and any other required documents are to be uploaded to the application form and submitted before the closing date and time. Any documents not supplied may result in your application being withdrawn from the recruitment process.

AFP Employment Suitability Questionnaire (ESQ):

The ESQ is the tool in which applicant’s character is assessed against the employment character standards. All applicants who are not currently an AFP employee are required to upload a completed ESQ for every application. You can access the ESQ here .

More information about the ESQ can be found on the AFP’s Employment Character Standards webpage .


Traffic History:

Providing your traffic history is mandatory. All applicants who are not currently an AFP employee must upload an up to date traffic history (no more than 90 days old) for the last 10 years, from all states and countries where they have held a licence.

More information on the documents required and how you can obtain your traffic history can be found on the traffic history page on the AFP careers webpage.

For further information on positions, and other employment opportunities in the AFP, please visit our website or ring the contact officer.

You:

Engaging, confident and passionate about Agile Business Analysis and bridging the gap between technology and the business! You have an analytical mindset and experience working with technical teams to deliver customer facing web solutions.

The role:

Working within an agile squad to deliver a new web initiative for the organisation, working closely with the technical teams and the business stakeholders to cement the user stories, user journeys and deliver new exciting customer facing technical solutions.

The Organisation:

A well-known household name in the retail space this company are innovating and expanding their organisation.

Skills and experience needed:

  • Experience working as an Agile BA on customer facing websites (ideally retail)
  • Exposure to SCRUM and Kanban
  • Exposure to JIRA
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; strong ability to articulate complex situations and information clearly
  • Experience of working within Agile and waterfall projects
  • Attention to detail; thorough
  • Disciplined and rigorous in following through on actions
  • Able to work collaboratively and effectively at all levels in an organisation.
  • Solid Business Analyst capabilities, experienced at being the link between IT and business stakeholders

If you are interested please click the Apply button or call Richard Green on 03 8399 9312 for a conversation about the role.

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management
  • Optimize workflow management to ensure traceability back to strategic alignment
  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)
“We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you."

To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.anz.com/careers. You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for reference number AUS099344

Job no: 500779
Work type: Full Time
Location: Sydney
Categories: Workers Compensation, RTWSS

Do you have a passion to make a difference and help people get their lives back after injury or illness?

  • Do you have an experience in the workers compensation industry and strong analytical and reporting skills?
  • Provide support and detailed analysis of claims portfolio and guidewire system
  • We help people get their lives back on track after a workplace injury

EML is a leading Workers Compensation Insurance company. We now have over 2000 employees and are still growing which means an amazing and diverse culture with a very high internal promotion rate.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As part of our diverse team based in Sydney CBD , you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.

You will assist to identify and assess risks by working collaboratively with Senior Managers, and key stakeholders to manage key risks and identify corrective and preventative actions that minimise financial, reputational and operational risks to EML.

The role requires a collaborative and consultative approach, working with iCare and business leaders to identify critical issues.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Providing incisive analysis and making recommendations to enhance and improve current claims management processes, and performance.
  • Modelling performance and financial outcomes.
  • Provide assistance to understand claims management practices and emerging experience trends
  • Make recommendations to enhance and improve current processes for data collation and extraction, monitoring and reporting.
  • Deliver detailed analysis of portfolio trends, utilizing information to make strategic decisions

ABOUT YOU

  • Sound knowledge and experience of Workers Compensation Insurance
  • Demonstrated experience in QlikSense / QlikView and SAS highly desirable
  • Data interpretation and visualisation experience.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as in a team
  • Excellent communication and problem solving skills are a must.
  • Must have strong analytical/reporting skills
  • Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline is highly desirable

WHAT WE OFFER

We stand together as equals. EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.

EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including:

  • Onsite Learning and Development Team
  • End of Month Celebration Events
  • 17.5% Annual Leave Loading
  • Free Fruit Boxes
  • Free Onsite Pilates,Yoga and Fitness Classes

We value our people and are committed to supporting our employees by investing in their professional development and providing generous employee benefits. If this is of interest to you, please or for more information/confidential conversation please contact Mary Norouzifar on 0280713623.

Advertised: 10 May 2019 AUS Eastern Standard Time
Applications close: 31 May 2019 AUS Eastern Standard Time

• Partner with the business to drive process improvement
  • Collaborate on projects across the business
  • Drive frontline centre of excellence

ORIGIN – GOOD ENERGY

Origin has a rich heritage in energy exploration, production, power generation and retailing. Today, we're a leading provider of energy to homes and businesses throughout Australia.

THE ROLE

Reporting to the Senior Business Solutions Analyst, the Business Process Analyst is responsible for providing support to the Credit Collections Operational Leads and team. Ensuring it is effective in end to end management of all portfolio management of Origin customers to resolve disputes affecting cash collections to increase speed to cash and proactively manage all debtors within the portfolio to pay accounts in line with the agreed and contracted payment terms.

The primary purpose of the Business Process Analyst is to drive innovation and ensure the function is well represented on key projects outside of the team (within C&C, and outside of C&C), to ensure change and process changes are managed without any degradation in performance.

IS THIS YOU?

The ideal candidate will have the following skills and experience:

  • Ensuring Credit & Collections Teams effectiveness through providing targeted insights to close identified capability gaps across the agent population
  • Drive incidents to satisfactory resolution
  • Ensure gaps in system and operational process are identified, fixed and / or appropriately documented for further follow up
  • Liaise with different stakeholders (internal & external) to gain exceptional process outcomes for our customers & the business
  • Drive frontline centre of excellence for frontline Process and SOP’s
  • Identify, Investigate and drive key process blockages or exception\performance issues and undertake remediation activities
  • Key conduit with C&C Initiatives and Process Development Team Provide support in change management, and testing of process changes
  • Stakeholder Management with key Retail interdependent departments i.e Billing, OBC, KM, Service, Sale

This is a fantastic opportunity for someone partner with the business to drive process improvement change

Our purpose drives everything. If you connect with Getting energy right for our customers, community and planet this role is for you.


For more information contact: Iain Pratt (03) 8665 7325

Requisition ID: 71798


Origin recognises Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples as the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia, and we pay our respects to Elders past, present and future.

IT Business Analyst
Description
At Mercedes-Benz Financial Services Australia we pride ourselves on our reputation for service excellence and our care in providing flexible, innovative and tailor-made finance and insurance solutions.

An exciting opportunity exists for a fixed term period within the Financial Services Information Technology team for an IT Business Analyst. The objective of this position is for the end to end delivery of enhancements into IT systems through the ITF Delivery model, specifically for the Mercedes-Benz Financial Services.

Specific responsibilities will also include:

  • Accountable for maintaining a suite of requirements across the enhancements including:
  • Business Requirements (from BRDs)
  • System Requirements (in HLDs and SRSs)
  • Vendor Requirements (in FSs and Technical Requirements)
  • Responsible for requirements traceability
  • Responsible for gathering, analysing and documenting requirements
  • Responsible for planning and executing workshops with the business and vendors
  • Accountable for ensuring the package of enhancements under management follow all the required Daimler ITM standards and processes

Qualifications
The person we seek will be a strong negotiator, confident and motivated professional with developed interpersonal skills and a drive to succeed. This person will have solid leadership skills that will assist in managing local and virtual project teams.


Specific Business Analysis experience in the Financial Services or consulting industry is preferred. Strong requirements gathering experience is essential for this role.

The successful candidate will have:

  • specific knowledge of Business Analysis methodologies and of Financial Services systems;
  • the ability to get in the detail and understand/ challenge enhancement requirements and system functionality; and
  • experience in managing cross-functional business stakeholders.

If you believe you are the right person for this exciting role, application close 5pm Wednesday 22nd May 2019.

Mercedes-Benz Financial Services proudly offers generous employee benefits, such as Employee Recognition and Rewards Programs, access to Learning & Development opportunities, on-site parking, discounted health insurance and much more.

Primary Location : Australia-Victoria-Mulgrave/Melbourne

Would you like to work in a dynamic and challenging environment where you will be supported to reach your potential? There are opportunities available for the role of State Business Analyst in Melbourne.

About the Role:


Working within the National Field environment, you will ensure that the accurate analysis of market performance is communicated to State Management. This analysis of statistical data and market information will support the monitoring, planning and development processes of the business in order to achieve sales & marketing objectives.

You will provide the State Management team with regular updates on progress against company targets and ensure all relevant data bases are maintained with the latest information. You will be a motivated, self-starter who strives to offer solutions and input on process improvements to maximise efficiency within the team, field force and across departments. There will also be an element of administrative support required in the day to day activities of the State Office that you will to support with.

About You:

You should ideally possess the following attributes:

  • Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel including defining & creating formula, macros and pivot tables as well as PowerPoint.
  • Strong analytical ability to proactively identify trends, issues and opportunities and translate these into insightful commercial stories and recommendations
  • Ability to effectively plan, organise and prioritise
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in addition to presentation skills
  • Resilience and initiative, with a ‘can do attitude


The Perks:

If you are successful, you will receive the following:

  • Competitive remuneration package including bonus
  • Above statutory superannuation
  • Company laptop and smart phone
  • Opportunities for regular Learning and Development training

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

company: Department of Justice and Community Safety
job_desc:
About us
,With Victoria's strong population growth and demand for services within the justice portfolio increasing at unprecedented rates, the scale of the infrastructure required to support this demand has never been more significant.
,The Community Safety Building Authority (CSBA) has been established to support the transformation required to create a public service that is more connected, agile and mobile to respond to these challenges.
,The CSBA supports the Department of Justice and Community Safety (DJCS) by planning, designing, procuring and building new infrastructure assets as well as modernising and upgrading existing ones.
,About the role
,As the Business Analyst you will contribute to a significant and high-profile security infrastructure program being led by the CSBA and delivered in collaboration with a range of program partners and stakeholders.
,
,
,
Please note this is a fixed term positon based in Melbourne.
,About you
,
,
,
Qualifications in business analysis, or equivalent experience are essential.
,How to apply
,Please click the Apply button at the bottom of this advertisement. Applications should include a resume and covering letter. Attachments can be uploaded in .doc, .docx, .pdf, .txt or .rtf formats.
, When submitting your application online, there will be questions pertaining to a number of the position's Key Selection Criteria to which you are required to respond.

Job Description:

This team is tasked with becoming the leading provider of solutions relating to data within the Microsoft stack, a goal to which we are well on our way to achieving.

You will be tasked with working directly with our customers to understand detailed business requirements surrounding data and translates these into designs and specifications for delivery by our build teams. You will position yourself as a "data champion" with our customers, working with them to realise the possibilities that leveraging data with cognitive capabilities can provide.

This role will involve working with customers to design innovative and cutting edge solutions in areas such as reporting, BI, IOT, machine learning and automation. Technical knowledge and experience within this domain is important, as is the ability to get hands on with delivery as required. However, this role is primarily focused on designing solutions and requires strong business acumen and ability to engage on conversations around key metrics and KPIs across areas such as finance, marketing, inventory, retail and manufacturing.

Required skills:

  • Strong experience in data analysis and interpretation, capturing user stories and business process specifications
  • Strong communication skills and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and educate key stakeholders
  • Ability to lead business focused workshops to facilitate strategic planning of Data & Intelligence projects
  • Strong business and financial modelling skills
  • Strong business acumen and strategic mindset
  • Actively participate in the production of a business model and BI reporting
  • Drive data & intelligence projects across multiple complex areas such as customer profiling, demand forecasting and predictive analytics.
  • Ability to understand and map complex data from multiple sources
  • Understanding of how to use data to predict trends & deliver business value
  • Ability to assist in the design of financial models and forecasts
  • Seek to continually improve processes and delivery outcomes
  • Strong project leadership capabilities
  • Minimum of 5 year’s professional experience in Data or Intelligence related roles
  • Ability to prioritize and manage a complex and changing set of requirements
  • Provide pre-sales assistance and assist the sales team to ensure clear client expectations for delivery
  • Perform product demonstrations to business and technical audiences
  • Achieve personal utilisation targets
  • Review project documents to ensure they meet quality standards

Beneficial Skills

  • Prior hands-on technical experience in data or intelligence project delivery
  • Masters/bachelors degree in business focused discipline
  • Prior experience with Microsoft Dynamics or AX
  • Microsoft Azure certification

company: Chartered Accountants Australia and New Zealand
job_desc:
Business Analyst - B2B Project

View Position Description



  • 12 Month Contract
  • Work within a SAFe Agile framework
  • Sydney CBD Location

We are a professional membership body supporting 120 000+ diverse, talented and financially astute members. We employ over 350 people in 14 locations across Australia, New Zealand, UK and Asia. When you join us, you have an opportunity to develop great skills & strong networks and do something different and fresh with your career.

“This exciting Project will support our delivery of a tailored and personalised approach to learning based on competency building and career progression. Through provision of a variety of learning experiences and delivery modes to create long term partnership with members and their employers”.

The Business Analyst – B2B Learning will work closely with Education & Learning business owners on a key initiative to develop an online capability diagnostic tool that connects members to learning solutions relevant to their development needs. The tool will be accessed by two key user groups being individual members (B2C) as well as partner organisations (B2B).


The role responsibility is:

  • Identifying and proactively engaging with key stakeholder groups to facilitate documentation of business requirements
  • Documenting high level and detailed functional and non-functional business requirements to form Business Requirement Documentation that inform the technology solution. This includes translating requirements into user stories with detailed supporting analysis, coordinating and prioritising user stories for implementation, and providing test and acceptance criteria for user stories and features
  • Contributing to the identification of potential technology solutions by mapping business requirements and business criteria to proposed technology solutions, identifying gaps and managing gap analysis to ensure solutions are fit for purpose.
  • Contributing to the development of Request for Quotation, managing the administration of RFQ responses and supporting the development of an implementation plan for selected partners.
  • Develop clear, concise and actionable project documents including those that support project briefs, business cases, and business requirements documentation


To be successful in this role, you will have:

  • 4+ years of experience performing business analysis in a cross-functional business environment
  • 2+ years in business process mapping and/or user journey mapping
  • 2+ year leading stakeholder workshops and presenting to project and leadership teams
  • Building strong working relationships and developing trust with internal and external partners
  • Developing a business case and business requirements document
  • Ability to document a business process as described by an end User (Promapp or other tools such as Viso) and user story in JIRA


What’s in it for you

At Chartered Accountants ANZ, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace reflecting the members we serve. As a value driven organisation, we collaborate for success, through integrity and being accountable for ourselves in the role we play to grow and improve as a team. Our benefits include Scholarship program, flexible workplace and staff benefits.

University Services comprises of 1,600 professional staff focused on providing client-centric and innovative services to the University. The group is providing transformational change, defining and influencing future service enhancements, and acts as a shared services function within the University of Melbourne.

About the role

The Support Analyst works closely with subject matter experts across Finance Services and other relevant areas to streamline current practice and procedures by investigating and pursuing opportunities for process and performance improvements that deliver value to stakeholders.

About you

  • Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline with relevant experience, or an equivalent combination of extensive relevant experience and/or education/training
  • Experience with service improvement methodologies, e.g. Lean, Six Sigma, Human Centred Design, Agile, etc
  • Demonstrated critical and analytical thinking
  • Ability to coordinate and support concurrent process improvement activities.
  • Able to work well with a range of people and work in a team

Business Analyst - Business Intelligence

12 Months Contract

Sydney CBD

A great opportunity has risen for experienced Business Analyst that has worked on a wide variety of Business Intelligence Projects.

The Role:

  • You will be involved in data analysis and assist in defining the data models and effectively provide data visualisations.
  • Liaise with stakeholders gathering requirements and developing documentation.
  • Review test cases and change requests.
  • Passionate about the latest BI trends and be able to provide new insights for better solutions.
  • Be involved with analysing data for forecasting and predictions.

About You:

  • 5 years experience in design and analysis of complex reporting across multiple platforms.
