job_title: Business Analyst | Digital Transformation & Data | Data Quality
job_desc:
This role sits within the Enterprise Data Management function and specifically the team that is responsible for building out the Enterprise Tools that are used to govern data across the organisation. The remit of the Enterprise Data Management team is quiet broad and you will utilise your previous Business Analyst experience and take on a range of responsibilities. This role has a focus on Data Quality and the implementation of a new Enterprise Data Quality Tool in Macquarie.

As part of your day to day duties you will work with the Enterprise Data Management Team and Business Teams to shape our data governance processes and support other teams on their data initiatives and projects to ensure they are getting value from our data tool-sets. You will take the lead in document requirements needed in our Data Quality Tool to support the data quality process and help the business teams to define and implement data quality rules and providing best practice guidelines in data quality. In addition, you will develop and deliver training material and templates to support on-boarding of the business community into our data quality tool.

You will have a good technical background and happy to work with business teams to elicit requirements and manage our stakeholder expectations. As a core quality you will have a core understanding of data and how data quality is managed in a large enterprise. Experience working in a data quality role or within a data governance function is important and hands on experience writing data quality rules and using enterprise data quality tools will be highly regarded.

You are a self-starter that is happy to take on ownership of their deliverables and take the initiative to drive end to end outcomes. In this role you will be required to facilitate workshops and user training.

In addition, you will also have a:

  • Good understanding of data management principles and data quality.
  • Exposure to data architecture or data modelling highly regarded.
  • Business requirements elicitation and documentation.
  • Use Case Design and User Story Development.
  • Strong communication skillset and the capability to facilitate workshops and training sessions.

If this opportunity interests and next career move, then please apply online.

Corporate Operations Group (COG) provides specialist professional services, human resources, workplace infrastructure, technology and market operations to Macquarie's businesses. The primary purpose of COG is to support and enhance the value of Macquarie through the creation of an efficient, scalable operating model. This is evident across the activities of each of the divisions which comprises of Business Improvement and Strategy Division (BIS), Business Services Division (BSD), COG Business Management, Human Resources Division (HR), Market Operations, Operational Risk Strategy and Support, Shared Services and Technology.

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats
  • Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions
  • Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies
  • Use data modeling practices to analyze your findings and create suggestions for strategic and operational improvements and changes
  • Designs new computer programs by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications
  • Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings
  • Consider the opportunities and potential risks attached to the suggestions you have made
  • Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management
  • Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports
  • Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance by establishing project budget
  • Monitors project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, recommending actions
  • Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements
  • Produce written documentation to support your work, report on your findings and to present to stakeholders when necessary
  • Participates in Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing
  • Managing competing resources and priorities
  • Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects

Qualification:

  • 3-5 years of experience in Business analytics, exploratory analysis, unstructured analysis, and creating analytics datasets
  • Should be open to learn quickly on new technologies like ASP.NET, AJAX, SQL Server, SharePoint development and web development
  • Proficient in SQL Server, SAS, Tableau and basic to intermediate skills in Amazon Web Services
  • Ability to design and develop advanced SQL or PL/SQL stored procedures using RDBMS concepts

job_title: Senior Business Intelligence/ Data Warehouse Analyst
job_desc:
Senior BI / Data Warehouse Analyst Contract Job in Brisbane, 6-month contract, Up to $89ph, MS Tech


Your new company
This well-established government department based in Brisbane CBD requires a Senior Business Intelligence/ Data Warehouse Analyst to join on a 6-month contract. The purpose of the role is to work on a variety of projects on behalf of Partnering Agencies, being responsible for the design and development of business intelligence and ETL solutions utilising the Microsoft BI tools.

Your new role
Working collaboratively across the wider team your responsibilities will include design and develop ETL, data transformation and data management processes using SSIS, Design and develop SSAS cubes and SSRS reports on both data warehouse and cubes. You will provide data modelling utilising Kimball principles, design and develop application to application integration and data management solutions, manage quality assurance including unit testing and support for SIT/UAT, compile supporting technical documentation as well as BAU data warehousing / business reporting whilst participating in team process improvement activities.

What you'll need to succeed
As the successful incumbent of the role you will have extensive working experience in Microsoft Business Intelligence with demonstrated experience in the following technologies: Microsoft SQL, server SSIS, SASS, MDX, SSRS, T-SQL, SQL 2012, SQL 2014, SQL 2016, MS Visual Studio and Power BI. You will have demonstrated strong working experience in data analysis, data modelling, data integration and database design as well as building data warehousing and business intelligence solutions. You will have the ability to work autonomously whilst communicating and collaborating with the wider team and business to utilise your strong analytical and problem-solving skills in an Agile development environment. Any experience with the following technologies will be highly regarded: MS Self-Service BI toolsets including Excel using PowerPivot or Power view, Team Foundation Server, SSRS with SharePoint, MDS, DQS as well as building application to application integration and data migration solutions

What you'll get in return
In return for your hard work and dedication you will be offered a 6-month contract with the opportunity of extensions and an hourly rate of up to $89 + Super depending on experience. You will be based in Brisbane CBD and will work within a dedicated team.

What you need to do now
If you’re interested in this role, click ‘apply now’ to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call Aden Daud now on (07) 3243 3044. If this job isn’t quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career. #2196784

Reporting & Analytics team in Melbourne. The incumbent will be responsible for all reporting needs for our Open Distribution - VADS and Gear Team in line with vendor and customer requirements.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist the business by defining, analyzing and documenting requirements
  • Daily, weekly, monthly reporting to deliver to vendor/customer contractual KPI's
  • Deriving analysis and recommendations for internal/external stakeholders to make sound business decision
  • Ensure data integrity, consistency and accuracy
  • Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements
  • Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects
  • Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements
  • Gathering critical information from meeting with various stakeholders and producing useful reports
  • Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management
  • Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings
  • Suggest and build automations and improvements to existing reports at every opportunity
  • Design and build dashboards and scorecards for internal/external stakeholders


Requirements/Skills
  • Business degree or equivalent desirable
  • Experience in mobile carriers or retail environment
  • Ability to prepare and deliver presentations to internal and external stakeholders
  • 5+ years of associated work experience
  • Advanced SQL database management and maintenance skills
  • Practical application ability with Microsoft Office and Visio, Advanced Excel skills required
  • Experience using Microsoft Power BI
  • Strong experience in user testing and project management
  • Strong communication/interpersonal skills

Are you a Brightstar?
At Brightstar, we handle every stage of a mobile device's lifecycle for our customers-from the moment it's manufactured to trade in and re-sale, and everything in between.

This industry moves fast. But so do we. What's innovative today might become outdated tomorrow, so we have to be able to see the big picture and sweat the small details. Doing that successfully takes trust, teamwork and a knack for making the complicated simple.

We're looking for creative, quick and relentless talent to join the team. Are you one of us?

Would you like to work in a dynamic and challenging environment where you will be supported to reach your potential? There are opportunities available for the role of State Business Analyst in Melbourne.

About the Role:


Working within the National Field environment, you will ensure that the accurate analysis of market performance is communicated to State Management. This analysis of statistical data and market information will support the monitoring, planning and development processes of the business in order to achieve sales & marketing objectives.

You will provide the State Management team with regular updates on progress against company targets and ensure all relevant data bases are maintained with the latest information. You will be a motivated, self-starter who strives to offer solutions and input on process improvements to maximise efficiency within the team, field force and across departments. There will also be an element of administrative support required in the day to day activities of the State Office that you will to support with.

About You:

You should ideally possess the following attributes:

  • Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel including defining & creating formula, macros and pivot tables as well as PowerPoint.
  • Strong analytical ability to proactively identify trends, issues and opportunities and translate these into insightful commercial stories and recommendations
  • Ability to effectively plan, organise and prioritise
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in addition to presentation skills
  • Resilience and initiative, with a ‘can do attitude


The Perks:

If you are successful, you will receive the following:

  • Competitive remuneration package including bonus
  • Above statutory superannuation
  • Company laptop and smart phone
  • Opportunities for regular Learning and Development training

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

Path4 Technology is currently recruiting for a Business Intelligence/Data Warehouse Analyst for an initial 6 month contract with possible extension. this role is based in Brisbane's CBD with a Queensland Government client.

Job no: 500779
Work type: Full Time
Location: Sydney
Categories: Workers Compensation, RTWSS

Do you have a passion to make a difference and help people get their lives back after injury or illness?

  • Do you have an experience in the workers compensation industry and strong analytical and reporting skills?
  • Provide support and detailed analysis of claims portfolio and guidewire system
  • We help people get their lives back on track after a workplace injury

EML is a leading Workers Compensation Insurance company. We now have over 2000 employees and are still growing which means an amazing and diverse culture with a very high internal promotion rate.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As part of our diverse team based in Sydney CBD , you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.

You will assist to identify and assess risks by working collaboratively with Senior Managers, and key stakeholders to manage key risks and identify corrective and preventative actions that minimise financial, reputational and operational risks to EML.

The role requires a collaborative and consultative approach, working with iCare and business leaders to identify critical issues.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Providing incisive analysis and making recommendations to enhance and improve current claims management processes, and performance.
  • Modelling performance and financial outcomes.
  • Provide assistance to understand claims management practices and emerging experience trends
  • Make recommendations to enhance and improve current processes for data collation and extraction, monitoring and reporting.
  • Deliver detailed analysis of portfolio trends, utilizing information to make strategic decisions

ABOUT YOU

  • Sound knowledge and experience of Workers Compensation Insurance
  • Demonstrated experience in QlikSense / QlikView and SAS highly desirable
  • Data interpretation and visualisation experience.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as in a team
  • Excellent communication and problem solving skills are a must.
  • Must have strong analytical/reporting skills
  • Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline is highly desirable

WHAT WE OFFER

We stand together as equals. EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.

EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including:

  • Onsite Learning and Development Team
  • End of Month Celebration Events
  • 17.5% Annual Leave Loading
  • Free Fruit Boxes
  • Free Onsite Pilates,Yoga and Fitness Classes

We value our people and are committed to supporting our employees by investing in their professional development and providing generous employee benefits. If this is of interest to you, please or for more information/confidential conversation please contact Mary Norouzifar on 0280713623.

The Applied Intelligence division of BAE Systems delivers solutions which protect and enhance the connected world. Everything we do creates a safer future.

We want to solve problems for our customers and by bringing together great minds, we can work together to make the world a safer place.

Role Summary

We’re looking for an experienced Business Consultant/Analyst to play a key role in our professional services team based in Melbourne.

This is an exciting opportunity for a Business Analyst who is a critical thinker and solution oriented to join our Professional Services team in the Financial and Banking Sector. The ideal candidate will be passionate about tackling challenges and be able to multi task on various projects.

Responsibilities

The successful candidate will take responsibility for investigative work to determine business requirements and specify effective business processes, through improvements in information systems, information management, practices, procedures, and organisation change.

Our projects and consulting engagements focus on a client’s business requirements, analysing and documenting these and then supporting the design and implementation of solutions.

The Business Consultant will work with a wide range of stakeholders to understand and address a wide range of client challenges.

Requirements

  • Have minimum 2-5 years of business analysis or consultancy experience
  • The candidate will come from a Business Analyst or consultancy role within a tier 1 or 2 consultancy firm or financial institution
  • Must have solid experience working with technology projects within financial services or government
  • Familiarity with Software development lifecycle, including analysis , design, development, testing
  • Have excellent communications skills and must feel comfortable presenting in front of customers on a professional level
  • Able to multitask and handle multiple project and client engagements simultaneously and adapt to a fast pace environment
  • Available to travel, though most projects are expected to be based in Melbourne.

Desirable

  • Domain experience in one or more of; AML/CTF/Sanctions, NPP/payments or Fraud/ Financial Crime
  • Exposure to both Waterfall and Agile software development methodologies
  • Exposure to all aspects of testing including the creation of internal and external test plans and test strategies
  • Familiarity with various project management methodologies including Waterfall and Agile development methodologies

Security Clearance is required for this vacancy. If you are not currently Security Cleared, you will need to be eligible for this and willing to go through the process. For more guidance on National Security Vetting please click here.

About BAE Systems Applied Intelligence:

We help nations, governments and businesses around the world defend themselves against cyber crime, reduce their risk in the connected world, comply with regulation, and transform their operations. We do this using our unique set of solutions, systems, experience and processes.

Our success is down to our people. The changing nature of our business means that we’re constantly looking for the brightest talent to help us fulfil our ambitions. As an experienced professional, we’ll entrust you with responsibility; this means that you’ll have client contact, variety and support from day one.

We'll encourage and support you to develop your skills and reward you as you grow. Whatever your area of expertise, you'll be much more than just a job title; you'll be an integral part of the business where your individual contribution makes a difference every day. Great minds deserve great rewards, so we also offer a very competitive salary and benefits package.

Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Applied Intelligence. Staying competitive in today’s global marketplace requires an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds – the best and brightest minds – can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential. We also welcome discussions about flexible working.

Division Overview: Commercial Solutions

BAE Systems has been in the business of protecting some of the world’s most important assets and networks for over 100 years. We apply the same techniques, intelligence and strategy used in defending nations and governments to businesses as well. That’s us – Commercial Solutions - a division of BAE Systems that specializes in providing businesses around the globe with the products and services they need to stay protected in today’s connected world.

We offer a broad portfolio of on premise, managed and cloud-based products and services that are proven to protect our clients against financial crime and persistent cyber attackers.

We aim to be a global industry-leading, cyber and financial crime products business and will do this by leveraging the BAE Systems brand and by delivering higher grade security solutions for our clients.

Help us secure a connected world by being an unseen hero. Apply now and be inspired.

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management
  • Optimize workflow management to ensure traceability back to strategic alignment
  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)
“We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you."

To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.anz.com/careers. You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for reference number AUS099344

TELSTRA HEALTH

Our vision is to be the technology provider of choice for the Australian healthcare sector to find better ways to serve patients in a connected world.

THE TEAM

Our Emerging Markets business provide a range of clinical and business applications to the market, most notably Remote Patient Monitoring, HealthNow and the Telehealth Platform. Our solutions are designed to help organisations to provide better healthcare to patients, while maintaining levels of quality and safety.

THE ROLE

The Business Analyst is a key role in delivering the Information and Technology capital program for the Emerging Markets team. This role is critical in the delivery of Emerging Markets product solutions, and will be responsible for maximising delivery of functionality, quality of IT products, and successful delivery of product roadmap.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Manage the collection and documentation of approved roadmap functionality in alignment with the Product Governance framework
  • Providing support to Product Management team for the delivery of requested functionality as presented in the approved Product Roadmap.
  • Update and maintain the Product Governance Framework including analysis, design and stakeholder approval process.
  • Interpret business requirements into user stories as part of the Agile delivery methodology.
  • Provide clearly identified acceptance criteria that is both measurable and realised.
  • Workshop facilitation and communication of business requirements to delivery team members.
  • Play a key role in collaborative development activities (e.g. sprint planning, stand-ups, refinement and reviews)
  • Lead product reviews to ensure business requirements are being met by technical delivery team
  • Provision of technical training and ongoing support material to relevant internal and external stakeholders.
  • Proactively engaging and working with stakeholders to support the implementation and support of new product features.
  • Consistently role modelling the Telstra Health values.
  • Actively participating in the Telstra Health community, sharing and re-applying skills and knowledge and bringing in best practice.

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

MANDATORY

  • You will have a proven amount of experience as a Business Analyst role within a technical team
  • Practical experience in the application of professional project management principles and practices for the delivery of end-to-end software solutions.
  • Agile accredited certification or equivalent experience.
  • Experience in the development of web and mobile application interfaces
  • Experience in managing Agile ceremonies including or equivalent to Feature Kick-Offs, Sprint Planning, refinement and reviews
  • Detail requirements for Proof of Concepts and product prototyping
  • Experience with the Atlassian toolset (JIRA and Confluence specifically)


DESIRABLE

  • Previous Health industry experience within software development
  • Experience in Digital Transformation projects
  • Experience in Governance processes
  • Current knowledge of information technology trends
  • Bachelor Degree or Higher Degree in relevant field such as Business Administration, Information Technology, Engineering or Computer Science with substantial experience in information technology and telecommunications networks or systems research and development.

About the role


We are seeking to appoint a talented individual for the role of Business Analyst based at State Transport team in Mulgrave, VIC.


The Business Analyst Transport role is responsible for financial and analytical analysis and reporting as well as for providing financial and commercial support to State Transport team as required by the business.


This includes responsibility for State Transport related budget, forecasting, performance and financial results reporting, transport analytics support and overall centralised data ownership for the scope.


As a member of our team, your key responsibilities include:


  • Manage financial and commercial reporting for the State Transport scope
  • Manage ongoing and ad hoc analytics as required by business
  • Manage database and statistics within State Transport task
  • Identify commercial, network or operational opportunities improve cost outcomes for Transport
  • Work closely with the Regional Commercial Manager and ensure Transport practices and processes align with Commercial Management across the broader Regional Supply Chain structure.
  • Provide analytical support to Leadership teams by assembling and summarising data, preparing reports, making presentations of findings, analyses and recommendations
  • Support Finance and Leadership teams with the annual budget and forecasting process, working across all State transport teams to ensure all requirements are completed in a timely and accurate manner
  • Own data and statistics management task acting as single centralised Data source for State Transport function
  • Work with National teams to maintain consistent data approaches and sources of information without creating isolated information repositories

To be considered for this role you should have the following:


  • Tertiary or Diploma qualifications in finance and/or accounting or demonstrated experience
  • in a finance environment
  • CPA/CA/CIMA qualified or part qualified
  • Experience in or solid understanding of Supply Chain operations
  • Highly skilled in the use of Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets and Financial modeling tools
  • Experience with statistical analysis and financial forecasting
  • At least 2 years’ relevant experience, preferably as a Finance Analyst.
  • Previous experience in FMCG or Manufacturing
  • Attention to detail and the ability to identify data patterns
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong technical accounting skills
  • Planning and problem solving skills and ability to prioritise and manage multiple tasks
  • Ability to work to tight deadlines
  • Strong focus on continuous improvement
  • Willingness to travel between the Victoria Supply Chain facilities will be critical in this role, however the base location will currently be Mulgrave.

What we can offer you:


  • Attractive remuneration package consisting of base salary, superannuation and incentive scheme.
  • Added benefits including staff discount, free secure parking and corporate healthcare options.
  • Training and education - we pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential.
  • An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people.

Job Description

Sibelco mines and manufactures a wide range of mineral products for local and international markets. Founded in 1872, Sibelco began in Europe and has grown into one of the largest industrial mineral companies in the world - privately owned, multinational, with enviable long-term growth, and a great organisational culture. Sibelco owns and operates 40 industrial mining and processing operations in 12 Asia Pacific countries (including Australia and New Zealand).

We are currently seeking a Corporate Business Analyst join our Finance team serving our APAC lime and limestone business for a 6 month fixed term contract based in our North Sydney office.

Reporting to the VP Finance of the Lime and Limestone Business Unit, this role will partner with the Sibelco Asia Pacific operations, commercial and finance team providing decision support for capital expenditure and strategy as well as reviewing operational performance

A true business partner role, the successful appointment will support senior operational, commercial and financial management, influencing operational decision making and constructively challenge the business based on analysis of data and expert insight of operations cost & revenue structures, evolution and trends, to facilitate optimal operational outcomes.

Key Responsibilities Include;

  • Provide analytical support including preparation of reports, data and PowerPoint presentations.
  • Jointly review and analyse the operations costs, capacity utilisation and production forecasts, challenging assumptions and identify risks and opportunities.
  • Provide support, reports and analysis to business partners and the finance team for the development of budgets, forecasts and the strategic business plan.
  • Financial expertise and deep-dive analyses: as financial partner develop and leverage a deep understanding of the cost structure of our products, the sales and product mix, and how production & sales relationships impact plant profitability.
  • Prepare business cases in support of capital expenditure, operational & commercial strategy and networking optimisation.

Key Requirements Include;

  • A tertiary qualification in accounting, finance, or engineering that is supported by proven experience in a multi-national organisation.
  • CA, CPA or CIMA qualified, or, equivalent qualification preferred.
  • Advanced user in MS Excel (essential) as well as experience with a large Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system, Online Analytical Processing (OLAP), Business Information (BI) tools.
  • Expertise in financial modelling with the ability to prepare and present complex data in a simple and understandable manner.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively engage with numerous stakeholders to understand competing requirements, influence outcomes and deliver effective services.
  • Experience in the mining or manufacturing industries would be desirable .
  • Ability to travel within Asia Pacific as required to company mining and processing operations.

Sibelco recognise the strength of our diverse global workforce and value difference in gender, age, disability, religion, nationality, ethnicity and sexual orientation. Our rich mix of people bring an exciting exchange of ideas and knowledge that keeps us moving forward and innovating new solutions. We seek talent of all backgrounds and abilities and continue to develop our leaders and our culture to help all employees, no matter our differences, to grow and reach their full potential.

Applications (cover letter & CV) can be sent via the careers page on our web site at www.sibelco.com.au no later than Wednesday 29th May 2019.

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

What we're looking for…
We're looking for an experienced Business Analyst with hands-on experience in digital/software development projects that have employed Agile/Lean/Kanban techniques and methodologies.

You have experience building and maintaining collaborative relationships with a diverse range of technical and business partners.

You are confident in your abilities to work autonomously on client sites, leading and driving teams towards innovative solutions that satisfy business needs.

This role would suit someone with a good understanding of the web and with an appreciation of its importance in the future of marketing and business success. You must also have a keen interest in user experience and an understanding of the importance of user insights to help improve the customer experience and business success of digital channels.

To do this, we need someone who can:

  • Translate business requirements into clear, concise, testable and accurate user stories & process flows
  • Ensure that requirements are understood by Software Developers and Quality Analysts through story kick offs and constant communication
  • Contribute to the team's understanding and prioritisation during iteration planning meetings
  • Have great analytical skills and techniques to support analysis
  • Able to identify and communicate any requirement dependencies, issues or risks identified through the analysis process
  • Experienced in working with Data and Reports
  • Technically familiar with web technologies and complex data systems
  • Experienced working in an Agile environment
  • Able to learn fast and willing to try new things

You bring

  • Excellent client relationship skills: You must be able to create rapport and relationships across a range of clients and functions.
  • Excellent communication skills: You must be fully-confident taking on a client-facing role with the necessary skills required to work with and manage clients, suppliers and colleagues.
  • Passion and creative thinking: We’re passionate about delivering high-quality, effective and value-added services to our clients.
  • Attention to detail: We pride ourselves on the quality of our deliverables, from an email to a client presentation. Achieving this, especially when under pressure, is a critical success factor for the role.
  • A sound understanding of Agile Scrum methodology and proven experience using JIRA and Confluence

You’ll be offered

  • The opportunity to learn and grow with a professional, innovative team
  • Ongoing personal and professional development
  • A professional development budget and planning
  • A commitment to work/life balance

This position is within the Enterprise IT area of Lockheed Martin Australia. This role is to provide internal capability around Microsoft SharePoint and SharePoint related technologies.

Key focus for this role will be to ensure that all modifications and customisations are done so in-line with Microsoft best practice; While leveraging advanced configuration over typical code-based customisations. Other tasks include but are not limited to:

  • Assist in the migration of existing SharePoint 2010 sites and solutions to 2013/2016 based platforms

  • Migrate business units, departments, and functional teams into new SharePoint sites/functionality

  • Develop business process automation solutions through the use of SharePoint (Workflow, Forms, etc)

  • Provide BAU type support for existing SharePoint users

  • Deliver structured SharePoint training to the business

Your users are distributed around Australia, so some interstate travel may be required. A majority of the work will be done remotely and within virtual project teams, while reporting to the APAC applications manager.


About you:

Candidates possessing experience in working with Microsoft SharePoint 2010, 2013, and 2016 and proficient in SharePoint Designer, Workflows, and Custom Web Parts will be of interest to us. In addition to this you have a sound understanding of SharePoint Search, and Search based solutions. Confidence in the use of Microsoft Office and competent in the use of Software, Hardware, Systems, and ICT Engineering frameworks, processes and technologies give you the core skills we are seeking to hire.

Any exposure to working within an Australian Defence security environment will set you apart.


Special Requirements:

Eligibility to secure NV1 Security Clearance


What we offer you:

Opportunity in a newly created position allows you to make an impact.

By leveraging our employees’ unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

Liebherr-Australia Pty Ltd is part of the Liebherr Group, which employs approximately 46,000 people, in more than 130 autonomous companies and 50 countries globally. Liebherr’s decades of experience, knowledge, and dedication to the highest quality and most reliable technologies makes Liebherr a respected leader and a trustworthy partner to industry. Liebherr-Australia is responsible for selling and servicing earthmoving machinery, mining equipment, mobile cranes as well as foundation and piling equipment throughout Australia and New Zealand. The company’s 20 hectare Head Office Complex boasts a national distribution centre and remanufacturing centre, with a state-of-the-art technical training centre due to open in April 2019.

Liebherr Australia has a fantastic career opportunity for a suitably qualified and experienced Analyst to join the team in the Brisbane South Office. Reporting to the Executive General Manager Sales & Marketing, the Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for providing accurate analysis and reporting on market trends, equipment competitiveness, Product Lifecycle costings and the management of the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) database. Working closely with the Sales, Marketing, Product Management and Customer Service teams you will ensure effective and timely critical information is available to assist in identifying opportunities, solutions, current market trends and ultimately machine reliability & customer satisfaction.
The successful candidate will have a proven track record in:
  • Practical and effective use of Customer Relationship Management Software - operational, analytical and strategic (collaborative) CRM.
  • Collection, analysis and solution based application of competitive market data (maintenance costs and machines installed)
  • Effective use and understanding of Life Cycle Costings software/tool. Assistance with automation and self-service migration.
  • Maintenance input, review, data extraction of CRM tool
  • Analysis of externally sourced data e.g. ERG and Parker Bay
  • Generating Lost Order, LCC, management reports and Production estimates
  • Improvement of the CRM experience through training, sharing and providing information
  • Establishing long term, robust and effective customer relationships
  • Providing exceptional customer service.
You are confident in your abilities, great at building long-term relationships, an excellent communicator, customer focussed and an influential team member.
You hold University qualifications in the Finance, Management, IT or Business disciplines and ideally possess a technical mind or qualifications in a technical trade or area would be highly regarded. Industry experience would also be viewed favourably.
A very attractive salary package is on offer to secure the right candidate.

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management
  • Optimize workflow management to ensure traceability back to strategic alignment
  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)

Role Description

Analysis, Policy and Research
Ongoing, full-time position located in East Melbourne Location


Catholic Education Melbourne (CEM) is a dynamic education service provider to 331 Catholic primary, secondary and special schools in the Archdiocese of Melbourne. More than 450 staff work across the head office in East Melbourne and four regional offices in the North, East, South and West. CEM provides services to schools in areas as diverse as Curriculum, Religious Education, Finance, ICT, Marketing and Communications, Student Wellbeing, Legal, Planning and Industrial Relations. This community is committed to the safety, wellbeing and protection of all children in our care.


ABOUT THE POSITION
Working as an integral part of the Analysis, Policy and Research Team, the objective of the Performance and Reporting Data Analyst is to deliver strategic improvement across CEM to better serve and lead schools through corporate planning and strategic management processes, effective monitoring, analysis and reporting of CEM performance against key indicators and provision of advice that underpins effective decision-making and informs system wide policy development and review.


ABOUT YOU
To be successful in this role you will have an analytical mindset and expertise in performance monitoring, reporting, and sound computer literacy skills and experience in extracting and manipulating large datasets. You will have experience in creating compelling reports, dashboards, and visualisations to a range of stakeholders and enjoy working across teams to prioritise business and information needs. Your attention to detail and the ability to follow processes thoroughly, analyse and assess information and articulate options to resolve complex issues are key requirements.

We offer an inclusive work environment with the opportunity to learn from and collaborate with team members and stakeholders who bring together a wide range of skills and experience. The ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders at all levels is essential.

The successful applicant will also be subject to a Working with Children Check and a National Police Record Check.

Special Requirements

QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
  • An appropriate tertiary education qualification in a relevant field
  • Statistical or mathematical knowledge and experience
  • Experience in the interpretation, presentation and communication of quantitative and qualitative data.

KEY SELECTION CRITERIA
  • Advanced data analysis and reporting skills including experience in statistical methods, survey design and analysis.
  • Demonstrated proficiency and experience in the use of computer applications such as SQL, Excel, SPSS, Microsoft Office, Tableau and on line survey applications.
  • Highly developed written skills and experience in the preparation and delivery of presentations, reports, proposals, briefing papers and correspondence to management.
  • Demonstrated project management and high level consulting skills and the ability to manage multiple competing priorities and proactive resolution of issues.
  • Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills including the ability to build relationships with staff and stakeholders as well as a commitment to teamwork.
  • A commitment to the principles of Catholic teaching and policies of the CEM.

Application Procedures

Applicants need to provide:
a) a separate statement addressing the Key Selection Criteria
b) a cover letter
c) an up-to-date Curriculum Vitae
d) the contact details for two employment referees (upon request).

Applications can be uploaded via the 'Apply' tab on the Catholic Education Melbourne website. All enquiries can be directed to the Recruitment Officer at recruitment@cem.edu.au or (03) 9267 0228.

Job Description

From humble beginnings almost 70 years ago, John Holland has been driving positive change in Australia, and is now one of the nation’s leading infrastructure and property companies.



We work in Australia, New Zealand and South East Asia offering services from infrastructure and property development, to rail and building.

By finding solutions to complex challenges, we transform communities to make them easier to move around, more connected and better to live in.



This position based will be based in either Sydney or Melbourne and will help find new and more adaptive ways to solve problems and deliver value by providing expert process, data and systems analysis and ideation to John Holland’s company wide Applications, Systems and Enterprise data.


Responsibilities of the role include;

  • Understand John Holland’s business needs by analysing and defining business processes, systems and data across all business areas to deliver fit-for-purpose solutions
  • Develop and manage relationships with internal business stakeholders, SMEs & ICT colleagues
  • Liaise between John Holland business stakeholders/SMEs and John Holland ICT colleagues to elicit & validate business requirements
  • Translate business requirements into technical requirements, ensuring requirements are documented and clearly articulated to ICT colleagues
  • Deliver improvements to John Holland systems and processes utilising SDLC or Agile development methods

To be successful in this key role, you must have:

  • Minimum 4 years’ experience in Business Analysis with advanced understanding of business analysis tasks and techniques
  • Strong understanding and experience of the full SDLC
  • Exposure to Agile development methods
  • Advanced skills in facilitating workshops
  • Experience dealing with business stakeholders/SMEs across all levels & negotiating outcomes.

From Parliament House to the Alice to Darwin Rail Link, from the MCG’s Great Southern Stand to Sydney Metro, we’ve had a hand in the Australia we all know today. We are currently involved in delivering all of Australia’s largest infrastructure projects. Whatever we face, the heart of what we do is creating people-centred solutions to complex challenges and opportunities. We think deeply about what we do and how it affects communities. We push boundaries and innovate, gain trust through our actions and whatever the project, we’re in it for the long, long term.


We work hard to attract and retain the best employees, and we provide opportunities for rich career experiences, and a strong framework for on-going career development.

Location : Melbourne

Position : Immediate

Requirement

The incumbent will be responsible for the below mentioned roles and responsibilities.

  • Identify the scope of automation along with operations team through feasible study
  • Analyze and model the business domain to create a complete picture of work-flows and technical requirements fulfilled by existing and proposed software
  • Create functional requirements in use cases and coordinate requirements walk-through and sign-offs
  • Enabling the technical team to gauge the requirements from a functional perspective to define the business problem and primary objectives of the project
  • Perform detail analysis of the process and prepare a Process Understanding Document along with AS IS & TO BE process maps
  • Perform requirement gathering and design robotics solution for the processes.
  • Creating detailed project road maps, plans, schedules, support structure, and work breakdown structures
  • Create user manuals, administrator Instructions, developer document activity diagrams and map processes and data flow
  • Create Benefit Summary/Case, detailed RACI matrix and CBA of projects
  • Analytics, Expertise in Six Sigma approach

Skills


Looking for an Experienced Senior Business Analyst with a demonstrated history of working in the information technology and services industry (Preferably Capital market, Investment Banking, Retail banking) skilled in Feasibility Study, Requirement Gathering, Gap Analysis, Business Documentation, and Analytical Skills. Overall more than 2 – 4 years of experience in BA role

Email CV to amits@fortuneselect.com

Would you like to work in a dynamic and challenging environment where you will be supported to reach your potential? There are opportunities available for the role of State Business Analyst in Melbourne.

About the Role:


Working within the National Field environment, you will ensure that the accurate analysis of market performance is communicated to State Management. This analysis of statistical data and market information will support the monitoring, planning and development processes of the business in order to achieve sales & marketing objectives.

You will provide the State Management team with regular updates on progress against company targets and ensure all relevant data bases are maintained with the latest information. You will be a motivated, self-starter who strives to offer solutions and input on process improvements to maximise efficiency within the team, field force and across departments. There will also be an element of administrative support required in the day to day activities of the State Office that you will to support with.

About You:

You should ideally possess the following attributes:

  • Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel including defining & creating formula, macros and pivot tables as well as PowerPoint.
  • Strong analytical ability to proactively identify trends, issues and opportunities and translate these into insightful commercial stories and recommendations
  • Ability to effectively plan, organise and prioritise
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in addition to presentation skills
  • Resilience and initiative, with a ‘can do attitude


The Perks:

If you are successful, you will receive the following:

  • Competitive remuneration package including bonus
  • Above statutory superannuation
  • Company laptop and smart phone
  • Opportunities for regular Learning and Development training

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

About BDO:

BDO is the largest mid-market professional service provider globally, with the depth and breadth of services to deliver on all of your clients’ needs. At BDO, exceptional client service underpins our belief system and all aspects of service delivery to our clients. Our culture is collaborative and personal, and we recognise that to deliver exceptional service, we must provide an empowering and flexible environment for our people.


Current Opportunity:

An exciting opportunity for an Analyst to join the Business Restructuring team based in Melbourne. The BDO Business Restructuring team focuses on a variety of engagements including profit improvement, debt restructuring, liquidations, voluntary administrations and receiverships.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Applying appropriate checklists and quality control procedures to client engagements
  • Planning, monitoring and execution of corporate insolvency engagements
  • Preparation of reports to creditors and financiers
  • Compiling information, drawing conclusions and making recommendations
  • Ensures all working papers are accurate and file is maintained in appropriate manner
  • Ensures investigations are completed and any identified contraventions are reported on a timely basis
  • Compliance with firm based L&OD programs and participates in training and development to keep abreast of the corporate market

Qualifications, Skills and Experience Required:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Commerce, Business, Law or other relevant studies
  • Studying or recently completed CA
  • A minimum of 12 months’ corporate insolvency experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Drive to build a career in the specialised area of restructuring and insolvency
  • Strong time management skills, a proactive attitude and attention to detail
  • Strong problem solving, financial analysis and investigative skills
  • Able to contribute and collaborate in a team environment and staff across the business
  • Thorough understanding and experience of Microsoft Suite, particularly Outlook, Word and Excel
  • Experience using MYOB suite is advantageous

What we will offer you

In addition to an industry competitive salary package, BDO offers a culture that emphasises career growth, professional development, collaborative culture, workplace flexibility and global opportunities.

To submit your application please click Apply Now!

SAP Business Intelligence Analyst

  • Ongoing | Full Time | Salary commensurate with experience
  • Sutherland Shire | Work-life balance | Health & Wellbeing Programs
  • Pivotal role within SAP and analytics landscape at ANSTO



About ANSTO

ANSTO leverages great science to deliver big outcomes. We partner with scientists and engineers and apply new technologies to provide real-world benefits. Our work improves human health, saves lives, builds our industries and protects the environment. ANSTO is the home of Australia’s most significant landmark and national infrastructure for research. Thousands of scientists from industry and academia benefit from gaining access to state-of-the-art instruments every year.
We operate much of our country’s landmark science facilities including one of the world’s most modern nuclear research reactors (OPAL). Importantly, ANSTO is helping to improve our health with one in two Australians benefitting from the nuclear medicines produced using the OPAL research reactor while being treated for serious illnesses such as heart disease and cancer.

About the position

The SAP Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst maintains business critical reporting operations and the integrity of the SAP Business Warehouse (BW), Business Objects (BObj) and Business Planning & Consolidation (BPC) application. The SAP BI Analyst also interacts and engages with business stakeholders, manages change requests and participates in project work in order to deliver highly detailed and impactful insights to ANSTO.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Ensure integrity and maintenance of business critical operations in SAP (BW\BOBJ\BPC) as required including problem solving and operational support.
  • Utilise data modelling and analysis skills to gather, analyse and document user requirements to enable the definition of BI Solutions utilising ANSTO’s standards, guidelines and change processes as required.
  • Undertake configuration and development of infocubes, ODS’s, multiproviders, extractors, queries and any other objects as required to implement Change requests and Projects.
  • Undertake configuration or development of BOBJ\BPC objects as required to implement Change requests and Projects.



Skills and Experience

  • Degree in relevant discipline such as Information Technology or relevant discipline including SAP certification.
  • Significant experience in SAP Business Analysis including requirements gathering, analysing and documenting user requirements to enable the definition of BI Solutions.
  • Significant experience in SAP Business Warehouse including reporting and query development skills with data modelling, data extraction and load monitoring skills.



“We are looking to recruit a knowledgeable, driven and innovative person that will work with the team to deliver a solid BW foundation and provide high impact analytics.” - Adam Barry, Development & Analytics Manager


Why join ANSTO?

ANSTO employees are passionate about what they do. We enjoy being part of an organisation making a difference in the lives of Australians.

We support and reward our employees through eligibility for:
  • Training, development and mentoring opportunities
  • Performance based salary increases
  • Work-life balance with generous leave entitlements and flexible conditions
Located in the Sutherland Shire, we have free onsite parking, a swimming pool, health and wellbeing programs and an onsite café.

If you want to join a world class organisation that’s making a difference in the lives of Australians, apply now!


For further technical information relating to this position please refer to the Position Information Package or contact Adam Barry on (02) 9717 3431. For all other queries please contact the HR Shared Services Team on +61 (02) 9717 3111 (press 3 for HR).

To be eligible for appointment, applicants will require a security and pre-employment medical assessment

All applicants must be Australian citizens.

Applications must be submitted online.

At ANSTO, we understand that diverse teams produce better outcomes – and we value the merit that a diverse perspective can bring to our team. We encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply for our roles including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, primary carers, those with a disability, and women in STEM. Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management
  • Optimize workflow management to ensure traceability back to strategic alignment
  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)
