Would you like to work in a dynamic and challenging environment where you will be supported to reach your potential? There are opportunities available for the role of State Business Analyst in Melbourne.

About the Role:


Working within the National Field environment, you will ensure that the accurate analysis of market performance is communicated to State Management. This analysis of statistical data and market information will support the monitoring, planning and development processes of the business in order to achieve sales & marketing objectives.

You will provide the State Management team with regular updates on progress against company targets and ensure all relevant data bases are maintained with the latest information. You will be a motivated, self-starter who strives to offer solutions and input on process improvements to maximise efficiency within the team, field force and across departments. There will also be an element of administrative support required in the day to day activities of the State Office that you will to support with.

About You:

You should ideally possess the following attributes:

  • Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel including defining & creating formula, macros and pivot tables as well as PowerPoint.
  • Strong analytical ability to proactively identify trends, issues and opportunities and translate these into insightful commercial stories and recommendations
  • Ability to effectively plan, organise and prioritise
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in addition to presentation skills
  • Resilience and initiative, with a ‘can do attitude


The Perks:

If you are successful, you will receive the following:

  • Competitive remuneration package including bonus
  • Above statutory superannuation
  • Company laptop and smart phone
  • Opportunities for regular Learning and Development training

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

We are looking for an experienced Solution Architect in the BI/DW space.

The role will give you the opportunity to work with multiple clients on interesting projects, flexing your design oriented brain on a daily basis.

Skills Required

  • 10 years’ experience as an IT professional
  • At least 5 solid years’ experience working as a Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence Architect
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Experience in Microsoft SQL Server Technologies (SQL and OLAP)
  • Previous experience building a Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence Solutions.
  • Strong ETL experience
  • Excellent dimensional design skills based on the concepts of Ralph Kimball.
  • Broad experience and ability to work across many projects.
  • Knowledge to support design elements, their specifications, prices, installation and configuration methods
  • Some experience within government or government type organisations desirable.

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management
  • Optimize workflow management to ensure traceability back to strategic alignment
  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)

Australian Unity is a national health, wealth and living mutual company providing products and services designed to help people thrive. More than one million Australians have created a brighter future with us. We are a mutual organisation with 280,000 members, more than 7000 employees and generating more than $2 billion in revenue per annum.

Y our Role

An exciting opportunity has become available in our Wealth & Capital Markets (W&CM) business for a Senior Business Analyst.

Reporting directly to the Registry Transition Manager, you will work on a high profile program of work with a focus on membership of our W&CM products, member value proposition, member register solution and supporting processes. This program is aligned to driving greater efficiency and effectiveness across the group to fund our future growth and to enable Australian Unity to put the customer at the heart of what we do.

You will use your strong stakeholder engagement skills to facilitate workshops and ensure business requirements are met and will also help guide and support the business on delivering better solutions.

This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting project working with stakeholders across a variety of business areas and domains.

To be successful in securing this role you will have/be:

  • Extensive relevant BA experience
  • A demonstrated track record of delivering high quality business requirement documentation
  • Demonstrated experience in business process mapping, documenting new operating models and process re-engineering
  • A working knowledge of relevant waterfall delivery principles – exposure to agile techniques would be highly advantageous
  • Excellent written skills including experience in writing business requirements, functional requirements and user stories
  • Excellent ability to navigate through ambiguity and complex business environments to deliver outstanding business solutions
  • Demonstrated experience operating in a fast paced, changing environment
  • Competent in use of project management software including Jira, Visio and Microsoft office suite

It’s an exciting time to be joining Australian Unity – we have grown significantly over recent years and are transforming to capitalise on further growth opportunities to help our customers and employees thrive. We operate with commercial principles and with a strong social purpose to create community value.

Australian Unity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Join us and thrive!

Job no: 500779
Work type: Full Time
Location: Sydney
Categories: Workers Compensation, RTWSS

Do you have a passion to make a difference and help people get their lives back after injury or illness?

  • Do you have an experience in the workers compensation industry and strong analytical and reporting skills?
  • Provide support and detailed analysis of claims portfolio and guidewire system
  • We help people get their lives back on track after a workplace injury

EML is a leading Workers Compensation Insurance company. We now have over 2000 employees and are still growing which means an amazing and diverse culture with a very high internal promotion rate.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As part of our diverse team based in Sydney CBD , you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.

You will assist to identify and assess risks by working collaboratively with Senior Managers, and key stakeholders to manage key risks and identify corrective and preventative actions that minimise financial, reputational and operational risks to EML.

The role requires a collaborative and consultative approach, working with iCare and business leaders to identify critical issues.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Providing incisive analysis and making recommendations to enhance and improve current claims management processes, and performance.
  • Modelling performance and financial outcomes.
  • Provide assistance to understand claims management practices and emerging experience trends
  • Make recommendations to enhance and improve current processes for data collation and extraction, monitoring and reporting.
  • Deliver detailed analysis of portfolio trends, utilizing information to make strategic decisions

ABOUT YOU

  • Sound knowledge and experience of Workers Compensation Insurance
  • Demonstrated experience in QlikSense / QlikView and SAS highly desirable
  • Data interpretation and visualisation experience.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as in a team
  • Excellent communication and problem solving skills are a must.
  • Must have strong analytical/reporting skills
  • Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline is highly desirable

WHAT WE OFFER

We stand together as equals. EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.

EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including:

  • Onsite Learning and Development Team
  • End of Month Celebration Events
  • 17.5% Annual Leave Loading
  • Free Fruit Boxes
  • Free Onsite Pilates,Yoga and Fitness Classes

We value our people and are committed to supporting our employees by investing in their professional development and providing generous employee benefits. If this is of interest to you, please or for more information/confidential conversation please contact Mary Norouzifar on 0280713623.

National Security Business Intelligence Analyst

Location: Canberra

Working to make the world a safer place

At PA Consulting Group, we help clients overcome the constantly evolving threats to national security. We have a longstanding and close partnership with the security, law enforcement and justice community to deliver critical national programmes that strengthen national security, protect the public and save lives. We do it by understanding each challenge and opportunity, working with individuals, teams and workforces to ensure capability is delivered.

Our experts generate tangible results throughout the investigative and analysis lifecycle – from defining strategy to delivering successful outcomes. We help our clients to become match fit and address complex issues such as countering terrorism, child exploitation and cyber crime.

Deliver exceptional results

As a business intelligence analyst, you will be responsible for engaging with stakeholders across out clients’ organisations to understand the most complex issues; and will use our clients’ data to identify the root cause of problems, model new ways of working, and design the most effective solutions. You will lead business intelligence projects and help define strategy for Business Intelligence within the context of our clients’ organisation challenges.

In this role, your deep experience in leading Business Intelligence teams within the security sector will enable you to identify and ask the critical questions that matter to clients’ organisations. You will work alone, or with software developers, to build effective BI products, which deliver lasting impact by answering questions that support decision making at the most senior level of our clients’ organisations.

Your duties will include:

  • Working with stakeholders across client organisations to analyse complex problems
  • Using management information and raw data to perform the root cause analysis
  • Developing models for new approaches and designing the most effective solutions
  • Helping to define Business Intelligence strategies to enhance client organisations
  • Coaching and mentoring of client programme/project staff on business intelligence.

You will have:

  • A post-graduate business degree from an internationally recognised top tier university
  • Demonstrable experience, with a track record of leading business intelligence teams, analysing complex data, and informing decision making at the most senior levels of tier 1 national security clients and within wider industry.
  • Experience of selecting commercial business intelligence software, including analysis, assessment, and recommendation to the business of various tools.
  • A strong skillset in using a variety of Business Intelligence tools and will have experience of building tools which are bespoke to the business need.
  • Held a client-facing delivery role within a leading global professional services firm, delivering outstanding client work and with excellent consulting skills.
  • An understanding of the intricacies of data analytics within tier 1 national security clients in an international context, with tangible experience of building robust solutions that ensure data is protected throughout the analysis lifecycle.

In addition, you must:

  • Hold a current TOP SECRET Positive Vetting (TS PV) security clearance with the Australian government
  • Be prepared to travel internationally.At PA, we take an innovative approach to technology consulting. That’s why we only hire the most innovative thinkers. With a global network of FTSE 100 and Fortune 500 clients, we offer our consultants unrivalled opportunities for growth and give them the freedom they need to excel. Whether they’re interested in solving complex challenges, executing organisational change or inspiring unconstrained ideation, we offer them a place to carve out a lasting career. Employee-owned, award winning and highly ambitious, at PA we are a different kind of consultancy. We believe that diversity makes us a stronger firm and seek to employ people with different ideas, styles and skill sets, each able to contribute in unique ways. This diversity engenders a richer, more creative environment – one in which our people develop and clients are served better. We are committed to recruiting, promoting and rewarding our people solely on the basis of their ability to contribute to PA’s objectives, without regard to their sex, race, disability, religion, national origin, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age or marital status.

Nb. Applications are limited to persons who have the right to live and work in Australia

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $94,000.00 /year

Key Responsibilities

  • Pre-sales consulting and support of the sales team. Preparation of the high-level technical materials for proposals, ensuring alignment of the solutions with the business needs of the clients and the functionality of the core platforms
  • Elicitation, analysis and management of the business, functional and nonfunctional requirements
  • Participation in the solution functional design together with implementation teams
  • Wireframing and documenting the design documentation
  • Ongoing support of the implementation teams, being an internal product owner

Requirements

You will have 4+ years work experience as a Business Systems Analyst and/or Project Manager with the considerable part of the experience in eCommerce

To be successful in this position, you will need to demonstrate skills and experience in the following areas

  • Conducting presentations and workshops involving business and technical stakeholders
  • Business, functional and nonfunctional requirements elicitation, analysis and documentation
  • Experience in a Business Systems Analyst role working with Magento or another eCommerce / ERP platform
  • Preparing concise business and technical documentation (examples will be requested during the interview process)
  • Product demonstration and training
  • Wireframing and prototyping solutions
  • At least 2 years of experience in Digital and eCommerce sector. Experience working with eCommerce platforms, CMS, Analytics suites (GA, others), EDM and other core Digital platforms
  • Structured project management experience. This includes scope definition and decomposition, estimation and project planning
  • Bachelor diploma in the relevant area

As this is a customer-facing role, we ask that you demonstrate the following

  • Strong verbal and written English
  • 2+ years of Australian / New Zealand / UK / US / Ireland experience
  • 1+ year of experience in customer-facing positions
  • Outstanding presentation skills
  • Proven ability to solve problems and think outside the box
  • Ability to work in cross-functional and geographically distributed teams

A stand-out candidate will demonstrate experience or expertise in some of the following

  • Knowledge of Magento Enterprise or Community platforms
  • Technical or development background
  • UML skills
  • Experience of working in a mature Agile environment
  • Experience and an ability to elicit and document the requirements for system and data integration.
  • Experience working with ERP, POS, WMS or other commerce IT systems
  • Experience in:
    • Pre-sales support
    • Strategy consulting
    • Business case development
    • UX design and research
  • Understanding of enterprise-level infrastructure for Digital/eCommerce
  • Data analysis experience or experience with Data analysis tools
  • Relational and NoSQL databases knowledge
  • PMI certifications, BABOK or other BA certifications, TOGAF certification

457/482/TSS visa sponsorship can be provided to the candidates currently in Australia.

If you believe you qualify for this role and are interested in this position, please click the apply button below and submit your cover letter and your resume addressing the selection criteria. In the cover letter, we ask that you to outline your experience in eCommerce / Digital, write about the most compelling eCommerce/Digital projects you have contributed to and address the key criteria listed above.

Job Description

At the Department of Justice and Community Safety, we’re looking for people who want to make a difference. People who take pride in their work. People who get things done. People who are committed to making Victoria a safer place.

We embrace diversity and strive to have a workforce that reflects the community we serve. We’re all about recruiting the best people, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation or cultural background. About us

With Victoria's strong population growth and demand for services within the justice portfolio increasing at unprecedented rates, the scale of the infrastructure required to support this demand has never been more significant.

The Community Safety Building Authority (CSBA) has been established to support the transformation required to create a public service that is more connected, agile and mobile to respond to these challenges.

The CSBA supports the Department of Justice and Community Safety (DJCS) by planning, designing, procuring and building new infrastructure assets as well as modernising and upgrading existing ones.

About the role

As the Senior Business Analyst you will contribute to a significant and high-profile security infrastructure program being led by the CSBA and delivered in collaboration with a range of program partners and stakeholders.

Your responsibilities will include:

  • producing a variety of critical project and program inputs, including the management, planning, identification, documentation, review and analysis of business processes and business requirements across the full project lifecycle
  • provide leadership, mentoring and development to other business analysts within the project
  • report on task progress, identify risks and issues, and work collaboratively to mitigate and resolve them
  • identify requirements using a range of techniques including document analysis, research, stakeholder interviews and chairing workshops with multiple senior stakeholders that address complex issues
  • manage stakeholder relationships and expectations, focusing on understanding stakeholder issues and influencing their views to resolve complex issues through a process of consultation and negotiation.
  • analyse issues and opportunities, including their risks and benefits, and determine solution options. Propose likely impacts of solution options and develop business cases.

Please note this is a fixed term positon based in Melbourne.

About you

Our ideal candidate will have:

  • knowledge and proven expertise in the management, planning, definition, documentation, and validation of business requirements and processes
  • previous experience in developing requirements to inform a design or procurement, including leading or working with a team of business analysts in a government environment
  • knowledge and proven expertise in working on a wide range of complex public sector projects
  • experience applying advanced business analysis methodologies and industry standards, including Business Analysis Body of Knowledge (BABOK), Business Process Modelling Notation (BPMN) and Use Case.

We're proud of the important work we do across Victoria. Want to be part of it?

About us

The Crime Statistics Agency (CSA) is responsible for the production of official crime statistics for the state of Victoria independent of Victoria Police, and undertakes statistical, research and evaluation activities related to crime and criminal justice issues.

In 2018, the Victorian Government launched Burra Lotjpa Dunguludja – the fourth phase of the Victorian Aboriginal Justice Agreement and Dhelk Dja: Safe Our Way - Strong Culture, Strong Peoples, Strong Families (Aboriginal 10 Year Family Violence Agreement). The CSA is providing support to implementation of activities identified in in these initiatives through the development of crime data to inform local decision making and reduce the incidence of family violence, victimisation and offending in Aboriginal communities across the state.

About the role

As the Data Analyst – Aboriginal Data Specialist, you will be part of the CSA Operations team which is responsible for the transformation and dissemination of Victorian Police crime data into crime statistics. A key function of the Operations team is the statistical editing, processing and quality assurance activities that produce quarterly crime statistics releases. The Operations team also delivers a highly responsive data consultancy service.

To support these functions, you will:

  • liaise with Victoria Police about data quality issues, including the quality of data collected using the Standard Indigenous Question
  • attend meetings and facilitate data requests from community groups to the CSA
  • support the development and dissemination of statistical information produced by the CSA to regional stakeholders and partnership forums
  • undertake continuous improvement of information technology solutions and data processing systems
  • provide technical advice to users of CSA data and manage ad hoc and client service data requests
  • deliver value-added recorded crime outputs related to Aboriginal data to be produced and published by the CSA (analysis, research and evaluation of crime trends).

About you

As our ideal candidate, you will have sound knowledge and understanding of the Aboriginal community. In addition, you will have experience in:

  • statistical analysis (especially in the crime and justice or comparable subject matter fields)
  • statistical data management, interpretation, presentation and communication of quantitative data to a range of audiences
  • the use of recognised computer applications, including Excel, SQL and Tableau Experience in working effectively in team environments and working across agencies to deliver results
  • preparing written briefings for a range of audiences.

How to apply

Please click the Apply button on this advertisement. Applications should include a resume and covering letter. Attachments can be uploaded in .doc, .docx, .pdf, .txt or .rtf formats.

This is an Aboriginal Identified Position. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are strongly encouraged to apply. Applicants are welcome to utilise support from the Aboriginal Employment Team throughout the recruitment process. About Us

Civica (www.civica.com) is a market-leading specialist in business-critical software applications, digital solutions and managed services that help teams and organisations around the world to transform the way they work. Civica’s library and education management solutions are used widely in Australian schools and libraries of all sizes to help meet the changing needs of teachers, students, parents, librarians, and library communities.

Our team is proud to work within the sectors we do, where we make a real difference, contributing to the growth of the societies that we live in. Want to join us and help continue our mission?

About The Role

Exceptional opportunity for a mature BA with solid Accounting experience to be part of our Library & Education Solutions business unit. Reporting to the BA Lead, you will be responsible for analysing the features and utilisation of new and existing finance software packages. You will work closely with a number of stakeholders including the Development Team, Testers, Product Managers and internal & external customers. Based in our Melbourne office, your success will be dependent on your ability to be flexible in your approach & ability to collaborate with a variety of stakeholders.

  • Strong problem solver, analytical and design skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and a team player with strong people engagement

At Civica we believe our people are our biggest asset and we pride ourselves on cultivating a supportive and modern working environment; whilst providing you with the tools you need to get the job done. We will offer what you would expect in today’s modern work environments:

Civica is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all sections of the community.

Kaeser Compressors Australia has been serving the Australian, New Caledonian and Pacific region since 1990 with a dedicated team situated across the region, from our head office in Melbourne to our Sales & Service Center in Sydney, Perth, Brisbane, Mackay and Tasmania.

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management
  • Optimize workflow management to ensure traceability back to strategic alignment
  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)

CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organisation on earth. Its pallets, crates and containers form the invisible backbone of the global supply chain and the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, sustainably and safely. As pioneers of the sharing economy, CHEP created one of the world's most sustainable logistics businesses through the share and reuse of its platforms under a model known as ‘pooling’. CHEP primarily serves the fast-moving consumer goods (e.g. dry food, grocery, and health and personal care), fresh produce, beverage, retail and general manufacturing industries. CHEP employs approximately 11,000 people and owns approximately 300 million pallets, crates and containers through a network of more than 750 service centres, supporting more than 500,000 customer touch-points for global brands such as Procter & Gamble, Sysco, Kellogg’s and Nestlé. CHEP is part of the Brambles Group and operates in more than 55 countries with its largest operations in North America and Western Europe. For more information on CHEP, visit www.chep.com. For information on the Brambles Group, visit www.brambles.com

As one of four Brambles growth companies, CHEP and Brambles provide you unparalleled opportunities to advance and accelerate your career. You’ll be joining an international growth organisation with a pioneering, circular business model. You’ll be working for a company that is changing the way goods get to market. You’ll become part of an efficient and collaborative global team making a real contribution to a smarter, more sustainable future. For more on how Brambles growth companies can accelerate your career, visit https://careers.brambles.com/

job_desc:
This role sits within the Enterprise Data Management (EDM) function and specifically the team that is responsible for building out the Enterprise Tools that are used to govern data across the organisation. The remit of the EDM team is quiet broad and you will utilise your previous Business Analyst experience and take on a range of responsibilities.

As part of your day to day duties you will work with the Enterprise Data Management Team and Business Teams to shape our data governance processes and support other teams on their data initiatives and projects to ensure they are getting value from our data tool-sets. You will take the lead in documenting requirements that need to be implemented in our Data Governance Tools to support our data governance processes and data projects. In addition, you will develop test plans and test cases to validate your requirements and support the business teams in executing User Testing. This will involve providing input into the Enterprise Data Management Tooling Roadmap, helping to shape the future direction of our Tooling Products as well as support the tooling lead in managing the demand pipeline, status reporting and stakeholder management.

You will have a good understanding of data management principles and how it is managed in a large enterprise and have experience working in a data governance function or working on the delivery of data oriented. In addition, you will be a self-starter that is happy to take on ownership of their deliverables and take the initiative to drive end to end outcomes. In this role you will be required to facilitate workshops, develop and deliver training material and templates to support on-boarding of the business community into our toolset and would have strong communication skills.

If this opportunity interests and next career move, then please apply online.

Corporate Operations Group (COG) provides specialist professional services, human resources, workplace infrastructure, technology and market operations to Macquarie's businesses. The primary purpose of COG is to support and enhance the value of Macquarie through the creation of an efficient, scalable operating model. This is evident across the activities of each of the divisions which comprises of Business Improvement and Strategy Division (BIS), Business Services Division (BSD), COG Business Management, Human Resources Division (HR), Market Operations, Operational Risk Strategy and Support, Shared Services and Technology.

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.

The role The purpose of this role is to undertake high level analysis and reporting on patient safety related data for programs/initiatives, and to identify new and/or appropriate analytical methodologies, and adapt these to Queensland Health's needs.

We are an organisation that strongly believes in the need to work with people who value the goals of our organisation and who will thrive in our workplace. Working at the Department of Health is about making a difference.
, By joining the Department of Health you will work within a fast-paced, challenging and supportive environment where every employee plays a critical role in our ongoing success. You will enjoy a variety of benefits, including:

Luvo is an Australian-owned and operated company that provides a range of Professional Services designed to reduce the total cost, improve the quality and ensure stakeholder confidence on our client's IT projects.

We are looking for Salesforce Business Analyst to work onsite at our client’s location in Melbourne.

Key Criteria:-
  • Proficient in Sales and Service Cloud (Understanding of Business process with Salesforce terminology)
  • Support the development and communication of the service vision and roadmap
  • Minimum of 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst in the Salesforce ecosystem
  • Proficient in Salesforce Administration and functional knowledge (Salesforce Automation, Process builders, Security & Sharing)
  • Strong understanding of Workflow rules, Validation rules and Formula fields
  • Experience with Salesforce objects, page layouts and record types
  • Good to have Salesforce ADM 201 Certification
  • Experience with any CRM software (Salesforce.com, Siebel, Clarify, Vantiv, Peoplesoft, NetSuite) preferred
  • Experience on direct client discussions, daily status meetings
  • Experience of Agile delivery
  • Community Cloud experience preferred
Please click Apply in the first instance and we will be in touch to discuss further.
Must have the right to work in Australia.
No Agencies please.

In this key business focused role, supporting the Financial Management Group, you will be required to work with the business cross functionally and build and maintain strong relationships, and influence your key stakeholders. You will assist the Group in the implementation of the Information Management Strategy and in identifying its Critical Data and bringing that data under governance. This will include understanding data usage across the Group, detailing data lineage and capturing data risks and control within the end-to-end data flow. Your stakeholder group will be broad and your success in the role will require exceptional stakeholder management, and the ability to lead and inspire technical people alike.

You will act as a brand ambassador for good data management practices and will represent and be the voice of the Financial Management Group in Group-wide Data Working Groups and forums. This role is an excellent opportunity for someone who is passionate about data quality, able to build strong relationships and influence outcomes, and take people on the journey. Being a self-starter, driven and curious, will also be key, as you will be solving complex issues and providing solutions to the Group.

Prior experience as a Business Analyst in Regulatory Reporting, Regulatory Change or finance projects is highly sought after and an understanding of data related Regulatory Requirements e.g. BCBs 239 and APRA CPG 235 is highly regarded.

If this sounds like the right opportunity to further your career, apply today.

The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate communications and investor relations.

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers

Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

Would you like to work in a dynamic and challenging environment where you will be supported to reach your potential? There are opportunities available for the role of State Business Analyst in Melbourne.

About the Role:


Working within the National Field environment, you will ensure that the accurate analysis of market performance is communicated to State Management. This analysis of statistical data and market information will support the monitoring, planning and development processes of the business in order to achieve sales & marketing objectives.

You will provide the State Management team with regular updates on progress against company targets and ensure all relevant data bases are maintained with the latest information. You will be a motivated, self-starter who strives to offer solutions and input on process improvements to maximise efficiency within the team, field force and across departments. There will also be an element of administrative support required in the day to day activities of the State Office that you will to support with.

About You:

You should ideally possess the following attributes:

  • Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel including defining & creating formula, macros and pivot tables as well as PowerPoint.
  • Strong analytical ability to proactively identify trends, issues and opportunities and translate these into insightful commercial stories and recommendations
  • Ability to effectively plan, organise and prioritise
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in addition to presentation skills
  • Resilience and initiative, with a ‘can do attitude


The Perks:

If you are successful, you will receive the following:

  • Competitive remuneration package including bonus
  • Above statutory superannuation
  • Company laptop and smart phone
  • Opportunities for regular Learning and Development training

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

The Role & Opportunity
,You will be working as a business analyst/data analyst within the ICT division of our major client and will be responsible to support the Data Completions processes associated with data entry into our PNI system Spatialnet.
,
,
,
Ideal candidate would have familiarity with PNI environments and are able to work through changes associated with systems and processes whilst working with multiple stakeholders.
,
Data Completions is responsible for entry of physical, logical and address data into the clients Spatial Net PNI system.
,
What's in it for you?
,
,
Interested? If you have the skills and motivation we are looking for, please Apply Now. For more information, please contact Sukanya Mukhopadhyay on 03 8319 7810 or via email Sukanya Mukhopadhyay @ igniteservices.com.

We're seeking a Business Analyst to join our Tech Team. You'll be working closely with our Product Manager and Developers to understand our business and create a story for our clients.

We bring products, technology, and services into a single platform that connects our customers to solutions and insights. You'll play a key role in the overall creation of requirements and development of current and future product offerings.

Role responsibilities:

  • Analyse current or potential business intelligence product offerings
  • Understand business problems and opportunities in the context of requirements, analyse and present solutions
  • Perform data analysis to turn data into insights
  • Create and develop reports and visualisations in support of client business objectives
  • Serve as technical and functional business intelligence subject matter expert

Required skills, knowledge, and abilities:

  • Experience with BI visualisation platforms, like Looker or similar
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Familiarity with software development lifecycle
  • Ability to work with data sets from multiple data sources and analysing data quality
  • Understanding of databases and data infrastructure

You:

Engaging, confident and passionate about Agile Business Analysis and bridging the gap between technology and the business! You have an analytical mindset and experience working with technical teams to deliver customer facing web solutions.

The role:

Working within an agile squad to deliver a new web initiative for the organisation, working closely with the technical teams and the business stakeholders to cement the user stories, user journeys and deliver new exciting customer facing technical solutions.

The Organisation:

A well-known household name in the retail space this company are innovating and expanding their organisation.

Skills and experience needed:

  • Experience working as an Agile BA on customer facing websites (ideally retail)
  • Exposure to SCRUM and Kanban
  • Exposure to JIRA
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; strong ability to articulate complex situations and information clearly
  • Experience of working within Agile and waterfall projects
  • Attention to detail; thorough
  • Disciplined and rigorous in following through on actions
  • Able to work collaboratively and effectively at all levels in an organisation.
  • Solid Business Analyst capabilities, experienced at being the link between IT and business stakeholders

If you are interested please click the Apply button or call Richard Green on 03 8399 9312 for a conversation about the role.

Senior Business Analyst


Closing Date
15-Jun-2019


Department
IT


Description

Who are we?

Australian Gas Infrastructure Group (AGIG) is one of Australia’s leading gas infrastructure companies, comprising of the Dampier Bunbury Pipeline (DBP), Australian Gas Networks (AGN) and Multinet Gas Networks (MGN).

We are the largest gas distribution business in Australia, serving more than 2 million customers in South Australia, Melbourne, Queensland and New South Wales. We also own and operate the Dampier to Bunbury Natural Gas Pipeline and Tubridgi Gas Storage facility in Western Australia, both of which play a critical role in the Western Australian economy.

We are a values driven organisation. Our values are Respect, Trust, Perform and One Team.

What is involved in the role of a Senior Business Analyst?

The overall purpose of the Senior Business Analyst is to work alongside the business and Technology to define and document business requirements, to assist in the delivery of AGIG One IT.

The main responsibilities of the role are:

  • Liaising with relevant IT resources (i.e. Solution Architects, Systems Analysts, designers, developers and testers) to ensure the business requirements are understood.
  • Contributing to building a strong relationship between the business and technology.
  • Participating in UAT.
  • Contributing to business implementation tasks including training, business process mapping and business readiness.
  • Supporting the Business Process Change Management function to ensure the business functional and non-functional requirements are always being considered
  • Supporting the Testing Governance function to ensure the business functional and non-functional requirements are always being considered

Location: This role will be based in our Perth office

What are we looking for in you?

Essential

  • At least 15 years of relevant professional experience with 10 years of these in a business analysis role
  • Extensive experience in planning, preparing and conducting workshops/meetings with stakeholders/participants for business requirements gathering, process mappings etc.
  • Good experience in liaising with stakeholders at all levels (particularly senior to mid management)
  • Strong business requirements and process definitions experience using relevant tools
  • Good business communications skills
  • Excellent Powerpoint, Word and Excel skills
  • Good awareness of organizational/program/project change management
  • Good understanding of IT project delivery methodologies (e.g. agile development, SDLC)
  • Degree qualified

Desirable

  • Utilities & IT background
  • COBIT and/or ITIL
  • Experience in major business/ IT transformation

Bega Cheese Group is home to many trusted and wholesome food brands enjoyed in Australia and around the world. Our growth story of becoming a successful ASX listed company with a turnover in excess of $1.5 billion and over 2000 employees is made possible by our values and outward-looking perspective. If you believe in building a Great Australian Food Company, you are curious and creative and invested in the success and growth of others as much as your own, then you might be the one we are looking for!


With a strong regional focus and dedication to the community, we are proud of our heritage which continues to build outstanding opportunities for people to develop and thrive.

The opportunity/team

Bega has an excellent opportunity for a Business Intelligence Lead to join the Information Technology Team. As Business Intelligence Lead, you will analyse business processes and business information requirements in order to meet reporting and dashboarding requirements for all parts of the business.


You will provide business intelligence leadership to the BI team and the business.


The lead will also ensure that Business Intelligence systems and associated processes, including the data warehouse structures, are fully documented and understood. You will be working on projects within the Bega Group and will gain exposure to the M3 ERP solution and various BI tools including Infor BI and Birst.

Your ability to be resourceful, think conceptually, proactively form professional relationships with executives, managers, subject matter experts, and end users is critical to the success of this role.

To be successful in this role

We look for potential, not only performance. To be successful you will be open about your strengths and weaknesses and prepared to challenge yourself. We value the diversity of thinking, experiences, and perspectives and listening. Bega people support each other to achieve together.

Additionally, you will have:

  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in the design of BI solutions
  • Technical skills in use of BI reporting tools
  • Knowledge of ERP Systems (M3 being ideal, but not essential)
  • Strong skills in data analysis and problem-solving
  • Strong interpersonal skills including oral and written communication skills

Bega provides a competitive salary, certified training opportunities and a supportive team environment.

Applications

We want to learn about you. Send us a cover letter describing your strengths and how you might apply them in this role.


Applications close 24 May 2019


We will accept applications from all people with the right to live and work in Australia.

Recruiters, we appreciate your interest, but we've got this one covered, thanks!

• Position based in Head Office
  • DHA Level 5 - salary from $74,764 - $81,603 per annum, plus superannuation and potential bonus
  • Ongoing/Non-ongoing vacancies available

This position reports to the Manager, Business Analyst Team within Business Solutions and Technology (BS&T). BS&T is a group of teams in Business Solutions and Services within the People and Corporate Capability Group.

BS&T are responsible for all software related business analysis, business solutions, in-house software development, telephony, IT Services and Infrastructure. We deliver business as usual activities and innovation driven initiatives that provide efficiencies to the broader organisation.

As part of this role your responsibilities will include analysis, design and specification of new and existing IT systems to support the business using appropriate standards, methodologies and toolsets. The role will provide expert advice and assistance to system users, investigate complex issues and determine business impact and recommend solutions.

Eligibility: The remuneration package is negotiable and includes a base salary, potential performance bonus and Commonwealth funded superannuation. Employment with DHA is conditional on successful applicants demonstrating that they are an Australian citizen, meeting the required medical standards, achieving a satisfactory character clearance

Note: a 12 month vacancy is available.

A non-ongoing position will be offered for a specified term of up to 12 months with the possibility of extension depending on operational requirements. Should the position become ongoing and an Order of Merit has been established during the selection process, this may be used to fill the vacancy on an ongoing basis.

To apply, please submit an online application including a statement of claims against the selection criteria (with a maximum of 1500 words in total) detailing your skills and experience relevant to the duty statement along with a current resume.

Contact Officer: for further information about this position please contact Stacey Pearman, 02 62178 461, stacey.pearman@dha.gov.au

Please note late applications will not be accepted.

job_title: 2019 Investment Banking and Capital Markets Analyst Summer Internship in Melbourne
job_desc:
Australia-VIC-Melbourne
|
Full-time
|
Investment Banking and Capital Markets
|
Job ID

128511

Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse.

We Offer
Get your career off to the best start with Credit Suisse
Join the IBCM team in Sydney or Melbourne this Summer to start your investment banking career with Credit Suisse!
We advise companies, private equity firms and asset managers on strategically important acquisitions and divestments and help them access the best sources of capital to support their growth. We are innovative, creative and committed to the success of our clients and our team.
The 11-week IBCM Summer Analyst Program provides excellent exposure to the financial services industry.
Our Summer Analyst work on live deals and gain hands-on experience. As a Summer Analyst you could expect to:
  • Analyze companies using financial modeling and valuation techniques,
  • Examine the impact of a transaction on a client’s capital structure, and
  • Think about the strategy behind a merger or acquisition.
We are focused on your development and will give you regular feedback and have formal check-in points to review your progress. At the end of the Summer, graduate offers are made to interns who we believe will be successful as full-time analysts within the Credit Suisse IBCM team.
Positions are available in Sydney and Melbourne.
Training
We will provide you with the training you need to grow your skills and start your career in the fast-lane. Your first week is dedicated to orientation and completing our training program designed specifically for IBCM. During the program we will have sessions with senior bankers to help you learn from experienced professionals about innovative deals that are transforming today's corporate landscape. You'll grow your skills, while putting your career on a fast track.
You will be matched with a buddy who will provide advice and guidance throughout the program and will have opportunities to participate in social, networking and mentoring events that will also help you understand our Equities and Private Banking businesses.
You Offer
Qualifications
To be eligible for this program you need to be in your penultimate year of an undergraduate or Master’s program, graduating between June and December 2020, and have the right to work in Australia – Australian or New Zealand citizen or permanent resident.
Credit Suisse is noted for the diversity of its employees, but we seek candidates with a common set of abilities – motivation, creativity, demonstrated academic achievement, and the ability to work independently as well as within a high performing team.
We are looking to build future leaders who add fresh perspectives to our business.
Whatever your background, you will need to be:
  • A leader who engenders dedication, assumes responsibility and mobilizes others
  • A critical thinker with excellent problem-solving skills
  • An enthusiastic self-starter who achieves significant results
  • A supportive and adaptable team member who can build strong relationships
  • An articulate communicator who also recognizes the importance of listening
  • Principled and committed to the highest standards of ethical behavior
How To Apply
You will need to complete an application on the Credit Suisse website for consideration.
If you are eligible for the internship, you will receive an online invite from via the system. Please complete the online numerical and verbal reasoning tests in 2 days. It should take you no more than 40 minutes to do the test. We will only review the rest of the application once you have completed this step and test scores are submitted successfully.
Application deadlines:
Melbourne Office: Tuesday, July 16 at 12:00 noon AEST
Sydney Office: Tuesday, July 30 at 12:00 noon AEST
We encourage to you apply early as applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis.

An excellent opportunity exists for an experienced, highly personable functional/business focused ICT Business Analyst within a large and progressive State Government Department.

The successful candidate will be the interface between the business and the digital ICT department, mapping out business requirements, producing current workflow and operating models and translating those into documents that are easily understood by the team of architects and developers.

Having a strong focus to produce high quality documentation that dovetails with the overarching digital strategy, you'll be working on major, high profile and well-funded programs along with a number of smaller but equally critical projects that will propel the current work state into the digital age and future proof the department for anticipated business demands.

The key accountabilities for this role are listed below:

  • Enhance business systems by providing accurate information about business needs and priorities
  • Analyse and consolidate information to develop business cases to support achievement of business objectives and corporate plans
  • Provide plain language advice on technical issues to non-technical audiences
  • Work with key stakeholders to identify how changing business requirements may be delivered with existing solutions
  • Guide and support team members to provide customer focused services

To be successful in this role, you will need to possess the following experience, skills and attributes:
  • Excellent Business Process Mapping experience
  • 5+ years as a Business Analyst
  • Ability to communicate clearly and concisely with stakeholders at all levels
  • Attention to detail and the ability to produce technical and business documentation to a high standard
  • Organised, analytical with ability to prioritise workload
As part of NSW Government’s practices, please include a cover letter alongside your CV which clearly answers the following two questions:
  • Please highlight your experience of working within the health sector on clinical software development or clinical system implementation projects.
  • Please provide a recent example where you have created business process mapping documents, including current and future state designs

To find out more about this permanent opportunity, please apply now via the button below.

Work type: Full Time

Do you have a passion to make a difference and help people get their lives back after injury or illness?

  • Do you have an experience in the workers compensation industry and strong analytical and reporting skills?
  • Provide support and detailed analysis of claims portfolio and guidewire system
  • We help people get their lives back on track after a workplace injury

EML is a leading Workers Compensation Insurance company. We now have over 2000 employees and are still growing which means an amazing and diverse culture with a very high internal promotion rate.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As part of our diverse team based in Sydney CBD , you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.

You will assist to identify and assess risks by working collaboratively with Senior Managers, and key stakeholders to manage key risks and identify corrective and preventative actions that minimise financial, reputational and operational risks to EML.

The role requires a collaborative and consultative approach, working with iCare and business leaders to identify critical issues.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Providing incisive analysis and making recommendations to enhance and improve current claims management processes, and performance.
  • Modelling performance and financial outcomes.
  • Provide assistance to understand claims management practices and emerging experience trends
  • Make recommendations to enhance and improve current processes for data collation and extraction, monitoring and reporting.
  • Deliver detailed analysis of portfolio trends, utilizing information to make strategic decisions

ABOUT YOU

  • Sound knowledge and experience of Workers Compensation Insurance
  • Demonstrated experience in QlikSense / QlikView and SAS highly desirable
  • Data interpretation and visualisation experience.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as in a team
  • Excellent communication and problem solving skills are a must.
  • Must have strong analytical/reporting skills
  • Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline is highly desirable

WHAT WE OFFER

We stand together as equals. EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.

EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including:

  • Onsite Learning and Development Team
  • End of Month Celebration Events
  • 17.5% Annual Leave Loading
  • Free Fruit Boxes
  • Free Onsite Pilates,Yoga and Fitness Classes

We value our people and are committed to supporting our employees by investing in their professional development and providing generous employee benefits. If this is of interest to you, please or for more information/confidential conversation please contact Mary Norouzifar on 0280713623.

Advertised: 10 May 2019 AUS Eastern Standard Time
Applications close: 31 May 2019 AUS Eastern Standard Time

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management

  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)
