job_title: Korn Ferry RPO Graduate Program – Melbourne
job_desc:
About Us

Step into your future!

We are Korn Ferry – one of the world’s largest and most successful talent consultancies.

From airlines to insurers, sporting brands to energy giants, we partner with many of Australia’s and New Zealand’s largest organisations. Our purpose is to ensure companies have the right talent so that they can reach their full potential.

As Australia and New Zealand’s leading provider of recruitment outsourcing services, we enable better talent acquisition for our clients by providing them access to our best practice, highly capable team members and responsive business model, as we deliver best in class recruitment solutions for their organisations as an outsourced provider.

The Program

Korn Ferry has experienced unparalleled growth. Three years ago, we had seven core clients. Today we have over 25. As we look to the future, developing graduate talent to become our future leaders is mission critical to our continued success.

Our 18-month graduate program is designed to provide you with the grounding to succeed in the talent industry. Rotations could include:

  • Talent delivery centre: Working alongside our expert sourcing consultants who utilise the latest techniques, such as artificial intelligence to identify, engage and recruit the very best talent.
  • Working on-site at a Korn Ferry client: Working in one of our client’s offices alongside a recruitment business partner, living and breathing our client’s culture to ensure we can meet their talent requirements.
  • Recruitment marketing: Supporting recruitment campaigns by enhancing a client’s employer brand and utilising the latest digital engagement techniques.
  • Recruitment insights: Data driven decision making is supported by our market insights teams. As we consult to clients on their talent strategy, this is backed up by an understanding of factors such as supply and demand, diversity and inclusion and competitor insights.

We place great emphasis on the importance of training and development. On starting you will complete a three-week extensive training program which will equip you for success in your future career. Ongoing on-the-job training, mentoring and coaching will be provided throughout the program.

Program Location

The primary regions for this program are Melbourne and Auckland.

Whilst you will be based in a primary region, we believe that the best experiences are gained through exposure to different markets, clients and accounts. Therefore, we ask that you are mobile to moving to different locations throughout your preferred region (client sites and/or offices).

Who Are We Seeking?

Each of our clients have a unique personality. As do our people.

Underpinning their success are a series of traits. We seek people who:

  • Love taking the time to build relationships with others.
  • Are naturally inquisitive, self-motivated and take pride in their output.
  • Look to seek solutions, take challenges in their stride and think creatively to find solutions.
  • Appreciate that things may not always go to plan, be open to changes, learn from mistakes and have the resilience to bounce back.
  • Are always wanting to improve and take steps to challenge themselves.

Korn Ferry is an ambitious and inclusive company where everyone is empowered to contribute. Integrity is a fundamental part of our culture. We work in a fast-moving, dynamic industry where change is the only constant and flexibility is the key to success.

We are seeking applicants with a recently completed Bachelor’s degree. Ideally applicants will also have prior experience (either workplace or extracurricular) which demonstrate our key traits. Prior exposure to working in a corporate environment or a customer service role is advantageous but not essential.

What Happens Next?

Interested? Take the first step into your future and apply now!

To ensure fairness, we will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis. We therefore encourage you to apply in advance of the deadline. Applications will close on Friday 17th May.

You should apply to a single location only. You must have the right to work in that chosen location.

Throughout our recruitment process we will be looking to learn about your strengths, motivations and assess your drive for working at Korn Ferry.

At AIA Australia and New Zealand, our purpose is to make a difference in people’s lives through our customer value proposition centred on Life, Health and Wellness.

Our vision is to champion Australia and New Zealand to be the healthiest and most protected nations in the world.

Our firm belief is that by following our operating philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come.

AIA Careers

We are going through exciting times at AIA Australia and due to growth within the organisation the technology team are looking at automation opportunities to assist the rest of business and ensure they have the best experience and tools to support our valued customers and clients.

This role will be working in the AIA Automation factory that is focused on establishing capability that can bridge processes to resolve complexity of any service and optimize experience for our customers, partners and employees.

Location: 509 St Kilda Road, Melbourne, Victoria 3004 (Corner of Commercial and St Kilda road)

This is the kind of experience we are looking for:

  • Provide analysis, evaluation and recommendations in support of mission-oriented business functions and related applications and systems.
  • Work closely with key stakeholders and run discovery workshops.
  • Produce and/or analyse workflows and processes to identify process inefficiencies, areas for improvement, risks & issues.
  • Align processes, systems, policies, and organizational structures with mission and strategy of the organization and best practices.
  • Create process change by integrating new processes to improve existing ones and communicating these changes to impacted stakeholders.
  • Develop initiatives for continuous process improvements and innovative solutions.
  • Plan and implement approved business solutions and develops metrics, and methods to collect those metrics, to measure operational efficiency.
  • Provides input into change management plans including training, communications, and transition management to operationalized process/people/system change.

We would also like you to have.

  • 5+ years’ experience in Business Process Re-engineering, Process Improvements and/or Business Analysis roles.
  • Strong analytical and effective communication skills with staff at all levels.
  • Experience in process modelling and process mapping/analysis, preferably in a merger & acquisition transaction.
  • Experience in using process improvement methodologies, e.g. Six Sigma, Lean as well as BPM software tools.
Healthier, Longer, Better Lives

At AIA Australia and New Zealand, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility.

We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.

We’re an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce.

,About HelloFresh
,----------------
,
At HelloFresh, we want to change the way people eat. Over the past 6 years we've seen this mission spread beyond our wildest dreams. Now, we are the leading global company in the expanding online recipe kit delivery market.
,
So, how did we do it? Our weekly recipe boxes full of exciting recipes and lovingly sourced, fresh ingredients have blossomed into a community of inspired, energised home cooks that expands across the globe. We are one of the fastest growing meal kit businesses and are active and growing in 11 different countries across 3 continents.
,
If you would like to join an energetic and highly motivated team and work in a dynamic, high-energy, high-growth field where you can really have an impact and make a difference every single day then join us and become part of developing a global fresh food champion.
,

,Job description
,---------------
,
This role is a fantastic opportunity for a recent graduate or someone part way through their studies with a numerical and analytical background. We are looking for a Business Intelligence Intern to join our customer care team and work on various of projects.
,
You will…

You have the talent and aspiration to become the subject matter expert on data analytics within global operations.

You have…

You are...

What we offer...

, 6 Months PAID internship with the possibility to extend. You MUST have the right to work in Australia for the duration of the contract.

About us

Harris Farm Markets has built a strong reputation for delivering good quality fresh food at great value for our customers.

Since 1971, when David and Cathy opened their first store in Villawood, we've believed in something greater than just selling fresh food. We’ve believed in nature itself. The land, the sea, the air, the elements. It’s a remarkable thing. It brings families together, supports communities, and gives farmers a means. It offers nutrients to our bodies, and joy to our taste buds.

Better tasting produce from sustainable suppliers. Bigger value from unexpectedly bigger harvests. More variety from truly seasonal conditions. The highest quality which can only come from years of experience and a close relationship with farmers and their land.

For over 40 years we’ve remained 100% family owned and operated. We’re 26 (and counting) stores across Sydney and NSW and home to over 2,200 wonderful employees all with a common purpose, to reconnect Aussies with the joy of food.

The Role

The role of Warehouse and Logistics Analyst is to document, analyse data and report back Warehouse information supporting the operations of the business they work for are as effectively and as efficiently as possible. This will involve reviewing the processes in place and assessing them to determine ways to improve.

Key responsibilities will include ensuring;

  • Create processes to gather warehouse data
  • Analyse data, identifying areas that require process improvement
  • Analyse Labour and transport costs
  • Manage the Pallet reconciliation, including working with internal stakeholders and external stakeholders to ensure accuracy of the pallets
  • Track KPIs and report on warehouse performance
  • Assist with Stocktakes
  • Maintain databases of logistics information
  • Spend time in warehouse as required (Both ambient and chilled)
  • Interpret data on logistics elements, such as availability, maintainability, reliability, distribution, supplier management, or transportation.
  • Apply analytic methods or tools to understand, predict, or assist in controlling logistics operations or processes.
  • Monitor inventory transactions at warehouse facilities to assess receiving, storage, shipping, or inventory integrity
  • Maintain freight rate databases for use by supply chain departments to determine the most economical modes of transportation.
  • Contact carriers for rates or schedules.


Skills Required

  • Able to demonstrate HFM core values.
  • 2+ years' experience in a Warehouse as a Logistics Analyst or similar
  • High knowledge in Excel
  • Experience and knowledge in a logistics/supply-chain/or distribution industry
  • Working knowledge of databases and ERP systems
  • Analytical mind with business acumen
  • Problem-solving aptitude
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Outstanding organisational ability
  • Able to work independently without direct supervision and also as part of a team
  • Demonstrates excellent attention to detail


Benefits

  • High degree of autonomy
  • Wide variety of work which is challenging and enjoyable
  • workplace flexibility
  • 25% staff discount

The Role & Opportunity
,You will be working as a business analyst/data analyst within the ICT division of our major client and will be responsible to support the Data Completions processes associated with data entry into our PNI system Spatialnet.
,
,
,
Ideal candidate would have familiarity with PNI environments and are able to work through changes associated with systems and processes whilst working with multiple stakeholders.
,
Data Completions is responsible for entry of physical, logical and address data into the clients Spatial Net PNI system.
,
What's in it for you?
,
,
Interested? If you have the skills and motivation we are looking for, please Apply Now. For more information, please contact Sukanya Mukhopadhyay on 03 8319 7810 or via email Sukanya Mukhopadhyay @ igniteservices.com.

Every day, LexisNexis produces and provides industry-leading legal content to more than five million professionals across 100 countries in the legal, corporate, government, accounting, academic and law enforcement markets. Today, with our cutting-edge, high-speed and easily accessible information solutions, you can be the difference that will uphold the law across borders as the world and technology evolves.

Reporting to the Head of Analytics, you will be engaging with Business Unit leaders on projects to deliver analytical insights and reports to achieve revenue objectives and assess new opportunities. In addition, you will build data models to identifying trends and insights.

Specifically, your responsibilities include:
  • Using analytical problem-solving approaches that deliver insights and inform recommendations
  • Construct analysis that build arguments to support or negate project hypotheses
  • Discover trends, patterns and stories told by the data, structured and unstructured, and present them to stakeholders
  • Develop sophisticated models to support scenario evaluation
  • Determine financial impact and risks associated with recommendations
  • Data Interrogation, validation, creation and management of dashboards using OBIEE
  • Leverage new open data sources and extract further value from existing company data
  • Prepare persuasive presentations to communicate the case for change
  • Collect and synthesize internal and external data

It’s not a typical analyst role! As well as getting a chance to hone your data and modelling skills on a daily basis, you will be building your consulting skills; collaborating on projects from initial scoping through to delivery of recommendations, communicating complex insights in simple ways, with exposure to a variety of business units and leadership teams.
To be successful, we are looking for people with:
  • Analytical (quantitative and qualitative) and structured problem-solving skills
  • Time management skills, working across several projects concurrently
  • Strategic thinking to see the “big picture” and operational details
  • Creative thinking – consistently producing innovative ideas, analyses and recommendations
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel, OBIEE and SQL skills, with a great sense for how to present data in visual and inspiring ways
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, written and oral
We are a close-knit, high performing team that consistently delivers breakthrough insights and impactful recommendations to the business. We place the highest importance on the professional growth of our team members, and we have an excellent track record of sending our team into successful careers.


Today, you are the difference to how you look at your career. Make it happen.

Accountable for delivering analytics that optimises the overall performance of the Consumer Finance Product portfolios, in particular, Personal Loans.

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change

  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria

  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad

What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad

With a firm grasp of the technology, the intention would be for the role to evolve into presenting data in charts, graphs and tables as well as designing and developing algorithms for relational databases to operate autonomously.

Analytical Skills: Data analysts work with large amounts of data: facts, figures and number crunching.

Communication Skills: Must communicate methodology and findings well with team members and ancillary resources.

Attention to Detail: The conclusions drawn from this data analysis will drive critical business decisions and recommendations. Accuracy and attention to detail are paramount.

The International Institute of Data & Analytics (IDA) is a not-for-profit hi-tech organization with foci on data science and big data analytics innovation, education and training, and commercialization and services. IDA offers unique experiences and engagement models for bridging the gaps between academia and business, enabling industry and government `easy to do business with’ leading scientists and specialists in data & analytics, and building a platform for engagements and collaborations between outstanding researchers, practitioners and educators.

In data science and big data analytics, the IDA creates enablers for:

  • Leading the field of data science and analytics innovation, training and services by building think-tank and thought leadership, and next-generation of data scientists and professionals;
  • transforming excellent research and innovation outcomes to actionable data science and analytics systems, tools, services and training for industry innovation and transformation; and
  • building a flexible and engaging culture and platform to connect local, regional and global resources in data & analytics research and business towards developing world-class centre of excellence and research networks.

You shall find the IDA team very self-motivated, high standard and forward thinking focused, and highly hands-on.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with our clients and internal stakeholders to understand and document their business requirements, needs and objectives toward delivering project plans and business plans.
  • Comprehensive understanding of data structures, and extract required data for analysis according to business requirements.
  • Architect, develop and automate data analytics models and solutions. Develop analytics solutions, including data extraction, pre-processing, modeling, deployment, evaluation and maintenance.
  • Iteratively prototype and productise analytical models and solutions per commercial standard and for production and commercialization.
  • Make business recommendations in terms of cost-benefit, forecasting and impact analysis by effective presentations of data-driven findings to clients and stakeholders, and provide insights to clients.
  • Document and communicate all relevant work and work outcomes.
  • Lead and mentor junior data analysts/scientists in a closely collaborative data science project team.

Qualifications

  • Solid background, knowledge and capabilities in statistics, mathematics, computer science, informatics, computing, or closely relevant scientific field.
  • At least three years of data-driven analytics hands-on experience with deep know-how of predictive modeling, machine learning and data mining, and relevant modeling approaches and algorithms.
  • Demonstrated capabilities to prototype and productise statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data-driven solutions to problems in new domains.
  • Demonstrated advanced knowledge of SQL (data extraction and manipulation), expertise in SAS programming, and software development skills in one to several scripting languages (Python/R).
  • Demonstrated capabilities to communicate and engage with and manage relationships across a range of stakeholder groups and technical project teams.
  • Demonstrated capabilities to work effectively as a member and leader of a data science project team to provide the high level specifications, management and communications.
  • Demonstrated experience for independent problem-solving and self-motivated innovation, education and services.

Contact: Jinjiu.Li@idawise.com

About the role:

A Business Analyst role exists within the Transformation Office of BOQ.

The purpose of a Business Analyst is to assist the business stakeholders identify the problem and the expected business and customer outcomes that will determine their actual needs. This is achieved by understanding where the business is today (the current state), where they wish to go (the future state) before determining the gaps that identify the end to end business requirements. Identifying options to the stated problem and outcomes enables the business to select a solution that best fits.

All Analysts are expected to follow BOQ internal guidelines for analysing, eliciting and documenting requirements.


Essential Skills and Experience:

  • Five years proven experience within a Business Analyst position, preferably within the financial services industry
  • Knowledge and previous project experience of AML/CTF compliance requirements would be beneficial, including KYC data collection and verification, monitoring and screening.
  • Strong capabilities across planning, process mapping, requirements gathering and delivery within complex environments
  • Willing to work autonomously and able to show resilience and flexibility in a dynamic environment
  • Experience working across multiple projects will be highly beneficial
  • The ability to produce fit for purpose business requirements and solution options
  • Review all solution documents ensuring they align with business requirements and benefits
  • Strong stakeholder management skills in order to meet project deadlines and expectations
  • Contribute to the continuous capability uplift of the Business Analyst community

  • Salary sacrificing options

GroupM is the world’s leading media investment company responsible for more than $113B in annual media investment through agencies including Mindshare, MediaCom, Wavemaker, Essence and m/SIX, as well as the outcomes-driven programmatic audience company, Xaxis.

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst to join [m]PLATFORM, the data & technology division of GroupM. In this role, you will be responsible for managing, analysing and deriving value from big data. You will be proficient in analytical modelling, have demonstrated research skills and can strategically apply insights for marketing effectiveness.

Reporting of the role:
This role reports to the Senior Manager of Data & Technology – [m]PLATFORM.

3 Best things about the job:

  • Be a member of a high performing team focused on technology, data, partners and platforms, a key strategic growth area for GroupM and WPP.
  • Work in an environment that promotes freedom, flexibility, empowerment and diverse working styles to solve real business problems.
  • Have access to industry leading data assets & technology in the field of data and analytics, where you can develop your skills.


Measures of success -
In 3 months:

  • Has an understanding of [m]PLATFORM operations and commenced utilising the team processes for analytics projects.
  • Reviewed in detail the data infrastructure, assets & tools available, and can extract data for analysis independently.
In 6 months:
  • Develop multiple Business Intelligence dashboards that increase efficiencies in reporting requirements.
  • Built comprehensive models that have resulted in improved ROAS across client media investment strategies.
In 12 months:
  • Established relationships with clients and has created/presented reports & insights on their work.
  • Is viewed as the analytics SME within the team, with demonstrated growth in demand for our services


Responsibilities of the role:

  • Liaise with client & [m]PLATFORM teams to define analytics requirements.
  • Ingest data from various locations & explore to verify integrity.
  • Clean and format different datatypes in preparation for analysis.
  • Develop models using various statistical methodologies.
  • Utilise Cloud Computing for data mining and machine learning tasks.
  • Create test & learn scenarios for performance validation.
  • Implement BI dashboard and visualisations to automate reporting.
  • Generate various static reports such as campaign optimisation, attribution, audience profiling & performance diagnostics.
  • Run ad-hoc analysis for specific use cases.
  • Create and maintain all code and artifacts via a VCS & project system.
  • Present insights, findings and recommendations from your analytics projects.
  • Keep abreast of technological developments within Data & Analytics & share learnings with team.

What you will need:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (statistics, mathematics, economics)
  • Previous experience in an analytical role, ideally within AdTech/Martech
  • Advanced analytical skills across multiple statistical tools & methods.
  • A strong understanding of database structures and data mining.
  • Demonstrated experience with various modelling techniques & machine learnin g applications.
  • Technical proficiency in Excel, SQL, CLI & Python for data analytics
  • Experience in utilising a version control system (GIT/TFS) and project tracking system (Jira/AzureDevOps)
  • Working knowledge of IaaS applications (eg AWS Athena, AWS SageMaker, Google BigQuery, Google Cloud AutoML)
  • Advanced dashboard/visualisation capabilities (Tableau, Datorama, PowerBI)
  • Proven ability to extract insights from data and present findings.
  • Flexibility to work in a cross-functional team but also have the initiative to problem solve independently.

About [m]PLATFORM

[m]PLATFORM is GroupM’s audience intelligence and activation solution that builds personalized consumer relationships at scale.

At the core of [m]PLATFORM is the uniquely powerful consumer identifier, [mp]ID. This ID unifies data to provide the most comprehensive and detailed picture of an individual consumer. This offers brands a rich and holistic view into their consumers’ mindsets and a deep understanding of the impact of their marketing touchpoints. Marketers can now anticipate where consumers are likely to engage and tailor their strategy to ensure they reach the right consumers with a message that is relevant and useful.

In addition to the technology suite, it is a worldwide service organization comprised of analysts, data strategists, search and social specialists, and product and media experts focused on ensuring consistent delivery in all markets where our clients do business.

About Australia

company: Australian Government Department of Human Services
job_desc:
The Information, Debt and Appeals Division is responsible for the development and implementation of the department’s information management strategy, debt and compensation operations and review and appeal processes.

The Debt Management Branch (DMB) is responsible for debt raising, debt recovery and compensation recovery for welfare related payments and debt recovery of Medicare payments. The branch aims to reduce the number and value of debts owed to the Department of Human Services through efficient and effective delivery of all aspects of debt and compensation operations and management.

The Business Demand and Capacity Planning Section has responsibility for:

  • Workload management of three core business functions (Debt Raising, Debt Recovery and Compensation Recovery) within the Debt Management Branch
  • Telephony management including the loading and analysis of the outbound dialler and liaison with Channel Operations Telephony team.
  • Maintaining and supporting delivery of existing systems and processes including Debt Management Information System (DMIS) and Compensation Management System (CMS).
  • Contributing to the identification and implementation of redesigned business process through enhanced technologies, automated solutions, improved, and standardised work management practices.

Working under the general direction of senior staff, DMB Business Analysts exercise a degree of independent judgement and make decisions within defined parameters that require reliance on skills and knowledge. They are responsible for the collection, interpretation and examination of information and data, and contributing to the work areas reports, identifying recommendations using an evidence based approach.

The APS5 Business Analyst has experience in problem solving, business intelligence and stakeholder engagement. He or she will be able to demonstrate the ability to provide solutions through analysis of information and data. They have an understanding of policy and business process and workload management principles. They can manage competing tasks and priorities, and their own workload accordingly.

They are responsible for the collection, interpretation and examination of information or data, and contributing to the work areas reports, findings, decision making or recommendations using an evidence based approach. They contribute to timely management of section workload through managing the section mailbox.

Business Analysts are good communicators who are able to interpret and negotiate stakeholder requests in order to achieve optimal outcomes for both stakeholders and the department. They are able to liaise with a wide range of stakeholders within both the Debt Management Branch and the broader Division and Group.

Business Analysts work well under pressure, under the general direction of senior staff they exercise a degree of independent judgement and have a passion and curiosity for solving problem statements presented to them.

Essential requirements

The successful candidate will be required to currently hold or be able to obtain and maintain a Baseline security clearance.

You're the type of person who has a passion for taking raw numbers and turning them into actionable insights. Your friends all know you as someone with a true interest in technology, who likes nothing more than spotting a creative way to improve a process. Our Team

Bloomberg runs on data, and our Global Data department is responsible for acquiring it and supplying it to our clients. They apply problem-solving skills to identify innovative workflow efficiencies, and they implement technology solutions to improve our systems, products and processes- and all this while providing platinum customer support to our customers.

The Global Data Mortgages team in Sydney is looking for a highly motivated individual with experience in data management and knowledge of financial markets to oversee Structured Finance-related data and content on the Bloomberg Terminal.

  • Support cash flows modelling and collateral surveillance for Structured finance transactions across Asia, with a focus on Australia market

  • Opportunity to gain exposure to and interact with key market players in business and finance
  • Make a true business impact on our products and clients – our data moves markets!

  • Excellent numerical and communication skills
  • Strong project management, problem solving and analytical skills

  • Genuine interest in learning and understanding the Structured Finance products market

  • The ability to multi-task, prioritise and work to tight deadlines

  • Available to start immediately

We'd love you to have:

Optus is no longer just a traditional telco and we have transformed into a mobile-led multimedia company that delivers content and experiences. Do you see yourself as part of our digital success story?

Playing a critical role in the Service Transformation team, you will work on digital and cross-business delivery initiatives with the relevant Service business owners and Transformation leads. You will also work within one or multiple project teams focused on implementing functionality enhancements across the Optus Digital Consumer and Service business, working with business SMEs and other key stakeholders.


Operating in a fast-paced Agile type environment that requires a flexible and pragmatic approach to achieving results, you will communicate project visions and guide the rest of the team to implement the best customer experience (CX) outcomes within the typical constraints that exist in a large and complex telco corporate environment.


To succeed in this role, you will have a good understanding of complex processes and business rules, managing conflicting stakeholder objectives and working with the required teams to propose a solution design that satisfies the business need within system limitations, time, resource and budget constraints.

DTF is looking to a position at the VPS 4 level as an Economist/Analyst.

Social Policy Group provides advice on health, human services, housing and housing affordability, outcomes-based funding and demand forecasting.

In addition to providing advice to Government on key reform policy issues, the Social Policy Group is responsible for implementing the Government's:

  • Partnerships Addressing Disadvantage initiative (formerly the Social Impact Bond Pilot);
  • Government's pilot program for Social Impact Bonds;
  • The HomesVic shared equity pilot; and
  • The $1 billion Victorian Social Housing Growth Fund and the Building the Financial Capacity of Housing Associations (including $1.1 billion of low-cost finance), with the Department of Health and Human Services.


Key accountabilities

  • Work both independently and as part of a team to advise on salient aspects of complex issues relating to social policy, including formulation of practical policy options;
  • Carry out quantitative analysis, especially related to government service delivery and infrastructure demand, to inform policy advice and development;
  • Develop policy proposals and prepare high-quality briefing materials in a timely manner;
  • Develop and maintain effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders;
  • Provide influential financial and commercial analysis;
  • Collaborate on whole of government projects; and
  • Participate in planning and decision-making in the Group.

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management
  • Optimize workflow management to ensure traceability back to strategic alignment
  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)

We stand together as equals. EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here.   • Exceptional skills in modelling software including the MS Office suite and Visio

Classification: APS 6
Position Number: 6928
Tenure: Ongoing
Duration: Permanent
Section: Office of the Chief Economist
Group: Policy and Governance
Division: Policy and Corporate
Location: ACT
Immediate Supervisor: Executive Level 1
Security Classification: ENTRY ONLY

Group Responsibilities

The Policy and Governance Group (PGG) is the agency’s lead on government engagement matters relating to intellectual property (IP). PGG covers a broad range of areas, from legislation through to international policy and trade agreements, from audit and attorney registration to legal advice and economic research. As such, PGG interacts across the agency and contributes to IP Australia’s strategic goals.

Section Responsibilities

IP Australia’s Office of the Chief Economist (OCE) was established in 2012 to enhance the agency’s economic capability, support evidence-based policy through rigorous research and analysis. The OCE also exists to raise awareness of IP economics and contribute to public debate.

The OCE:

  • Influences policy decisions through the provision of robust evidence and data
  • Provides analytical services upon request to internal and external stakeholders
  • Builds and disseminates enriched datasets to support the broader research community with their work
  • Produces analytical insights to be used in papers and the Australian IP Report (annual flagship publication)
  • Provides economic and statistical advice, data support and analysis to other business groups in IP Australia
  • Collaborates with other government agencies and the academia on research projects.

Job Description / Context of the Role

As Data Analyst, you will have strong data analysis and communication skills to work in a challenging and fast-paced environment to deliver a range of data and analytical services for the OCE. You will have a keen interest in data science and take initiatives to develop and refine the data assets built and published by IP Australia. This role may also come with some project management and mentoring responsibilities.

Job Specific Duties

  • Deliver projects to transform administrative data into enriched datasets that can be used to produce analytical insights. This will involve data manipulation and the managing of external contractors to deliver components of the overall project
  • Attend to requests for data and analytical services to support the work of internal and external stakeholders. You will interrogate large datasets in various formats to produce statistical insights
  • Provide statistical advice and analysis to support researchers in the OCE and policy areas in PGG
  • Liaise with stakeholders for data linkage work and the mapping of business facts in IT systems
  • Prepare documentations for data releases, data enrichment methodology and data governance
  • Demonstrate attitudes and behaviours responsive to workplace change
  • Effective engagement with and management of risk within relevant sphere of influence
  • Establish clear expectations, achieve work objectives, take ownership and honours commitments.
  • Maintain an understanding of their/worker responsibilities under the Work Health & Safety Act 2011 (WHS Act) and a commitment to promoting a healthy and safe workplace.

Job Specific Capabilities

The ideal candidate should have strong conceptual skills, highly developed technical skills and a willingness to take initiatives to drive continuous improvement in the work that we do. This role is challenging but ultimately rewarding for people who are motivated and can stay focused to solve complex problems.

The successful candidate will also possess the following:

  • Ability to use programming languages to conduct analytics and data wrangling
  • Programing experience in Python, R, Stata or SQL is highly desirable
  • Ability to deliver work commitments in a fast-paced customer focused team environment
  • Well-developed verbal and written communication skills to explain complex concepts
  • Experience in working with "big data" or administrative data is desirable
  • Understanding of basic economic principles is an advantage
  • Experience in data visualisation is also an advantage
  • Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline is highly desirable.

Application Requirements

To apply for this position, candidates are required to:

  • write, in no more than 1000 words, on how their knowledge, skills and experience make them suitable for this role
  • frame your response around the job specific duties and capabilities
  • provide a current CV detailing employment history and academic qualifications
  • provide the name and contact details of two professional referees.

Applications must be submitted through the IP Australia Web Recruitment system (ESS). Please note that you MUST be an Australian Citizen to work in the APS and to meet IP Australia’s security clearance requirements.

Contact Officer

For further information pertaining to this job please contact Razib Tuhin on 02 6283 2781

job_title: Business Analyst, Technology, Financial Services Advisory – Melbourne

Our firm belief is that by following our operating philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come.

AIA Careers

This is an experienced Agile BA role. We have a developing agile capability that’s looking to take things to the next level so this is an opportunity to bring your experience and ideas to help us level up!

This role will be required to work with internal teams as well as partners and vendors to ensure consistency and quality of delivery.

job_title: Information Management/Data Management Business Analyst Executive
job_desc:
In this key business focused role, supporting the Financial Management Group, you will be required to work with the business cross functionally and build and maintain strong relationships, and influence your key stakeholders. You will assist the Group in the implementation of the Information Management Strategy and in identifying its Critical Data and bringing that data under governance. This will include understanding data usage across the Group, detailing data lineage and capturing data risks and control within the end-to-end data flow. Your stakeholder group will be broad and your success in the role will require exceptional stakeholder management, and the ability to lead and inspire technical people alike.

You will act as a brand ambassador for good data management practices and will represent and be the voice of the Financial Management Group in Group-wide Data Working Groups and forums. This role is an excellent opportunity for someone who is passionate about data quality, able to build strong relationships and influence outcomes, and take people on the journey. Being a self-starter, driven and curious, will also be key, as you will be solving complex issues and providing solutions to the Group.

Prior experience as a Business Analyst in Regulatory Reporting, Regulatory Change or finance projects is highly sought after and an understanding of data related Regulatory Requirements e.g. BCBs 239 and APRA CPG 235 is highly regarded.

If this sounds like the right opportunity to further your career, apply today.

The Financial Management Group provides financial, tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management, managing Macquarie's funding, liquidity and capital position, ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate communications and investor relations.

Find out more about Macquarie careers at www.macquarie.com/careers


Macquarie understands the importance of diversity and inclusion - our long history of success has come from being different. At Macquarie we value the innovation and creativity that diversity of thought brings. The one thing we all have in common is our focus on high performance. If you're capable, motivated and can deliver, we want you on our team.

We facilitate a range of flexible working arrangements within our teams. Talk to us about what flexibility may be available.

• 6 Months Max-Term role based in Melbourne or Sydney
  • Great organisation culture, promoting a positive work/life balance
  • Bring your energy background experience and be a part of transformation project

Alinta Energy is a fast-growing Australian energy generator and retailer with an owned and contracted generation portfolio of around 3,000MW and over one million combined electricity and gas retail customers in Australia. We employ over 700 people throughout operations across five of Australia’s six states as well as New Zealand. With a decades-long history in Australia, we’re proud to be able to deliver an essential service to our customers.

We’re determined to make energy more affordable and we are committed to securing an energy mix that delivers on this challenge. This involves working to deliver 1,000MW of owned and contracted renewable generation by 2020.

It’s an exciting time to join Alinta Energy as we undergo a large Enterprise transformation. We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our dynamic Merchant Energy team. Reporting to the Manager, Merchant Energy Business Architecture, this role will play a critical role in Alinta’s implementation of procedural and technical changes arising out AEMO’s move to Five-Minute Settlement (5MS) and a Global Settlement (GS) framework.

Focusing on impacts to bidding and settlements, the role will be instrumental in translating procedural and technical specifications from the market operator into high-quality requirements to be implemented as part of Alinta’s ongoing transformation of its systems and processes

Additional responsibilities will include:

  • Interpret and document detailed procedural changes for NEM bidding and settlements as and when they are made available by AEMO
  • Interpret and document detailed technical requirements for billing and settlements as and when they are made available by AEMO
  • Contribute to the development and maintenance of a detailed register of 5MS and GS requirements
  • Work with technology vendors to monitor their progress in the delivery of changes to meet 5MS and GS milestones
  • Assist stakeholders in the Merchant Energy, Finance and IT transformation programs in solution design to address all 5MS and GS requirements for bidding and settlements
  • Assist the Program Director and Coordinator in the tracking of delivery against regulatory change requirements
  • Assist the Program Coordinator in the reporting of program performance for the steering committee
  • Attend AEMO Bidding and Settlements working groups, representing Alinta’s interest in these meetings

To be successful you will have:

  • Tertiary level qualification in business, IT or similar
  • Experience in the National Energy Market and the systems and procedures that underpin it
  • Technical knowledge of requirements gathering, process documentation, project planning, testing methodologies, change management methodologies
  • The ability to interpret large volumes of procedural documentation and translate them into business requirements
  • Excellent analytical skills with ability to understand complex systems and data flows with little or no documentation
  • Ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences, and adapt complex information into simple messages
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Ability to gather and analyse data and guide the business towards appropriate solutions
  • Experience with physical markets bidding systems in the Australian electricity industry
  • Experience with industry-wide changes in the Australian energy industry e.g. Power of Choice

You may be a seasoned energy market professional or an experienced analyst looking to take your next step in your career and to be a part of transformation Program

Please note these roles will have a national focus, therefore there is flexibility for the positions to be based in Melbourne or Sydney

It’s an exciting time to join Alinta, we are growing fast and need people who want to grow with us!

Let’s spread the positive energy together…

Click “APPLY” to submit your application.

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads

About RAA:


RAA is one of South Australia’s most trusted and respected organisations and has a proud history of over 110 years servicing the South Australian community. We provide a wide range of services and facilities for more than 700,000 members and employ over 850 people within South Australia.


About the role:


RAA’s Insurance Claims department is undergoing unprecedented growth, and hence this exciting opportunity exists for an experienced Business Process Analyst to join the Claims Business Support Team.


This role will see you utilise your Process Analysis skills to deliver Process, Quality and Performance Analysis services to the Insurance Claims operational department. You will also utilise your experience to help increase the maturity and formalise the approaches of this growing capability within the department.


You will provide well-informed and relevant input, feedback and recommendations that ensure Claims outcomes are optimised during process and operational improvements. You will participate in and actively coordinate Claims change initiatives to ensure changes are successfully implemented.


Responsibilities:


  • Discover, define, document and maintain as-is/to-be business processes & requirements in a variety of ways suitable for intended audience
  • Develop and maintain broad knowledge of Claims business processes to ensure informed analysis and recommendations are delivered
  • Analyse impacts of proposed changes, provide feedback and assist with decision making where required
  • Proactively identify and recommend current and future process improvement opportunities within Claims operations and Business Support Team processes
  • Represent Claims in externally-driven change initiatives, and ensure Claims best interests are considered
  • Utilise change management frameworks and tools to coordinate change initiatives, maximise change adoption, measure change effectiveness and support change efforts
  • Assist in the analysis of quality issues by providing data, reports, audits, insights and recommendations that support quality management objectives

What you need:


  • Solid experience in a Process Analysis role, or similar, working with front line business units (e.g. Business Subject Matter Expert, Systems Analyst, Systems Tester)
  • Insurance Claims operational experience would be beneficial, but not essential
  • Working knowledge of Change Management frameworks and approaches
  • Demonstrated experience in identifying and successfully implementing changes or improvements to drive efficiency, increase capability or improve services
  • Ability to articulate problems, identify root causes, analyse and determine impacts, and recommend relevant solutions or actions
  • Ability to conceptualise process changes and develop documentation that supports training, coaching, change adoption and knowledge sharing

What we offer:


  • Free RAA Premium Road Service & Home Security Monitoring
  • Discounts on all RAA Products and Services
  • Flexible Work Arrangements
  • Ongoing Training & Development Opportunities & Study Support Program
  • Onsite Massage, Well-being Facilities and Corporate Health Insurance Plan
  • Annual Bonus Incentive
  • On-site Café

As Business Analyst, you’ll work closely with Product Owners , Design and development teams to ensure customer and commercial goals for the product are effectively translated into stories, epics and tasks for the development team, and that the development team has all of the information it needs day to day to deliver.

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management
  • Optimize workflow management to ensure traceability back to strategic alignment
  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)

Information Technology Services

The Division of Information Technology Services (ITS) at The University of Queensland provides an information environment that supports the teaching, learning, research and engagement objectives of the University and contributes positively to the student experience and the University’s reputation, in line with our values of excellence, creativity, respect, supporting others, diversity, honesty and accountability. It comprises three major sections located across the University’s campuses: Academic Services, Enterprise Support and University Networks. Also located within ITS is the internationally recognised network security group, AusCERT, which provides internet security services throughout Australia and New Zealand. ITS manage core networks not only for the whole of The University of Queensland but also works with other Queensland universities to manage access to the national university network (AARNet). ITS also operates Supercomputers and many of the University’s largest servers.

For further information visit our website www.its.uq.edu.au

Information for Prospective Staff

Information about life at UQ including staff benefits, relocation and UQ campuses is available at - http://www.uq.edu.au/current-staff/working-at-uq

About This Opportunity

The position will play a key role in transformational initiatives at UQ. The position provides a high level of analysis, design, and support for key data governance and data architecture activities within the University. The position is also responsible for leading and mentoring other analytical and data modelling staff in projects to deliver sophisticated data modelling solutions to support many data intensive initiatives.

Our Ideal Candidate

The ideal candidate should have demonstrated experience working on data analysis and modelling projects, including the investigation and analysis of key data sets and their relationship with business functions. They will interact confidently and effectively with stakeholders, both technical and non-technical, at all levels of seniority across the university. They will demonstrate the ability to provide leadership and mentoring to other data modellers, developers, business analysts or technical engineers. Experience with database development, especially database design in an agile software environment, will be valued. Applicants should possess qualifications in relevant disciplines.

You must have ongoing unrestricted work rights in Australia to apply for this opportunity.

We value diversity and inclusion, and actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity to the University. Our Diversity and Inclusion webpage contains further information if you require additional support. Accessibility requirements and/or adjustments can be directed to recruitment@uq.edu.au.

What We Can Offer

This is a fixed term position for 2 years at HEW level 8.

The full-time equivalent base salary will be in the range $ 96,466 - $ 108,318, plus super of up to 17% (total package will be in the range $ 112.865 - $ 127,424 p.a.)

You will be able to take advantage of UQ Sport Facilities, salary sacrificing options, on-campus childcare, discounted private health insurance, cheap parking, development programs and many other benefits.

For further information, please review The University of Queensland's Enterprise Bargaining Agreement 2018-2021.

As a Data Scientist you will support our complaints Insights & Analytics team to make informed decisions through the application of data mining, predictive analytics and machine learning techniques. You will work closely with business partners to understand the business objectives and challenges to design analytical solutions to meet business goals.

Adept at using large data sets and streaming data to find opportunities to help optimise portfolio performance, you will identify customer needs and test the effectiveness of different courses of action. You will have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analytics methods, using a variety of analytics tools, building and implementing models. You will naturally demonstrate a proven ability to drive business results with data-based insights and must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams.


What is in it for me?

You will have the opportunity to build something from scratch. You are joining a new team and have the opportunity to automate a high percentage of the text analytics workload that is currently processed manually. This is your chance to really make the role your own and put your own unique footprint on it, with the opportunity to build your networks, knowledge and profile internally with stakeholders from across the bank.


What do I need?

  • Excellent proficiency in translating and analysing data
  • Strong working and conceptual knowledge of building and maintaining physical and logical data models

  • A minimum of 3 years’ experience in statistical modelling in a big data environment (Hadoop/Spark/R/Python) in Financial Services/Banking or similar industry
  • Knowledge of a variety of statistical and data mining techniques (regression, statistical tests and proper usage, random forest, clustering, decision tree learning, deep learning text mining etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
  • Experience with Natural Language Processing and unstructured data an advantage
  • Tertiary education in the Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics disciplines

What’s it like to work here?

You’ll join a small and agile newly formed team, so it could be ambiguous at times but you will have a chance to join the team at inception which is really exciting. You’ll also be doing your bit to reach our vision to become one of the world’s greatest service companies. As an equal opportunity employer, we celebrate difference and love having a diverse and inclusive workplace.

solutions, delivery of technology solutions, including digital technologies

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.
