Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management
  • Optimize workflow management to ensure traceability back to strategic alignment
  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)

This position is also involved in policy creation and review, assisting with tender documentation, briefs and business cases.

  • Excellent planning, time management and organisational skills particularly in the area of managing multiple tasks and multi-disciplinary issues to meet deadlines.
  • Demonstrated experience as a change agent and in providing advice on and interventions for complex change issues across ICT programs.
  • Current NSW drivers' license and willingness to travel to all facilities within Northern Sydney and Central Coast Local Health Districts.
  • Strong negotiation skills and ability to work within multi-disciplinary teams and key stakeholders both internal and external to the organisation to achieve desired outcomes.

Specialist Business Analyst

  • Attractive salary package and eligibility for a wide range of Rio Tinto benefits
  • Excellent career progression opportunities
  • Monday to Friday Darwin based position – ERA

About the role

An exciting opportunity exists for a Specialist Business Analyst to join the ERA team. Your role will be instrumental in the analysis and evaluation of the operation. You will be someone that thrives under pressure and can handle an often fast paced and challenging environment with tight deadlines.

Working Monday to Friday in Darwin, reporting to the Manager Finance, you will be involved in completing cost and business analysis to support ERA in maximising business value. This will include effective information gathering and robust analysis of alternative proposals and options, developing business models, forecasting systems and valuations, challenging business assumptions and recommending practical solutions.

About you

To be successfully considered for this role, you will have:

  • An undergraduate degree in Finance, Accounting or Commerce
  • Demonstrated business analysis experience
  • Experience and ability in economic analysis and modelling of investment opportunities
  • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills
  • Experience in a similar role preferably within the mining or heavy engineering industry
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to influence others
  • Strong analytical abilities and attention to detail
  • A current and valid manual ‘C Class’ driver's license

Where you will be working

Energy Resources of Australia Ltd (ERA) provides clean energy to the world, and as a trusted partner cares for both people and country. Uranium has been mined at Ranger for more than 35 years. During that time, Ranger has produced in excess of 125,000 tonnes of uranium oxide. ERA is committed to protecting the surrounding environment in which it operates and to demonstrating world class progressive rehabilitation practices. Since 2012, ERA has spent more than $452 million on rehabilitation and water management projects. ERA values safety, teamwork, respect, integrity and excellence, and places a high value on training and professional development of its employees. With corporate offices in Darwin and operations in Jabiru, ERA offers a wide variety of career opportunities, actively encourages Indigenous employment, and supports workplace diversity. The Ranger mine is on Aboriginal land and surrounded by, but separate from, the spectacular Kakadu National Park.

About us

As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.

Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents. Aluminium and copper, diamonds, gold and industrial minerals, iron ore and uranium: our materials make up the world around us. You’ll find then in smartphones, planes, cars, hospitals and throughout your home.

Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce

We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career.

Apply today if you want to work with the latest technology and innovation, in an environment where we challenge you to drive positive change.

Please note, in order to be successfully considered for this role you must complete all pre-screening questions.

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management
  • Optimize workflow management to ensure traceability back to strategic alignment
  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)

The Team

VIX Verify is a world-leading, fast-growing international software-as-a-service company providing identification services to financial institutions, telecommunications providers and other businesses where customer identification is essential. This excellent opportunity will have you working on VIX Verify’s on-line identity products that are used by many of Australia and the world's biggest and most progressive businesses.

The Role

Due to the expansion and growth of the company, we are looking for an experienced and capable Business Analyst to join our team. This position is a permanent full-time role based in Belconnen, Canberra ACT, and offers a rare opportunity to work in a fast growing, best of breed company that retains the atmosphere and culture of a start-up. If you're passionate about doing great work in a fantastic, flexible environment then this could be for you.

What you will do

As part of Agile development teams you will:

  • analyse business requirements and customer/user needs and map these to potential system solutions
  • facilitate meetings with internal business and technology subject matter experts, and external stakeholders where possible, to elicit business requirements
  • take the lead in breaking high-level requirements down into small, achievable, vertically-sliced user stories
  • take the lead in creating acceptance criteria that clearly articulate the functionality tests needed before a user story can be considered completed
  • create wireframes that consider UX principles and clearly articulate the desired user interface for a given story or solution
  • take the lead in ensuring team members contribute to the creation of, and deeply understand, all user stories at the appropriate points in the development cycle
  • advise testers and developers to ensure automated and manual testing has adequately considered the acceptance criteria
  • take the lead in analysing and discussing small customer-requested functionality enhancements to a sufficient detail that the team can arrive at reasonable, considered development time estimates

As part of our Design and Quality community of practice you will:

  • contribute to improvements in processes and practices as they relate to analysis, design and quality assurance work
  • use techniques and practices as recommended by our design and quality community of practice (where practical and appropriate)

To enable you to be successful, we are looking for

Skills:

  • Customer-focused and enjoys helping others

About the company:

Inenco is one of Australia’s great success stories that started back in 1954 and has clearly established itself as an Industrial industry leader across Australia, New Zealand and South-East Asia. With over 3000 major suppliers, a 160-branch network covering 20 business units and employing over 1500 employees it is clear that Inenco delivers on product and service and is now ready to move to take on new challenges whilst remaining true to its defines purpose of keeping its customers plant and equipment operating efficiently. Our core product lines embrace bearings, power transmission, sealing, fasteners, driveshafts, drives and motors, belting, fluid power, engineering services, lifting and safety equipment, tools and maintenance products.

As the Business Analyst you will work with complex datasets to build dashboards, pricing initiatives and business processes to gain market share and achieve revenue goals. This is a highly analytical role that requires you to be able review data from multiple sources (TM1, SQL, Phocas, IMAS, eCOS) and develop complex models to help the business achieve and exceed sales and margin targets.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Monitor industry trends to improve revenue/margin and recommend strategies or actions
  • Work with senior managers and other stakeholders to monitor adoption of, and increase usage of, Business Intelligence tools
  • Maintain databases on market trends, industry wide on competitor performance, analyse and report on emerging threats or opportunities
  • Prepare and present market trends and activity at a strategic level
  • Perform statistical modelling and cost/benefit analysis for the evaluation of alternative business strategies and provide recommendations
  • Develop top level business performance indicators to support and monitor business strategy implementation.
  • Provide analysis of key performance indicators and recommend adjustments to implementation procedures
  • Assess data and use it to derive insights into business strategies and market trends
To be successful in this role you should possess the following:
  • Tertiary Qualifications in Commerce, Mathematics, Finance/Statistics, Marketing is highly desirable, together with a minimum of 3-5 years related work experience
  • Extensive hands-on working knowledge of MS Office as well as experience using either Power BI, Tableau, Domo, Looker, IBM Cognos or Qlikview. Intermediate skills in TM1 or SQL are highly desirable
  • Confidence to use a variety of quantitative and qualitative methods to analyse our business data, assess margins and market share
  • Ability to develop business intelligence tools that can be used quickly to respond to changing market needs and trends
  • Sound ability to present findings to Executives, Marketing Teams, Operations teams other internal stakeholders
  • Highly developed communication skills – written and verbal
  • Experience working in a cross functional team with multiple internal and external stakeholders.
  • Advanced organisational, time management and planning skills.
In return our company benefits:
  • Career development- We encourage our staff members to reach their full potential by undertaking approved part-time study when relevant to their current or potential position and we will reimburse all course fees and textbooks upon successfully completing each stage of approved courses!
  • Corporate Super benefits- access to corporate Private Health cover
  • Vehicle Purchase- Inenco staff offer price advantage with a few major car brands
  • Starting with a well remunerated position that will be both rewarding and fulfilling, as well as, working as part of an enjoyable work environment.
  • Opportunities to move within the company and leverage the skills already gained in current and previous roles
You must be either an Australian Citizen or a holder of an Australian Permanent Residency Visa to be eligible to apply for this position.

Who are We?

At Target, our customers are at the heart of everything we do. Our quality fashion helps families live better by making it easy to love, easy to find and easy to buy online and in-store. We are focused on delivering products that truly excite our customers with quality that endures and making life just a little bit easier for Mum.

What will you do?

Target is investing in our data science and analytics capabilities and we are seeking an experienced Data Scientist to join our established and expanding team based at Williams Landing in West Melbourne. This is a new role that will see you working with varied data sets from across the business and dealing with retail transaction, customer, HR, logistics data on a daily basis.

As a Data Scientist, you will interpret retail business needs and translate them in to appropriate analytical methods and models to deliver the desired business benefits and outcomes.

We are well resourced and use a varied toolkit; provide analysts/scientists a lot of freedom to work with their preferred tools and master new ones.

You will be well supported from other data scientists from across the Wesfarmers business along with business translators, visualisation specialists and data engineers that are part of the team.

But we don’t just look for someone based on their skills and experience, our people work together and champion the Target values and behaviours. We are a business where our values and people matter, and we need like-minded people to join us!

Target values diversity and we pride ourselves on representing the diverse and multicultural communities of which we are a part.

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management
  • Optimize workflow management to ensure traceability back to strategic alignment
  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)

Overview of job
Wavemaker is an agency of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally. We are currently looking for a Data Analyst to join us. In this role, you will be responsible for helping to drive great data-driven work for our clients. You will play a key role in producing modelling insights for analysis to help drive optimal response to media, liaising with client teams when required and fielding technical questions.

The Analytics Associate Manager plays key role in delivering our reporting product and uses their skills to measure marketing effectiveness.

Reporting of the role This role reports to: National Head of Technology Platforms

3 best things about the job:

  • You get to work with some of the biggest businesses in Australia, helping them make sense of their data.
  • Media is constantly evolving and new channels are created all the time e.g. Snapchat, Spotify, Podcasts - it’s never dull!
  • A culture that encourages new thinking as opposed to maintaining the status quo


In this role, your goals will be:
In three months:

  • Managing the day-to-day maintenance and updates of reporting dashboards
  • You will be up to speed on all Group M preferred technology partners by attending training sessions

In six months:

  • Familiarised yourself with Wavemaker product and service offering
  • Earned the trust of client partner teams, having them turn to you for assistance in making their own basic data analysis more meaningful
  • Designed and implemented advanced BI visualisations with tools like Datorama or Tableau
  • Understood the Australian media landscape (for example, channel pros and cons, main players)

In 12 months:

  • Helped improve how execs and assistants in the client partner teams use data in their day to day roles
  • Contributed to our analytics product roadmap - helping drive our product even further
  • Made a key contribution to a new business pitch or two from a data planning point of view


What your day job looks like at Wavemaker:

  • Develop and maintain reporting solutions for business teams and clients that deliver insights in a timely and accurate fashion. This includes extracting, manipulating, and loading data into dashboard solutions.
  • Contribute to new business pitches when required
    • This might include presenting, creating content and any other areas requested by senior pitch staff.
  • Champion better use of software and technology within Wavemaker
    • Tools include Tableau, and standard media tools such as Roy Morgan Asteroid
  • Promote open, collaborative, supportive and dynamic relationships throughout the agency and the network
  • Build relationships with client analytics teams and key data/tech vendors
  • Respond well to guidance and feedback from line manager
  • Assist the internal training and development of Maxus staff by helping upskill employees in the areas of data and analytics
  • Build relationships with key clients. These are often members of the client’s data teams and/or gatekeepers to business critical data sets.
  • Help build on the agency's reputation for outstanding client service. Ensure delivery against client expectations every time – “under promise/over deliver”


What you’ll bring:

  • Someone who is numerate and statistically savvy
  • A problem solving mentality
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Know how to use the likes of Python, VBA, and/or R
  • SQL writing skills
  • Knowledge of Javascript, J Query, html and CSS.
  • Experience designing and deploying reports/dashboards/data visualisation
  • Experience in data analysis, modelling, and design
  • Good statistical and analytical knowledge
  • Strong attention to detail with the ability to document business and technical requirements based on user interviews.
  • Excellent analytical, organization and prioritization skills
  • Communicate complex topics to team through both written and oral communication

Wavemaker is a billion dollar-revenue next generation agency that sits at the intersection of media, content and technology. We invented WM Momentum, the world's most comprehensive study into how people make purchase decisions and have conducted over 375,000 surveys in 70 markets and across more than 30 categories. About Us
Quality and freshness doesn’t come easy, which is why we have a fantastic group of people working around the clock at Woolworths Distribution Centres to tackle the mind boggling logistical challenge of coordinating supplies from the farm-gate to supermarket shelves across the state.
Our Distribution Centres are also a critical control point in checking the quality of fresh food and placing it in the optimal conditions to protect its flavour, freshness and texture. Alongside the top service we provide to our supermarkets we also have super performance in our Distribution Network which store stock for many of our other brands such as BWS, Dan Murphy’s, Big W, to mention just a few.

About The Role


Process Controller | A Fresh New Direction


Do you have automation, manufacturing or planning experience and want to continue to work in our team for our new Distribution Centre?

  • Dandenong South Location
  • Fully Automated DC
  • Technology on a large scale
  • There are three different shift options available: Day shift (typically 0600 -1400), afternoon shift (typically 1400 - 2200), or night shift ( typically 2200 - 0600). Penalty rates apply for Afternoon and Night shift.

The Woolworths Melbourne South Regional Distribution Centre (MSRDC) is a state-of-the-art distribution facility utilising the latest cutting-edge technology in automation so that we can ensure efficient, quality service to our customers and stores in Victoria.

This new facility is the largest single infrastructure investment in Woolworths history, expected to deliver significant safety, accuracy, efficiency and productivity benefits. Located in Dandenong South, MSRDC will operate 24-hours per day, seven days a week and provide the bulk of ambient grocery needs to our Woolworths stores in Victoria.

The scale, automation and technology in our new facility has opened up a frontier in supply chain employment and career opportunities that support our wider Woolworths commitment to diversity and inclusion. Our new DC will offer individuals opportunities to work in a variety of roles, across different shifts to suit the availability, lifestyle, skill set and experiences of a wide range of people.

The purpose of this role is to manage and oversee the performance of Flow System Operations of MSRDC to meet People, Safety and Service expectations, contributing to the achievement of overall DC business performance. You are responsible for the control room activity on the specific shift that they manage. They are also accountable to ensure all activities on that shift are communicated to all key stakeholders for either hand over or reviewing purposes


A summary of responsibilities will include however not be limited to:


  • Monitoring DC progress against the daily Operational Plan (e.g. unloading rates, receiving rate, delivery windows) to ensure performance/service levels are met.
  • Report on any deviations to plan from automation (e.g. we are falling behind in our palletising area and this might risk the DC’s ability to hit delivery windows).
  • Work with SCADA Operators to understand cause and effect of automation issues, from an operational perspective.
  • Communication conduit between Jam Busters and Team Leaders to rectify known product issues causing automation problems.
  • Use automation and related systems, including Planning tools, Operational Dashboards, CCTV, UHF Radios
  • Comply with safety policies, procedures and role responsibilities as defined in the Supply Chain Safety Management Procedure SHE-SC-S01-P02 SH&E Responsibilities .
  • Perform user and product audits and identify where adjustments are required to improve accuracy.
  • Manage the introduction of new products into the DC and the required system information to allow for automated handling.
  • Correct problems related to product handling issues throughout the DC including root cause analysis and rectification.
  • Maintain accurate inventory and provide internal and external business units with accurate reports

About You


Woolworths people are great people and joining the Big Shed Community is like being part of a big family. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together, our customers are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re the sort of individual who takes accountability and strives to always do the right thing for each other, our communities, our customers, and our business then we ought to connect.


Together with demonstrated success in a similar role and your ability to influence , we are seeking the following skills and experience:

  • Operational experience working in Supply Chain or manufacturing environments.
  • Experience with Automated machinery (desirable but not necessary)
  • Experience with Automation and/or Control Room systems, including planning systems
  • Experience with Warehouse Management Systems.
  • Exposure to SCADA systems.
  • Problem Solving skills and process improvement experience

We’re social! - connect with us at #WOWcareers through LinkedIn, #Li, Facebook, Instagram or via www.wowcareers.com.au


As part of creating a safe working environment, our Distribution Centres operates under a Drug & Alcohol Policy for all those on site. Employees are subject to possible random testing, and applicants to this role can expect to undergo tests as part of the recruitment process, in addition to a full physical."

ICT Business Analyst Required

(Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central) for Austral Dynamics Pty Ltd

based in Sydney Olympic Park

Austral Dynamics Pty Ltd is a fast-growing Dynamics 365 Business Central Partner. Austral Dynamics Pty Ltd is a business software solution provider based in Sydney that services clients in most states of Australia and in the Pacific region.

We are dedicated to supporting the Business Central product and have a very experienced team of expert consultants in the field, all with more than 10 years' experience. We aim to exceed our customers' expectations through excellent service.

The successful candidate will be implementing Business Central Software at customers.

A full-time position for an ICT Business Analyst is available for an immediate start.

Specific duties and responsibilities for the position of ICT Business Analyst are as follows:

  • functional consulting in Business Central, requiring scoping of customer requirements, writing functional requirement documents
  • configuring the software
  • managing modifications
  • training
  • supporting
  • pre-sale demonstrations.

The successful candidate should either have a minimum Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field and at least 3 years-experience in Business Central or Dynamics NAV or if without a formal qualification in the specified field, must have at least 7 years-experience in the same. The successful candidate should also have an understanding of how systems will meet customer's strategic objectives and demonstrating this to the decision makers in organisations.

The candidate should be self-motivated, and customer focused with excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Attention to detail is important in the role. We are looking for someone with a positive attitude, self-starter, skilled at implementing solutions and experienced at support. The candidate must be hard working, organised, creative and passionate about working in a team environment. He or she will be required to work in a high-pressure environment.

We have a good team environment based in a great setting in Sydney Olympic Park. The position will attract an annual base salary of AUD 70,000 plus superannuation. Please send your resume to Austral Dynamics Pty Ltd at Suite 1.03, Level 1, Quad 1, 8 Parkview Drive, Sydney Olympic Park, NSW, 2127, Australia or email info@australdynamics.com.

Application closing date is the 16th of June 2019 at 5pm.

job_title: Global Investment Banking & Capital Markets | Summer Analyst 2020
job_desc:
Our Business

Global Investment Banking focuses on building long-term relationships with more than 3,000 large corporations, financial institutions and financial sponsors, by providing strong advisory expertise and capitalizing on powerful M&A, corporate banking, treasury, debt and equity product expertise to deliver integrated financial solutions. We have a significant presence in the Americas, Europe, Emerging Markets (ex-Asia) and Asia Pacific.

Overview

We are looking for Summer Interns from a wide range of disciplines with demonstrable energy, drive to succeed and a strong desire to make a difference – is that you?

Summer Analysts in the Asia Pacific region participate in an 8 - 11 week program, depending on location, which is designed to give you a unique opportunity to gain exposure to life in Investment Banking & Capital Markets. The program begins with firm wide orientation and continues throughout the internship with training, networking events and social activities across the Global business.

As a Summer Analyst within Investment Banking, you will:

  • Be part of a highly structured and dedicated program with global reach. You will develop technical and soft skills in a fun global team environment and leave us with a holistic understanding of our firm and the people within it
  • Work on projects alongside bankers in specific industry, product and country coverage groups, providing you with a unique learning opportunity
  • Help the team deliver solutions to clients leveraging full spectrum of the bank's capabilities
  • Actively contribute to the preparation of client presentations and underlying financial analysis
  • Develop a global network. You will learn from, and work with, teams consisting of professionals drawn from across the business, including senior bankers within your group, experts in other areas of the firm and colleagues from around the globe
  • Build relationships, knowledge and experience that will open doors to a wide range of future career options and opportunities

Unique to Bank of America Merrill Lynch is our provision of a Chief Resource Officer (CRO). The CRO’s sole purpose is to manage and optimize the junior banker experience on a very hands-on manner. The CRO partners closely with senior leadership to instill the firm’s culture, to ensure work/life balance and to provide a well rounded, fun and value-add experience for junior bankers.

In some countries, Summer Analysts are placed in a generalist team which means a 'staffer' will staff you on projects in specific industry, product and country coverage groups. In other countries, Summer Analysts are placed directly with a specific team throughout the internship. Team placement is determined by considering business needs and the interests/skills of the Summer Analyst.

The various Investment Banking groups span across country, industry and product (not all groups exist in all countries):

Country:

  • Australia
  • Hong Kong
  • India
  • Japan
  • Singapore
  • China
  • Korea

Industry:

  • Consumer Retail Healthcare
  • Energy and Power
  • Financial Institutions
  • Global Industrials including Metals & Mining
  • Real Estate & Gaming
  • Telecom, Media & Technology

Product:

  • Financial Sponsors
  • General Execution
  • Mergers & Acquisitions

Qualifications

  • Penultimate year undergraduate/master student
  • On track to receive a GPA 3.5/4 or above (2.1 degree or above - UK system). You do not need to have a background in finance or accounting to apply
  • Outstanding academic achievement which is complemented by other socioeconomic extracurricular activities

Required Skills and Abilities

  • Strong quantitative and analytical skills
  • Effective verbal and written communication
  • Comfortable with change and adjust to changing demands and requirements
  • A strong team player
  • Demonstrates energy and drive
  • Creative thinking and problem-solving skills
  • Demonstrates a keen interest in the business you are applying to
  • Fluency in English is essential, appropriate Asian language skills are also essential for some roles and countries

Training & Program Highlights

The 8-11 week program are designed to help you decide whether our offer matches your aspirations and include:

  • A dedicated Chief Resource Officer (CRO) who is tasked with managing and optimizing the junior banker experience
  • An induction and training program with classroom and on the job instruction
  • Summer Senior Speaker Series, featuring global and divisional presentations by top executives
  • Formal career support via buddies, CROs, mentors and staffers who will help you navigate through the program
  • Opportunities to interact with senior bankers and network with peers
  • Constructive feedback sessions through performance evaluations

How to Apply

  • Select 'Apply' and sign in as a new or returning user
  • Complete all sections of the application form, followed by the online assessment
  • Upload cover letter and/or resume to support your application
  • Submit form - please note that in order for your application to be considered, you must have completed the form, the online assessment and uploaded your resume before local Melbourne time, 12pm, 16 July 2019.
Application Deadline

July 16 2019

10/05/2019

28/05/2019 (Midnight)

Job Description

Working within the Strategic Budget Analysis and Reporting unit, you will support the management of the $15 billion budget for the Department of Education and Training. Your main role will involve maintaining a working relationship with the Department of Treasury and Finance and internal stakeholders, through provision of financial information and reporting activities, i.e., the monthly variance analysis report and maintaining the Department's forward estimates through preparing financial journals to update the State Resource Information Management System (SRIMS). In addition, you will provide assistance to program areas in the preparation of costing estimates for the Expenditure Review Committee (ESC) process and be involved in the preparation of the annual State Budget Papers and Annual Financial Reports.

To be successful in this role, financial experience gained within the government sector is essential.

Ideally, you will bring strong technical, analytical and systems skills as applied in a management accountant/analyst role within the Victorian Government. You will have a strong background in budget and management reporting and have familiarity with the state budget cycle and associated legislative requirements.

Your ability to interpret data and draw sound conclusions will be vital, and you will be comfortable working flexibly, dealing with ambiguity and thinking on your feet to ensure that ad-hoc tasks are delivered accurately in a timeline driven environment. You will be rewarded with hands-on exposure to key financial processes such as the preparation of the State Budget Papers, ERSC submissions and build on your non-financial skills through writing Ministerial briefs and coordinating responses from internal stakeholders as well as drafting monthly agenda, minutes and other administrative tasks for the Budget and Management Committee. Demonstrated ability to prepare financial journals and deal with multiple priorities and stakeholders at once is essential.

For more details regarding this position please see attached position descriptions.

Department of Education and Training is committed to diversity. The Department places considerable effort and resources into responding to the needs of staff with a disability. People from disadvantaged groups are encouraged to apply for this position. If you require assistance, with the recruitment process, have accessibility or adjustment requirements, please communicate with the contact person listed on this job advertisement or contact the People Division via email: vps.hr.services@edumail.vic.gov.au

Information about the Department of Education and Training's operations and employment conditions can be obtained from the following websites: www.education.vic.gov.au and http://www.education.vic.gov.au/hrweb/Pages/default.aspx.

Applications close 28 May 2019

Would you like to work in a dynamic and challenging environment where you will be supported to reach your potential? There are opportunities available for the role of State Business Analyst in Melbourne.

About the Role:


Working within the National Field environment, you will ensure that the accurate analysis of market performance is communicated to State Management. This analysis of statistical data and market information will support the monitoring, planning and development processes of the business in order to achieve sales & marketing objectives.

You will provide the State Management team with regular updates on progress against company targets and ensure all relevant data bases are maintained with the latest information. You will be a motivated, self-starter who strives to offer solutions and input on process improvements to maximise efficiency within the team, field force and across departments. There will also be an element of administrative support required in the day to day activities of the State Office that you will to support with.

About You:

You should ideally possess the following attributes:

  • Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel including defining & creating formula, macros and pivot tables as well as PowerPoint.
  • Strong analytical ability to proactively identify trends, issues and opportunities and translate these into insightful commercial stories and recommendations
  • Ability to effectively plan, organise and prioritise
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in addition to presentation skills
  • Resilience and initiative, with a ‘can do attitude


The Perks:

If you are successful, you will receive the following:

  • Competitive remuneration package including bonus
  • Above statutory superannuation
  • Company laptop and smart phone
  • Opportunities for regular Learning and Development training

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

(MEL003UX)

As a Business Analyst you are responsible for taking all necessary actions to complete prevention, early detection or resolution activities as per agreed timelines to ensure that Link deliverables to our clients meet each fund specific business rules and product descriptions while Link liabilities are kept to a minimum

Key Accountabilities
  • Design, develop, and execute plans to ensure the quality of products are maintained to the satisfaction of our clients as per each Fund business rules and product descriptions
  • Complete allocated tasks to prevent, early detect and resolve product related complex issues as per the monthly delivery plan agreed with the manager
  • Work closely with the resources within the IT area and deliver cost effective solutions that meet client requirements
  • Review, comment and make necessary changes to product related business requirements / technical solution documents as subject matter expert
  • Contribute to managing product systemic issues assigned by your manager that are identified by operations teams and provide information to CPM / Admin teams for the management of liabilities
  • Maintain a regular communication channel with client SME in regard to product matters and participate in client meetings
  • Prepare monthly reports covering prevention, early detection and resolution of product systemic issues
  • Work with Funds, internal / external auditors in delivering components of audits assigned by the manager.
  • Maintain all work meeting GS007 standards including completion of assigned quality assurance testing and follow ups
The above list of key accountabilities is not an exhaustive list and may change from time-to-time based on business needs.

Ideal Candidate Profile
  • Proven experience in managing complex product related issues liaising with clients, operations teams, and IT resources in the Financial Services or Superannuation industry
  • High levels of technical expertise and ownership to investigate, analyse and resolve detailed and complex product systemic issues
  • Ability to take ownership for delivering solutions that leads to prevention, early detection and resolution of product systemic issues covering all Funds managed by the Fund Administration Division and delivery of solutions with minimum liabilities to Link.
  • Ability to build relationships between teams, departments, units internally and externally to support the achievement of the team and business goals
  • Effective communicator (written and verbal) including ability to communicate complex and detailed information to stakeholders using a variety of methods.
  • Promote a culture of risk awareness and proactive identification of potential issues
  • Ability to plan, organise, prioritise, and deliver meeting deadlines, in a dynamic and fast-paced working environment
  • Ability to make decisions in a timely manner based on the information, experience and skills available
About us
Link Group is one of Australia's leading fund administration and share registry specialists. We are a market leading provider of technology-enabled administration solutions, continually developing our offerings to expand with our clients' needs. Since our inception, Link Group has been entrusted by clients to handle sensitive data in a secure and confidential manner. Our core businesses of fund administration and securities registration are complemented by our expertise in digital solutions and data analytics.

At Link Group we attribute our success to our wonderfully diverse workforce serving our equally diverse clients and members. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunities and welcome all applications including but not limited to LGBTIQ identifying individuals, all ethnic origins, all ages, all disabilities and gender diverse individuals.

Link Group runs a successful and evolving national Corporate Social Responsibility program. Join us in helping those disadvantaged (physically or financially), needing assistance with education, addressing health concerns affecting our society, advancing our Indigenous Australians and migrants and securing our environmental future. Together, we can make positive change locally and internationally.

Candidates must have the relevant work rights to be considered for an opportunity at Link Group. Successful applicants will be required to complete background screening prior to commencement of employment.

Do you have a passion to make a difference and help people get their lives back after injury or illness?

  • Do you have an experience in the workers compensation industry and strong analytical and reporting skills?
  • Provide support and detailed analysis of claims portfolio and guidewire system
  • We help people get their lives back on track after a workplace injury

EML is a leading Workers Compensation Insurance company. We now have over 2000 employees and are still growing which means an amazing and diverse culture with a very high internal promotion rate.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As part of our diverse team based in Sydney CBD , you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.

You will assist to identify and assess risks by working collaboratively with Senior Managers, and key stakeholders to manage key risks and identify corrective and preventative actions that minimise financial, reputational and operational risks to EML.

The role requires a collaborative and consultative approach, working with iCare and business leaders to identify critical issues.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Providing incisive analysis and making recommendations to enhance and improve current claims management processes, and performance.
  • Modelling performance and financial outcomes.
  • Provide assistance to understand claims management practices and emerging experience trends
  • Make recommendations to enhance and improve current processes for data collation and extraction, monitoring and reporting.
  • Deliver detailed analysis of portfolio trends, utilizing information to make strategic decisions

ABOUT YOU

  • Sound knowledge and experience of Workers Compensation Insurance
  • Demonstrated experience in QlikSense / QlikView and SAS highly desirable
  • Data interpretation and visualisation experience.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as in a team
  • Excellent communication and problem solving skills are a must.
  • Must have strong analytical/reporting skills
  • Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline is highly desirable

WHAT WE OFFER

We stand together as equals. EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.

EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including:

  • Onsite Learning and Development Team
  • End of Month Celebration Events
  • 17.5% Annual Leave Loading
  • Free Fruit Boxes
  • Free Onsite Pilates,Yoga and Fitness Classes

We value our people and are committed to supporting our employees by investing in their professional development and providing generous employee benefits. If this is of interest to you, please or for more information/confidential conversation please contact Mary Norouzifar on 0280713623.

And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.

Job no: 500779
Work type: Full Time
Location: Sydney
Categories: Workers Compensation, RTWSS

Do you have a passion to make a difference and help people get their lives back after injury or illness?

  • Do you have an experience in the workers compensation industry and strong analytical and reporting skills?
  • Provide support and detailed analysis of claims portfolio and guidewire system
  • We help people get their lives back on track after a workplace injury

EML is a leading Workers Compensation Insurance company. We now have over 2000 employees and are still growing which means an amazing and diverse culture with a very high internal promotion rate.

THE OPPORTUNITY

As part of our diverse team based in Sydney CBD , you’ll help make a positive impact on someone’s life every day. You’ll feel great satisfaction knowing your talent and hard work has a purpose.

You will assist to identify and assess risks by working collaboratively with Senior Managers, and key stakeholders to manage key risks and identify corrective and preventative actions that minimise financial, reputational and operational risks to EML.

The role requires a collaborative and consultative approach, working with iCare and business leaders to identify critical issues.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Providing incisive analysis and making recommendations to enhance and improve current claims management processes, and performance.
  • Modelling performance and financial outcomes.
  • Provide assistance to understand claims management practices and emerging experience trends
  • Make recommendations to enhance and improve current processes for data collation and extraction, monitoring and reporting.
  • Deliver detailed analysis of portfolio trends, utilizing information to make strategic decisions

ABOUT YOU

  • Sound knowledge and experience of Workers Compensation Insurance
  • Demonstrated experience in QlikSense / QlikView and SAS highly desirable
  • Data interpretation and visualisation experience.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently as well as in a team
  • Excellent communication and problem solving skills are a must.
  • Must have strong analytical/reporting skills
  • Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline is highly desirable

WHAT WE OFFER

We stand together as equals. EML is an equal opportunity employer so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of a culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion. We’re committed to maintaining a workplace where everyone feels valued and where we show respect, integrity and honesty.

EML provides career opportunities and great employee benefits, including:

  • Onsite Learning and Development Team
  • End of Month Celebration Events
  • 17.5% Annual Leave Loading
  • Free Fruit Boxes
  • Free Onsite Pilates,Yoga and Fitness Classes

We value our people and are committed to supporting our employees by investing in their professional development and providing generous employee benefits. If this is of interest to you, please or for more information/confidential conversation please contact Mary Norouzifar on 0280713623.

Advertised: 10 May 2019 AUS Eastern Standard Time
Applications close: 31 May 2019 AUS Eastern Standard Time

Analyst, Business Automation and Integration Domain
Our purpose?
The Business Automation and Integration Domain’s vision is to work with our customers, partners and within ANZ to create commercially viable, open and innovative services that meet evolving needs and contribute to our growth ambitions. We will radically simplify the customer and banker experience through the automation and simplification of key banking processes.

The Document and Knowledge Management Tech area’s mission is to provide the technology platform, services and support that optimises our document and knowledge management platforms, systems and processes to enable digitisation of documents to radically simplify the customer experience. We aim to provide an enterprise and digitised document service to deliver simplified, consolidated systems faster to market for our Customers and Bankers. We drive outcomes that are compliant, stable, repeatable and self-serving.

The journey we are embarking on is focused on Digitising Documents and to provide Document as a Service for the enterprise which covers Document Capture, Document Generation, Document Collaboration and Document Management with Enterprise Search capabilities.

As an Analyst in Business Automation and Integration Domain,you’ll be working as part of a high performing cross-functional team that focuses on Document and Knowledge Management. You will work to deeply understand the business environment to refine requirements to increase the quality and efficiency of the customer outcome being delivered by the Squad and ensure the stability of systems.

For more information about what a day in the life of a Analyst looks like, check out our Analyst Persona or watch this Animation to get an insight in to what a day in their life looks like.

Who are you?
  • A team player – You know we only win if we all win. You recognise and value the different perspectives and skills your colleagues bring. It is not about being a hero but jumping in and contributing to the successful delivery of the team’s mission
  • The customer’s biggest fan – You demonstrate a thirst for better understanding the customer and define the problem and develop solutions through their eyes
  • Comfortable being uncomfortable – You are comfortable with uncertainty and have the ability to effectively manage yourself through ambiguity and change
  • Continuous improvement junkie – You constructively challenge the status quo, look for better ways to do things and passionately advocate continuous improvement
  • Committed to your own and other’s growth – You strive to stretch and grow yourself and others by identifying your own development areas, seeking feedback and providing feedback to others to help them learn and grow everyday
  • A problem solver – You are energised by tackling complex problems and use critical thinking, your network, skills, knowledge, and available data to drive better outcomes for our customers and the bank
  • Risk savvy – You build sustainable solutions that protect customers, stakeholders and the community
What you bring to Document and Knowledge Management team as an Analyst?
  • Experience in one or more Analyst roles previously, EG: Process Analyst, System Analyst, Business Analyst, Data Analyst, Operations Analyst
  • Deep domain and system knowledge to turn customer needs into business requirements and workable technology outcomes
  • Experience in translating requirements into user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Demonstrable experience and understanding of agile development practices, JIRA and Confluence, and Git/Bitbucket or similar distributed source-control systems
  • Knowledge of xPression, Filenet, Datacap and Adobe Lifecycle is desirable
  • Experience with continuous integration/delivery, Cloud and Automation. Tooling such as Git/GitHub, Bamboo/Jenkins, splunk, uDeploy, containerisation etc
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • A desire to continuously learn new techniques / technologies and bring innovative ideas into the Squad
  • Deliver initiative milestones and “own” the impacts to ensure all changes impact customers and frontline staff in a positive way
  • Has a broad understanding of how to apply New Ways of Working to their role
What might a 'day in the life' look like
  • Partnering with the Product Owner, Engineers and other people in your Squad to uncover dependencies and validate boundaries and sequencing of User Stories as well as ensure alignment to value.
  • Collaborates with Product Owners and Engineers to translate business requirements into workable technology outcomes for the Squad
  • Leverage tools for optimal collaboration (across geographies) and knowledge sharing
  • Implements a culture within the Tribe and the Chapter, encouraging best practices around reviews, quality and documentation
  • Building mastery in both the depth and breadth of their capability Design.
  • Creates estimates and continuously reviews demand within the individual Squads
  • Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and implement solutions to perform more effective and efficient analysis
  • Provide ongoing support for the platform as required e.g. problem / incident management
  • Optimize workflow management to ensure traceability back to strategic alignment
  • Verify and validate what is in production (especially after changes)
“We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you."

To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.anz.com/careers. You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for reference number AUS099344

Would you like to work in a dynamic and challenging environment where you will be supported to reach your potential? There are opportunities available for the role of State Business Analyst in Melbourne.

About the Role:


Working within the National Field environment, you will ensure that the accurate analysis of market performance is communicated to State Management. This analysis of statistical data and market information will support the monitoring, planning and development processes of the business in order to achieve sales & marketing objectives.

You will provide the State Management team with regular updates on progress against company targets and ensure all relevant data bases are maintained with the latest information. You will be a motivated, self-starter who strives to offer solutions and input on process improvements to maximise efficiency within the team, field force and across departments. There will also be an element of administrative support required in the day to day activities of the State Office that you will to support with.

About You:

You should ideally possess the following attributes:

  • Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel including defining & creating formula, macros and pivot tables as well as PowerPoint.
  • Strong analytical ability to proactively identify trends, issues and opportunities and translate these into insightful commercial stories and recommendations
  • Ability to effectively plan, organise and prioritise
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in addition to presentation skills
  • Resilience and initiative, with a ‘can do attitude


The Perks:

If you are successful, you will receive the following:

  • Competitive remuneration package including bonus
  • Above statutory superannuation
  • Company laptop and smart phone
  • Opportunities for regular Learning and Development training

British American Tobacco is all about freedom of choice — whether it’s our people or our products. Combined with our entrepreneurial spirit, it’s what’s driven our phenomenal success. We started trading tobacco over a hundred years ago. Today, we’re a multibillion dollar company with more than 200 brands in our portfolio. With robust positions in each of our regional markets, our future looks equally bright too.

There’s no doubt our industry is controversial — we’re the first to admit that. But rest assured, we take a responsible approach to our trade. In our market, we observe every law and regulation regarding tobacco (in many cases going further through our own voluntary code). Not only that, we treat our Global farmers fairly, invest in the environment and help to sustain local communities.

We also excel at developing our own people into leaders of the future. As a firm with a high-performance culture, we’ll expect a lot from you. But we’ll support you every step of the way to help you deliver. If you’re passionate and ambitious, rapid career progression is a reality here. And because we’re such a large firm (we employ more than 55,000 people worldwide), there are plenty of exciting opportunities for you to develop a truly extraordinary career.
